story:
Hello! My name is Nikki. I am working with a team of amazing individuals (2011 Underground Music Award winner J-Clash and writer/actor/director Tommie Sox) in hopes that you too will want to extend a helping hand in creating and featuring a compelling music video tribute to our soldiers home and abroad! We have taken a mini mountain of chicken scratch and compiled it into a video idea for the artist's song "When You Come Home."

The idea behind this video will not only shed light on the camaraderie between soldiers during a time of war.. but more importantly the loyalty that they take with them when they return home and how it impacts their everyday lives. The video concept we have come up with will not only move the viewer.. but will really make them THINK and pay attention to all of the chaos that is going on and poses the question.. "What would YOU do?"

Any donations up to the $3,000 goal will be used for the creation of the video for "When You Come Home." This includes paying the actors, rental fees for space used to shoot the video, production and editing costs, wardrobe for the actors and actresses, special effects/props and makeup.

Any donations after the $3,000 goal will be put towards featuring the video on WorldStar, the internet's most well known music video website. The cost of the main feature on WorldStar is exactly $4,000. If the goal is NOT met we will choose a lesser feature option that ranges from $650-$3,000.

Help us by sharing this link and emailing it to your friends, blasting it out on your facebook/twitter and spreading the word!

Check out more work from J-CLASH!

Requiem For A Dream Video - Occupy Wall Street Footage:
http://youtu.be/Hpx8MOLViuk

Dreaming Song:
http://snd.sc/rPTkaT

Fly With The Angels Song:
http://snd.sc/slkJ38

If you have any questions feel free to email me at MsNicoleChristie@aol.com

story:
Short Summary

We are Malice and Mario Sweet. We are a married couple from Seattle, Washington who share our love for each other and others through music. You may have heard of us or seen us perform with our band The Physics. You also may have heard our first studio album called Happy 2 Year. We are truly humbled by the success of our first album and we never imagined that a project we started in our living room could get airplay across the globe! 

We are very anxious to drop a new studio album and have been working for over a year on our new project. We are calling it Enjoy:Like:Love. In essence, it is an elaboration of Happy 2 Year, but it will take you on a more intricate musical journey. We are calling it Enjoy:Like:Love because we believe you are going to Enjoy this album for it's positivity and soulful melodies. We also believe you are going to Like this album, possibly enough to share it with a loved one or a friend. But we strive to make you Love this album because it was made out of love for the lover in all of us. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We believe that our financial goal of $3000 will sufficiently fund the project.

We also believe that 45 days is the appropriate amount of time to raise these funds.

Every dollar contributed to this campaign will go to financing studio sessions, and the mixing and mastering of the album.

$3000 is all that is standing in between us releasing this album to the world.

We also believe that the awesome folks that contribute to this campaign should get something in return so they know how much we appreciate their support! 

Every single person who contributes to our campaign will receive an incentive: anything from free music downloads, an invite to our exclusive album release party, an original chorus from us, and many other additional incentives.

Although we have faith that we will reach our goal- we will not be deterred if this goal is not fully attained. We are releasing this album no matter what!

 

The Impact

We never imagined that people would gravitate to our music the way they have thus far. We think we have something special which is why it would mean the world to us to complete this album in 2013. 2013 is not only going to be a special year for music,  but we are also expecting a baby in July! We would be soo proud to be able to not only share new music but new life with the world! Come be a part of our journey!

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand if you can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

You can help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by word of mouth and through you social networking sites. The more people that know about our campaign and our music- the better!

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools as well!

And that’s all there is to it. In closing, thank you in advance for all of your help and for believing in us and our music. Let's reach this goal and keep indie music alive!

Sincerely,

The Sweets

story:
Esme Barrera was a fixture in Austin’s underground music community - a bighearted music fan, a record store clerk, a Girls Rock Austin volunteer, a video star, and a ball of light and positivity to everyone she came in contact with. She was also a student, a special needs teaching assistant, and a devoted daughter and sister. After her tragic death on New Year's Day 2012, almost forty of Austin's finest female musicians (and Esme’s fellow Girls Rock Austin volunteers) came together to perform The Rolling Stones’ “She's A Rainbow” at her Austin memorial. The song was then recorded with the generous help of Benjamin Hotchkiss and Kyle Crusham at Tequila Mockingbird.


A year and a half later, Esme's friends, coworkers, family, students, and campers still feel her loss--but her colorful energy continues to radiate throughout the community. The recording of “She’s a Rainbow” captures Esme’s beautiful spirit and helps it live on for the world to experience through Esme’s favorite medium - records! Specifically, red vinyl 45s! Digital downloads are also available for the turntable deprived.

Your donation will help fund the production of “She’s a Rainbow” 7" records and jackets, performed by the Esme Barerra Fan Club, and fund scholarships for girls to participate in Girls Rock Austin music programs.

Esme inspired people far and wide, and many others have written about her. Read Summer Anne Burton’s moving tribute “The year without Esme” on Buzzfeed. The Austin Chronicle and the Austin American Statesman also wrote eloquently about Esme.

We’re excited to offer this as a community project - and we want you to join us and help us get the record out. We believe in the power of the individual to make a difference and in the power of the collective to have an even greater impact. We are stronger together and we want to do this with you!

 

Ultimate Campaign Goal: $5950

$2000* - Record pressing, jacket printing, promotion and distribution of records.

$3950 will go directly into the Esme Barrera Unlimited Possibilities Scholarship Fund to provide full Girls Rock Austin scholarships to 10 girls who otherwise wouldn't be able to afford to go to an empowering music education program like this. Full fare girls rock camp tuition is $395. GRA aims to provides scholarships to half our campers. This summer, our four camps will serve almost one hundred eighty girls. That’s almost ninety girls that will have a Girls Rock experience thanks to this fund.

Any money raised beyond this campaign’s goal will provide more opportunities for girls in need.  

NOTE: Most music camps are for-profit, costing 2-3 times as much as GRA's programs and often teach students to play cover songs instead of encouraging students to experience the thrill of writing their own original material. The B-side of "She's a Rainbow" will feature an original song about Esme composed and performed by former Girls Rock Camper, Christina Arellano.

 

What You Get For Participating  

Depending on your level of donation, you'll get to experience the amazing recording of the Esme Barrera Fan Club performing “She’s a Rainbow,” backed with Christina Arellano’s “For Esme,” and special Girls Rock Austin events and merchandise.  Your contribution will be tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law. The record release party will be held at the Spiderhouse Ballroom on August 4th, 2013, from 4-8pm to commemorate Esme's birthday.  Some of Esme’s favorite Austin bands will be performing as well as Girls Rock Camper bands. Copies of the 7-inch will be available for sale and pick-up at the event.

*Admission is subject to capacity of the venue. First come, first served.
**For Austin residents, records will be available for pick up at the release party or at Waterloo Records for a limited time following the event. Non-local orders will be mailed. Please allow for extra shipping charges for deliveries outside of the contiguous 48 US states. 

Contact us at gra.rainbow@gmail.com to request mailing, or if you have any questions about this campaign.

 

The Impact You'll Have

Esme was passionate about Girls Rock Austin, and we strive to keep her name and memory alive by providing a safe space for girls from all backgrounds to develop their own musical and personal voices. This scholarship helps bring kids to camp, many of whom wouldn't otherwise be able to afford to come. Our programs provide music instruction, a variety of workshops, and performances by local bands in a positive, all-female environment. Leadership opportunities are provided for campers to build self-esteem, increase self-efficacy, and find their own voices through a collaborative and supportive creative process. We are a nonprofit dedicated to building a community of empowered girls and women, who have the confidence to pursue their goals any field.

Here are a few highlights of our accomplishments over the years:

  • 100 to 120 girls aged 10-17 have attended Girls Rock Camp here in Austin every summer since 2008.  Not counting returning campers, we have served over 350 girls.

  • Nearly half of the girls who attend Girls Rock Camp have done so on full or partial scholarship, and affording this expense is the bulk of our fundraising activity.  We are the only rock camp in Austin with a mission to serve girls from low-income backgrounds.

  • GRA has been partnering with the Settlement Home for Children since 2011, and last summer we enabled 9 girls in residential foster care to attend the camp entirely for free.  This year we will serve 12 girls from the Settlement Home for Children.

  • The annual Ladies Rock Camp program provides a venue for women to experience the joys of rock camp while raising scholarship funds for girls.  We have provided an empowering experience to 60+ women aged 18-88 through Ladies Rock Camp.

  • GRA has been backed by community and business sponsorships, allowing us to broaden our reach and provide top-notch programming to more girls.  We have been awarded grants by the City of Austin Cultural Arts Division and Texas Commission on the Arts, and received corporate support from Maurice's, SXSW, and Guitar Center.  

Our goals for 2013 include:

  • Increasing camp to three summer sessions to meet the growing demand for girls ages 10 to 17, and establishing a new program for girls ages 7 to 9.  This summer, we will serve nearly 180 girls.

  • Exploring options for after-school programming in the Fall semester, and continuing to expand our outreach and partnerships with other organizations to make this growth possible.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign! Facebook, tweet, pin, tumble, email, and call your friends on tin cans! Tell them about this amazing person, and how they can keep her memory alive and support Girls Rock Austin.

We understand if money is not the best way for you to contribute.  There are still a lot of ways you can get involved with the girls rock camp movement and help to support Esme's legacy of community involvement.  We have a record of four camp sessions this summer, twice as much we normally have! Girls Rock Austin depends on the hard work, advice, and support of many individual volunteers, donors, and business sponsors. Volunteers are essential to both the existence and the spirit of our nonprofit camps, and music experience is not necessary for all positions. Check out the webpage for volunteer opportunities: www.girlsrockaustin.org.

Thank you!

*Special thanks to Chicago Mastering Servicefor generously donating mastering service and to Gerard Cosloy at Matador Records and 12XU Records and Richard Lynn at Super Secret Records for their help.

story:
Voices from Russia

Scottish singer, songwriter and translator Tommy Beavitt will record the album ‘Voices from Russia’ with prominent Scottish folk musicians including Toby Shippey (Salsa Celtica, Whisky River Band) John Somerville and Adam Sutherland (Treacherous Orchestra, Babelfish).

This album will be the culmination of 5 years of creative work involving Scottish singer, songwriter and translator Tommy Beavitt, Russian poets and translators including Boris Petrov, Misha Feygin, Alexander Zyryanov, Vadim Astrakhan and Irina Golovina as well as painters John Mikietyn, Vicky Stonebridge, Frank McNab and Andrey Eletsky.

The collaborations continue to take place under the auspices of the Global Village Bards (Scotland, international) project working together with other organisations such as the Ural-Scottish Society (Ekaterinburg) and Veresk (Moscow).

Starting from the coincidence of the joint birthdays of bards Robbie Burns and Vladimir Vysotsky on 25th January, this project has produced new translations of Burns into Russian, new translations of Vysotsky into English and a significant number of completely new songs, many of them based around paintings by the visual artists involved.

The key idea behind the project is that VOICES, if authentically developed, can transmit across national, cultural and even linguistic barriers.

Thus:

  • 'Stranger in Paradise', written by Tommy Beavitt in his early 20s after reading the Russian novel 'Master and Margarita', is given a new dimension in Misha Feygin's masterful translation Чужой в рай
  • Vladimir Vysotsky's transposition of mediaeval English archers' urge to throw off the chains of their thraldom into the late Soviet Russian context is re-adapted into the conditions of  Anglophone late capitalism in Beavitt's collaboration with New York-based Vadim Astrakhan 
  • Георгий Победоносец, Boris Petrov's Eurasian paean to St. George becomes an invocation of England's patron saint at a time of need in Beavitt's translation 'St. George, Arise!'; with the addition of a female chorus, an international peace anthem
  • The lusty voices of British privateers are artfully captured from Frank McNab's painting by Professor Alexander Ziryanov's Russian poem Кариатида and then retransformed back into British English in Beavitt's translation and song 'Caryatida (floozy on a ship)'
  • The voice of the rebellious lone wolf in Vysotsky's classic 1968 Soviet protest song Охота на волков is blended with that of his gentrified persecutors by Beavitt – who was born in that same year of global revolution – to create a red-hot political invective for a post-crisis global capitalist world under the title 'Who'll come a hunting for the wolf'
  • The voice associated with the figure of St. Andrew, patron of both Scotland and Russia, is channeled by Petrov from a painting by Andrey Eletsky into the poem Андрей Первозванный and into the Scottish independence anthem 'On the Saltire Cross' by Beavitt
  • The voice of the Russian soldier who misses his fallen in action comrade in Vysotsky’s Он не вернулся из боя is transposed into any number of possible contexts (e.g. Afghanistan etc.) in Beavitt’s collaborative translation with Misha Feygin ‘He hasn’t returned from the battle’.
  • The voice of the internationalised emigrant Scot, known the world over from the Burns song 'Auld Lang Syne', bubbles up with renewed vigour into Zyryanov's poem В кругу друзей and on into Beavitt's song 'Old comrades circle' 

 

The English-language album ‘Voices from Russia’ will be recorded alongside its Russian-language ‘sister album’ Голоса нетуманного Альбиона, which will however be separately funded. However, English-speaking sponsors of the English-language album will also receive copies of the Russian-language recordings and vice versa.

While some songs will appear only in one language (i.e. Vysotsky songs will only be recorded in English translated form and Burns' songs will only be performed in the new translated Russian versions), many of the new songs on this album will appear in both Russian and English versions. By allowing listeners to compare the same voice accompanied by the same music – but in different languages – this is potentially a great way to facilitate language learning and cultural appreciation – in both directions!

For this to happen, we need to create a concentrated space for musicians to work in

While a lot of the creative effort behind this project has already taken place, in order to get professional musicians together in one room, holding their instruments and ready to commit their creative energy to this project, we need a budget!

  • We need to pay for accommodation, food, drink and a sound engineer for a week
  • Like any other professionals, musicians need to be paid! This is not just a moral consideration but also a practical one – without a budget, this project will not happen when we need it to happen!
  • The result of the project will be high quality recordings that may go on to form a concrete, valuable and lasting relationship between Russia and Scotland! By supporting this project, you will be part of that relationship!
  • You will also receive high quality digital copies of the musical recordings produced and an e-booklet describing the project, the places and the artists involved, texts and images and the names, logos etc. of all sponsors
  • The twin albums will only be released, in Scotland, Russia and elsewhere, once all the relevant permissions have been agreed and a distribution deal negotiated.
  • By supporting the project as a private sponsor, you will jump the queue and receive personal copies of the recordings as soon as the work is completed!
  • By supporting the project as an organisation or corporate sponsor you will get your name/logo on all subsequent printed and digital communications associated with this project and the released material.
  • Or, by supporting the project as a main sponsor, you could be the beneficiary of any ensuing distribution deals!

 

Past, Present and Future collaborations

Global Village Bards is committed to the facilitation of future collaborations involving singers, translators, poets, songwriters, artists and international cultural actors. This album will establish the path towards many future endeavours that will create opportunities for artists and culture workers in Scotland, Russia and elsewhere. Its high quality and accessible musical and lyrical output will prove the concept of the collaboration approach taken. 

  • International collaborative projects like this have the potential to literally ‘create a better world’, in which there is less violence, more understanding and cooperation and a greater flow of cultural energy between the different countries, groups and individuals involved
  • During the recording process, there will be extensive engagement within and without the small community of Scoraig, including involving local children, youths and amateur musicians. The week will culminate in a concert / ceilidh at which many different people will be brought together.
  • The recording project will create a lasting memorial to the five years of existing collaborations between Scotland and Russia via the Global Village Bards Project
  • Without your help it won't happen! If you can't support it financially yourself, please consider mentioning it to colleagues or posting a link on your social networks!

The lusty voices of British privateers are artfully captured from Frank McNab's painting by Professor Alexander Ziryanov's Russian poem Кариатида and then retransformed back into British English in Beavitt's translation and song 'Caryatida (floozy on a ship)'
The voice of the rebellious lone wolf in Vysotsky's classic 1968 Soviet protest song Охота на волков is blended with that of his gentrified persecutors by Beavitt – who was born in that same year of global revolution – to create a red-hot political invective for a post-crisis global capitalist world under the title 'Who'll come a hunting for the wolf'
The voice associated with the figure of St. Andrew, patron of both Scotland and Russia, is channeled by Petrov from a painting by Andrey Eletsky into the poem Андрей Первозванный and into the Scottish independence anthem 'On the Saltire Cross' by Beavitt
The voice of the Russian soldier who misses his fallen in action comrade in Vysotsky’s Он не вернулся из боя is transposed into any number of possible contexts (e.g. Afghanistan etc.) in Beavitt’s collaborative translation with Misha Feygin ‘He hasn’t returned from the battle’.
The voice of the internationalised emigrant Scot, known the world over from the Burns song 'Auld Lang Syne', bubbles up with renewed vigour into Zyryanov's poem В кругу друзей and on into Beavitt's song 'Old comrades circle' 
 
The English-language album ‘Voices from Russia’ will be recorded alongside its Russian-language ‘sister album’ Голоса нетуманного Альбиона, which will however be separately funded. However, English-speaking sponsors of the English-language album will also receive copies of the Russian-language recordings and vice versa.
While some songs will appear only in one language (i.e. Vysotsky songs will only be recorded in English translated form and Burns' songs will only be performed in the new translated Russian versions), many of the new songs on this album will appear in both Russian and English versions. By allowing listeners to compare the same voice accompanied by the same music – but in different languages – this is potentially a great way to facilitate language learning and cultural appreciation – in both directions!
For this to happen, we need to create a concentrated space for musicians to work in
While a lot of the creative effort behind this project has already taken place, in order to get professional musicians together in one room, holding their instruments and ready to commit their creative energy to this project, we need a budget!

We need to pay for accommodation, food, drink and a sound engineer for a week
Like any other professionals, musicians need to be paid! This is not just a moral consideration but also a practical one – without a budget, this project will not happen when we need it to happen!
The result of the project will be high quality recordings that may go on to form a concrete, valuable and lasting relationship between Russia and Scotland! By supporting this project, you will be part of that relationship!
You will also receive high quality digital copies of the musical recordings produced and an e-booklet describing the project, the places and the artists involved, texts and images and the names, logos etc. of all sponsors
The twin albums will only be released, in Scotland, Russia and elsewhere, once all the relevant permissions have been agreed and a distribution deal negotiated.
By supporting the project as a private sponsor, you will jump the queue and receive personal copies of the recordings as soon as the work is completed!
By supporting the project as an organisation or corporate sponsor you will get your name/logo on all subsequent printed and digital communications associated with this project and the released material.
Or, by supporting the project as a main sponsor, you could be the beneficiary of any ensuing distribution deals!
 
Past, Present and Future collaborations
Global Village Bards is committed to the facilitation of future collaborations involving singers, translators, poets, songwriters, artists and international cultural actors. This album will establish the path towards many future endeavours that will create opportunities for artists and culture workers in Scotland, Russia and elsewhere. Its high quality and accessible musical and lyrical output will prove the concept of the collaboration approach taken. 

International collaborative projects like this have the potential to literally ‘create a better world’, in which there is less violence, more understanding and cooperation and a greater flow of cultural energy between the different countries, groups and individuals involved
During the recording process, there will be extensive engagement within and without the small community of Scoraig, including involving local children, youths and amateur musicians. The week will culminate in a concert / ceilidh at which many different people will be brought together.
The recording project will create a lasting memorial to the five years of existing collaborations between Scotland and Russia via the Global Village Bards Project
Without your help it won't happen! If you can't support it financially yourself, please consider mentioning it to colleagues or posting a link on your social networks!

story:
Who

Commnunity Vision Fellowship is a small- but growing- church located in Duross Heights, New Castle, Delaware. We are part of the Church of God of Prophecy. We are also home to a very active youth group, and a rapidly expanding music program. Our youth group caters to underprivleged kids, and the music program is open to anyone. We offer lessons in guitar, bass, drums, and music theory; we're also building a new church band with the goal of playing out at youth rallies and benefit concerts. Our goal is to offer a comprehensive music education program; classes will be offered free of charge and anyone who wants to perform will get their chance.

What

We have a clear goal of what we need and how the funds will be spent:

- One thousand dollars will be put towards a new guitar rig. This includes a new amplifier and speaker cabinet, effect pedals, and audio cables.

-Another thousand dollars will be put towards a new bass rig. This includes a new amplifier and speaker cabinet, effect pedals, and audio cables.

-The last thousand will be used for instrument upkeep, upgrades, and repairs. At the time this is is being written, the church owns two electric guitars, two basses, two acoustics, and a drum kit all in need of various parts. Some of this funding will be used to buy new hardware, electronics, and drums. The rest of it will go towards picks, strings, spare audio cables, power supplies, and drumsticks; tools we're always in need of. Indiegogo's 4% will come out of this part of the budget.

-If we surpass our goal, the extra funds will go towards further upgrading our sound system. This includes mics, mixing boards, audio cables, and the like. If we surpass the goal by enough, we could even purchase more instruments. This is all icing on the cake though, the main focus is giving the kids more to work with.

-In the event that we do not reach our goal, the funds will be used to repair and upgrade what we have. How much we can do depends on how much we bring in.

We are more than capable of repairing and upgrading used gear, so every effort will be made to spend the money wisely. 

 

Why

Music is proven to improve the lives of kids. Music teaches focus, teamwork, creativity, confidence, and improves both math and language skills. The music programs in public schools all over are being cut, and it's up to local communities to pick up the slack. With your help, we could give underprivleged kids the chance to play in a band that goes well beyond their church. Everyone knows how hard growing up can be, and everyone knows the power and magic of music. Let's use the latter to make the former a little easier.

 

Spread the word!

Share this all over! The more people that see this, the more likely it is that they'll donate, the more money we'll raise, the more we can accomplish. We have the oppurtunity to not only improve the lives of these children, but also to enrich the local comunity as a whole.

story:
The Pitch

 Hey Folks,

I'm here on IndieGoGo to ask for your help to fund a Song-Book for my best-selling album, "Well, Well,' Said the Rocking Chair'.

The album contains top-40 hits like, 'Lydia' and 'Lucky Stars' as well as fan-favorites such as, 'The Deli Song', 'S&M', 'Shopping Bag Ladies', 'Rocking Chair' and more.

For years now, folks have been asking me to produce a song-book and sheet-music for "Well, Well,' Said the Rocking Chair' and my only excuse has been that (a) it's a huge amount of time-consuming work and (b) it's actually quite expensive. Transcribing the music, creating the scores, graphic-layout and design and finally manufacturing, are each time-intensive and costly steps which 'til now I've never been able to find the time or resources to tackle.

I've decided to wait no longer.

But it will only be possible with your help.

The main-stream music-biz isn't going to do it, I can't do it on my own, but with your support I can have Dean Friedman's "Well, Well," Said the Rocking Chair' Song-Book for Piano & Guitar ready to ship by the new year (and possibly even by the upcoming holidays).

By the way, this is intended as a 'stretch' campaign, which means, if I succeed in raising the initial funds necessary to produce a "Well, Well," Said the Rocking Chair' Song-Book, each additional 5k raised will enable me to produce another song-book for each subsequent album: 'Rumpled Romeo', 'Songs for Grownups', 'The Treehouse Journals', 'Squirrels in the Attic', and 'Submarine Races'. [note: I still don't own the rights to my first album, 'Dean Friedman', so, I'm afraid that one will have to wait - for now.] Again, it's a huge job to even consider producing all these song-books. But with your help - it can actually get done. 

Years ago - in fact many years before crowdfunding sites like IndieGoGo and Kickstarter even existed - I sent an email to everyone on my email list asking for help to fund a new album. You came through in a big way and made 'The Treehouse Journals' possible. You did it again for my last two albums, 'Squirrels in the Attic' and 'Submarine Races'. Those albums simply wouldn't exist without your belief and support!

I realize not everyone out there plays an instrument or sings, but I'm hoping enough of you do - or have friends or family that would enjoy receiving this Song-Book as a gift, or would simply like to support my ongoing musical efforts - to succeed in funding this IndieGoGo crowd-funding campaign.

As always, thanks for listening, thanks for all your support and thanks for making all this music possible. If it weren't for your support, over the years, I'd probably be selling wind-mills or solar-panels or electric cars or light-caps with little LED's, or something. Not a bad idea, actually. But I digress. ;-)

Anyway, what I mean to say is... you guys are the best! And I hope this new project is one that strikes a chord with you. And if you're not sure exactly what that chord is, you'll find it in one of these songs-books, which hopefully, you'll help fund in this IndieGoGO campaign.

Nuts & Bolts

If I succeed in raising full 5k, here's what'll happen next:

Step 1:  I'll immediately sit down with a couple of hand-picked transcribers/orchestraters, well-versed in professional notation/scoring software.

Step 2: I'll bring in a graphic-designer to integrate the actual scores into a song-book featuring piano and guitar parts for each song on the album(s).

Step 3: I'll send the final book files to a manufacturer to print up at least 1,000+ copies of the song-book.

Step 4: I'll enlist a group of family, friends and wildlife to pack-up, label and affix postage to all those books and proceed to ship 'em - along with assorted 'perks' listed below - to you good folk! Oh, yeah!, I almost forgot about those perks! You don't think I'd be asking folks for oodles of money and offering nothing in return. No way! Check out the long list of amazing perks I've put together, which you'll receive in return for your generous support. Go ahead, check 'em out. Yeah! Pretty impressive, huh?! So, anyway, once you've all received your cool perks...

Step 5: I will sit back and smile in gratitude at your generosity and support and at the awesomeness of crowd-funding in this strange and bewildering digital age.

And as I mentioned, earlier, if I do succeed in raising the initial funds to produce a Song-Book for "Well, Well,' Said the Rocking Chair', every additional 5k I raise will go towards producing a new Song-Book for each successive album. That would mean a Song-Book each for 'Rumpled Romeo', 'Songs for Grownups', 'The Treehouse Journals', 'Squirrels in the Attic', and 'Submarine Races'.  Maybe that's overly optimistic, but hey, you never know.

The Radical and Subversive Impact of Crowdfunding

And here's the thing, folks. don't forget, if I'm actually able to pull this off, it will be only because you guys decided it was worth doing. You didn't leave the decision up to some multinational conglomerate, or non-musical bean-counter... I mean not that I have anything against bean counters. Or beans, for that matter. I like beans. And I like bean counters too. I'm sure they're all decent people with, you known, lovely families. It's just, maybe they shouldn't be the ones in charge of deciding what music you get to hear and what song-books you get to enjoy.  

Anyway, here's the point...

Every time a crowd-funding music project is successful - or any crowdfunding project, for that matter - it represents a small victory for independent musicians, and artists and entrepreneurs of every ilk, over a broken and increasingly irrelevant system of gatekeepers who tightly restrict access between an artist and their audience - and that would be you, the audience, the folks who all this music is meant for! 

Anyway, if it works, that'll be cool! And if it doesn't, well you know... 'Light Caps'. I use mine every day, to take out the garbage, change a fuse. It's great for reading in bed. Anyway, it's just an option.

Other Ways You Can Help

Meanwhile, as most of you know, I'm currently in the middle of another 40plus city UK/Ireland tour. So, if for some reason, a Dean Friedman song-book doesn't tickle your fancy, you can still support my musical efforts by buying a ticket to one of the upcoming gigs, or, hey, you could always order one my albums - CD or downloads - via my website www.DeanFriedman.com. It all helps make it possible for me to continue to pursue my music, all while keeping the electricity turned on in my recording studio.

Thanks for listening - and watching - and I hope to see some of you folks on the upcoming tour!

Yours,

Dean

story:
Jimi Hendrix is one of the most influencial and pioneering musicians of our time. Most of us never had the opportunity to experience Jimi Hendrix before his untimely death in 1970. With your help, Gab Guma and the Gypsy Eyes will bring you a taste of what that experience was like.

Gab was only thirteen when he first heard the music of Jimi Hendrix, which was a defining moment in his life. Jimi quickly became a huge influence on Gab's playing and overall artistic growth. Since he was fifteen years old people that heard and saw Gab play seemed to always make some general comparisons between him and Jimi. Gab, who also plays mainly Fender Stratocaster guitars, spent many of his formative years learning Jimi's techniques, tricks, as well as performance and writing style. Gab always related to Jimi since they both share a love for the guitar, showmanship, spirituality, and freedom, as well as both displaying a trademark afro. Now Gab Guma, along with bassist Aaron White, and drummer, Jay Yachetta, is delighted to finally pay true homage to Jimi Hendrix and bring his tribute show to audiences around the world. 

Funds received will go towards the following:

  • Live audio and video recording
  • Completion of Live DVD


Other Ways You Can Help:

We understand if you do not have the means to help us financially, however, you can still help us out  by doing the following:

Share this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, or other social media account. There are special "share" buttons at the bottom of this page to help you do so!

Spread the word by sending emails to your network of people.

Word of mouth - simply talking about this fundraiser can help us reach our goals. 

Thank you for taking the time to check out our campaign and thanks for all your help!

story:
THANK YOU SO MUCH TO EVERYONE WHO DONATED! If you're looking at this site now, the Indiegogo campaign has ended, but you can still donate! I won't be in the studio until Monday, July 15th, so we have until then to raise all the funds! If you feel led to donate, please contact me @ jessicahoover22@outlook.com or send a check to:

Whitecell Productions- P.O. Box 638, Elk Rapids, MI 49629 

THANK YOU AGAIN! :)

Short-ish Summary

Why hello there! My name is Jessica Hoover and I'm a singer-songwriter from Northern Michigan. I've been playing different instruments and singing since I was a young pup, and was then struck by the songwriting bug about ten years ago, and I've been loving it ever since.

To tell you a very brief version of my life this past year, I had an accident at work where I suffered a severe head trauma in December 2012. This caused me to lose my memory, forcing me to relearn almost everything. Then on the last day of February 2013, many memories came flooding back. Recovery has been a long and winding road, but I'm so thankful to be alive and to have an amazing support system of family, friends, and my local church.

This EP is personal. These songs display the different emotions we feel when going through the things that life throws our way. Joy, love, longing, loneliness, aching, sorrow, and eventually a peace that passes understanding. 

The biggest thing is... I HAVE A DEADLINE! But an awesome one! Because... drumroll please...

I'm playing in a HUGE festival in Traverse City Labor Day weekend (Bayside Festival), and I'll be opening for TENTH AVENUE NORTH! Whaaat! Yes. Are you excited? I'm excited. So I need the CDs ready to go by then! And to do that, I need to be in the studio ASAP!

I have an amazing Producer, Brian Whitscell (More Jesus), who will be leading this project. He loves these songs just as much as I do, and this guy is a big deal (but seriously the most humble person you'll ever meet). No really. If you haven't heard of the More Jesus campaign, Google it, and you will find that Brian has been on some of the Christian music charts for the past several weeks!!! 

What We Need 

I am doing all of the recording and mixing here in the beautiful and resourceful land of Traverse City, Michigan. Some will be at Rolling Thunder Studios, some will be in a house. This is a very low budget project, so we're trying to save money wherever possible. Your money will be going toward:

  • Studio Time
  • Musicians
  • 3 Songs (there will be 4 on the EP)
  • Making the actual CD's
  • Mixing & Mastering

And if we go over the $3,000 goal (which would be AMAZING!), it would go toward:

  • Paying my Producer Brian for all of his hard work on this album
  • A music video for a song on the album 
  • Equipment or merchandise for the festival & beyond
  • A tour bus (hey, I'm thinking big here) ;)

The Impact

There's only one way to put this: I'm crazy about Jesus. Even when I lost my memory, I knew who my Lord and Savior Jesus Christ was. He has never left my side, even when going through my darkest moments. I want to honor Him with the talents He has given me, and I want to love His people. The Lord has allowed me to experience so much in such a short period of time, but I have never felt more clear on what I want to do with my life. I want to love others the way Christ loves us, and I want to encourage you and worship the King of Kings with you. This album is just the first step. I want you to partner in this ministry with me!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

PRAYER! Pray pray pray. Please pray that the Lord abundantly provides for this project, and that the Lord will absolutely bless the Bayside Festival at the end of August. Pray that the Lord will continuously inspire Brian, the musicians, and I as we are recording this album. 

SPREAD THE WORD! :] Send this to everyone you know. We've gotta get this thing funded in 7 days!

If you feel more comfortable sending a check, please do so! :] Details below:

  • Please make checks payable to: Whitecell Productions
  • Please send checks to: P.O. Box 638, Elk Rapids, MI 49629

You are loved, you are appreciated, you are prayed for. 

Links

Facebook: www.facebook.com/jessicahooversings

Website: http://jessicahoover22.wix.com/music 

Twitter: www.twitter.com/jessicahoover22

Brian's Facebook: www.facebook.com/BrianWhitscellMusic

Contact: jessicahoover22@outlook.com

I won't be in the studio until Monday, July 15th, so we have until then to raise all the funds! If you feel led to donate, please contact me @ jessicahoover22@outlook.com or send a check to:
Whitecell Productions- P.O. Box 638, Elk Rapids, MI 49629 
THANK YOU AGAIN! :)
Short-ish Summary
Why hello there! My name is Jessica Hoover and I'm a singer-songwriter from Northern Michigan. I've been playing different instruments and singing since I was a young pup, and was then struck by the songwriting bug about ten years ago, and I've been loving it ever since.
To tell you a very brief version of my life this past year, I had an accident at work where I suffered a severe head trauma in December 2012. This caused me to lose my memory, forcing me to relearn almost everything. Then on the last day of February 2013, many memories came flooding back. Recovery has been a long and winding road, but I'm so thankful to be alive and to have an amazing support system of family, friends, and my local church.
This EP is personal. These songs display the different emotions we feel when going through the things that life throws our way. Joy, love, longing, loneliness, aching, sorrow, and eventually a peace that passes understanding. 
The biggest thing is... I HAVE A DEADLINE! But an awesome one! Because... drumroll please...
I'm playing in a HUGE festival in Traverse City Labor Day weekend (Bayside Festival), and I'll be opening for TENTH AVENUE NORTH! Whaaat! Yes. Are you excited? I'm excited. So I need the CDs ready to go by then! And to do that, I need to be in the studio ASAP!
I have an amazing Producer, Brian Whitscell (More Jesus), who will be leading this project. He loves these songs just as much as I do, and this guy is a big deal (but seriously the most humble person you'll ever meet). No really. If you haven't heard of the More Jesus campaign, Google it, and you will find that Brian has been on some of the Christian music charts for the past several weeks!!! 
What We Need 


I am doing all of the recording and mixing here in the beautiful and resourceful land of Traverse City, Michigan. Some will be at Rolling Thunder Studios, some will be in a house. This is a very low budget project, so we're trying to save money wherever possible. Your money will be going toward:

Studio Time
Musicians
3 Songs (there will be 4 on the EP)
Making the actual CD's
Mixing & Mastering

And if we go over the $3,000 goal (which would be AMAZING!), it would go toward:

Paying my Producer Brian for all of his hard work on this album
A music video for a song on the album 
Equipment or merchandise for the festival & beyond
A tour bus (hey, I'm thinking big here) ;)



The Impact
There's only one way to put this: I'm crazy about Jesus. Even when I lost my memory, I knew who my Lord and Savior Jesus Christ was. He has never left my side, even when going through my darkest moments. I want to honor Him with the talents He has given me, and I want to love His people. The Lord has allowed me to experience so much in such a short period of time, but I have never felt more clear on what I want to do with my life. I want to love others the way Christ loves us, and I want to encourage you and worship the King of Kings with you. This album is just the first step. I want you to partner in this ministry with me!!!


Other Ways You Can Help
PRAYER! Pray pray pray. Please pray that the Lord abundantly provides for this project, and that the Lord will absolutely bless the Bayside Festival at the end of August. Pray that the Lord will continuously inspire Brian, the musicians, and I as we are recording this album. 
SPREAD THE WORD! :] Send this to everyone you know. We've gotta get this thing funded in 7 days!
If you feel more comfortable sending a check, please do so! :] Details below:


Please make checks payable to: Whitecell Productions

Please send checks to: P.O. Box 638, Elk Rapids, MI 49629

You are loved, you are appreciated, you are prayed for. 
Links
Facebook: www.facebook.com/jessicahooversings
Website: http://jessicahoover22.wix.com/music 
Twitter: www.twitter.com/jessicahoover22
Brian's Facebook: www.facebook.com/BrianWhitscellMusic
Contact: jessicahoover22@outlook.com

story:
We are Spontaneous Thin Air Radio (STAR) based in Boulder , Colorado.

Posted above is the video for one of our early demo songs, Star Shine. This song was recently released on a compilation CD called Differentiate, a collaboration between musicians in locations as diverse as LA, Iran, the UK, Denmark, Utah, Switzerland, Canada, and Italy.

Working with these musicians – and, throughout the process, learning more about their individual challenges and triumphs – has inspired us in our own musical lives.

This is what Star Shine is all about. You know those people in your life who inspire you, just by being who they are? Each line or two in the song is a reference to a real person who we have found to be admirable or inspirational. If you reflect a for bit, perhaps you can recall details about similar individuals in your own life. They could be close friends, relatives, lovers, or even strangers met in passing… Brief contacts that nonetheless had a deep impact. Yet no matter how long the duration, these relationships all help to shape who we are today.

Which brings us to STAR’s current project— We are currently in the process of recording our first full length CD, and we are reaching out you for help in manifesting our new goal. Every contribution makes a difference, and has huge significance to us. If you are on this site, you are probably a believer in the synergistic power of collective efforts. Your assistance will help our dream of a CD release become a reality.

Like people, music has the power to touch lives in a profound way. A certain song, heard at the right time can serve as a catalyst for powerful personal shift and change. Our goal is that our music serve as more than entertainment. Yes, hopefully it is fun, sexy, and engaging, but STAR’s main mission is to encourage people to live truthfully and courageously. And you’re invited to play along too… We’re all members of the same band. As Sly Stone sang, “Everybody is a STAR…”.

So if you see what we mean, and something you have read above touches you or resonates with you— Join the jam now and select one of the options on the right side of the page.

May the energy generated when you decide to give now be returned to you in many wonderfully unexpected ways!

story:
Africa Oyé is the UK’s largest celebration of music and culture from Africa and its diaspora. Beginning in 1992 as a series of small gigs across Liverpool's city centre, the event has gone from strength to strength and moved to its present home, Liverpool's picturesque Sefton Park, in 2002.

With too many negative representations of Africa, Oyé seeks to establish a balance and highlight the fantastic range of cultures, foods, music and artists that make this great continent vibrant and inspiring. The festival is a truly international event that harnesses the spirit of multiculturalism and tolerance. Africa Oyé remains a registered charity and re-invests any and all funds raised back into the festival.

The festival is also one of the most relaxed in the UK. We welcome individuals and families from all walks of life. Oyé prides itself on being inclusive and unrestrictive, attracting a wide range of cultures and helping to lay claim to Liverpool’s “The World in One City” status.

In 2010, the event hosted over 50,000 visitors and contributed over ￡1.3m ($2.1m) to the local community's economy. To an extent, we've become a victim of this success.  

For a time leading up to this year's festival, we at one point faced a grim choice brought on by the unprecedented attendance of Africa Oyé 2010: Charge an entry fee and fence off the grounds, or don't hold the festival. The increased costs (£100,000/$160,000) brought on by a new permit and subsequent regulations meant that charging an entry fee was our only option to keep the festival alive. To say we were reluctant to introduce this charge is quite an understatement.

Thankfully after talks with the local authorities, further financial support, and some sponsorship, we've managed to keep the festival open and free once again. We're not about profit. We're dedicated to bringing fantastic music to Liverpool and doing what we can to engage and enrich the local community.   
 
Still, we're not out of the water just yet. We're extremely thankful for the sponsorship we've received so far but, as we strive to maintain both the calibre of the festival and further develop year round educational programmes, we're asking that you support Africa Oyé at its very root.  

The stage is the focal point of any music festival, an essential element of its existence really, and ours costs precisely ￡9480 ($15340). The music which emanates from it is vibrant and full of life. Our stage is the heart of our festival. Help us keep it beating.

story:
Brief Summary

Laura Caffrey is an Irish woman and singer/songwriter, she has sung all around Ireland, UK and internationally and is very keen to pick up her singing career by touring Irish festivals around the world. The album that this funding will produce is Laura's first collection of songs on CD. The songs which she has chosen to record are personal to her and have been a part of her repetoire over the last twenty years. This has been a stop/start project due to finances and raising a family. 
 

The Music

Laura feels very fortunate that John Faulkner (De Dannann, Reel Union, Rejoice, Deolris Keane) is producing this collection of song in Audio Monkeys Studios, Kinvarra, Co. Galway with technical engineering from Paul Mulligan. The album is of composed of new and old songs. New songs are written by Laura and old songs are from the traditional Irish storytelling genre of music.

 

Where does the funding go?

All of the funding provided through this campagn will go towards the completion of the project. The money will go towards paying for a week of studio time, the sound engineer fees, the producers fees, session musicans, mixing days, the final mix, pressing, artwork/packaging and travel expenses. The the album has cost Laura eight thousand thus far and she owns it in its entirity. 

Unfortunately we are unable to offer any immediate perks for donators as every penny is needed to go towards finishing the album, but once the album is complete donators will be invited to its launch. 

The complition of this album will be the end of one journey and the beginning of the another as Laura plans to tour the album after its complition. 

Thanks for listening 

Any request will be considered, within reason.

story:
WHAT IS THIS?

Hello Everyone,

Thanks for viewing our Indie Go Go campaign page and thanks for listening to the brand new song streaming above! We are Deaf Scene, a psychedelic instrumental rock trio from Baltimore, USA. We’ve been a band for seven years, have recorded a few EP’s, have toured extensively in the USA, and just recently finished recording our first proper full-length album. Making music is what we love to do more than anything else, and we want to share our passion with our friends and fans by delivering them as much new music as possible! On our own budget, we have been able to afford all parts of the recording, mixing, and mastering processes for our new album! We are psyched about the results, and the process has been an incredibly rewarding and fun experience! However, recording the album is only half of the battle. We want to be able to produce 12” Vinyl LP’s as well as CD’s of our new album, but since we are not on a record label, it is very expensive to do so. This is why we are turning to fans like you for support with this project! Rest assured, we have some unique and worthwhile rewards to offer in return for your supporting donations!

OUR CROWDFUNDING GOALS

We have two goals of our crowdfunding campaign.

  1. To raise $5000 to help us cover the cost of the vinyl and CD manufacturing processes. This is the last step of the ‘new album’ process, and will allow us to finally put quality Vinyl and CD’s in the hands of our fans!

  2. To involve our fans in our process of music creation in new ways, and to show our deep appreciation for the support of our friends and fans by offering perks that are worthwhile, personalized, and lasting.  

HOW YOU CAN HELP US

Your support means everything to us! We have a variety of perks that are calling your name! Just click the perk to make a supporting gift! But if you don’t have the ability to donate, it’s ok! We dont hate you, but you can help us by SPREADING THE WORD! Post our campaign on facebook and other social media sites, and let your friends and family know. Our perks make a great Christmas idea for any music lover and independent music supporter. Check out all the amazing perks we have to offer below!


ROCK ON! May the force be with you!

Team Deaf Scene


                                                         THE PERKS!!!

story:
Why Your Support Means So Much to Us

Requiem by John Rutter

 . . . in memory of those who have gone before us.

Music of Stillness, Peace, and Hope by Michael John Trotta

 . . . for peace and goodwill until everyone is free. 

The Choir of Virginia Wesleyan College has been given an once in a lifetime opportunity to debut in Carnegie Hall. Two concerts will take place on Memorial Day weekend in 2014. 

  • 250 singers 
  • 50 member orchestra 
  • 2 concerts 
  • 1 opportunity of a lifetime 



What We Need & What You Get

  • To date the choir has raised 50% of the $75k needed to cover the cost of transportation food and lodging.  
  • Your contribution will not just help our choir financially but you are also making a dream come true for a group of young adults passionate about using their voice as an instrument of change in the world. 
  • We have some AMAZING perks when you contribute to making our lifetime opportunity come true. Here is a list of what you can get depending of how much you contribute. (see below for details)
  • All the money that is raised will fund the trip. There will not be any money funded that will not go to making sure that this is the best experience for the choir.

The Impact

"Nothing that I can do will change the structure of the universe. But maybe, by raising my voice I can help the greatest of all causes - goodwill among all and peace on earth." Albert Einstein

"This will be our reply to violence: to make music more intensely, more beautifully, more devotedly than ever before." 

Leonard Bernstein

Other Ways You Can Help

Anything you do to help us is greatly appreciated here are some other things you can do to support our tour.:

  • Please tell people about this amazing opportunity that the Choir of Virginia Wesleyan College has. Ask them to help support also to make this lifetime opportunity come to fruition. 
  • Share this site! Use Facebook and Twitter to help us get the word out about what we are doing.

Thank you for your support. Every contribution is appreicatied.

story:
About me:


“Stay true to yourself, because you are who you are! You are perfect!!”


I´m Nana Kuronoma, a cosplayer from little Austria.
I´m cosplaying since 2006 and I have experienced a lot since then,
At first, it wasn´t easy. I had no help and had to learn everything by myself,
where to buy wigs, how to recognize a high quality textile and where to get good contact lenses. In the past years, I evolved, and I´m now on a higher level.
Many people would call me a „professional cosplayer“, but thats not how I see myself.

I´m quite normal, like all the other cosplayers.
For me it is important, to „take care of my fans“.
For example, If you write a messege to me, you can be sure that you will get an answer. And I will always help, if someone needs an advice for his/her cosplay.
I will not put myself on a podium, just because I have some followers ( v.v).
Of course, I´m happy that my fans like my work and that they hang it up in their rooms, but what is really amazing is when people at conventions come over to me and tell me that they like my attitude and that I encourage them. What can be more beautiful?

So, that´s a little bit about myself, now to the important part.
This whole thing is about one of my dream Cosplays of all time.
Asuka in her Plugsuit and Rei in her Plugsuite from Neon Genesis Evangelion.
As my Fans will know, I did both of them, but this time will be different.

The Suits are handmade for me, out of latex. I LOVE THESE PLUGSUITS!!
They will fit perfectly on my body and will be one of my best Cosplays so far.

My plan is, to raise the money,
(I saved a litle amount by myself, so you don´t have to do all the work XD)
As I mentioned before, I cosplay for my fans, so If you help me, to get my suits, actually you help yourself. Not only for the good feeling you have helped me to
realize my dream, there will be some rewards for special amount of donations.

What will I do with the money?

First of all I will buy these awesome and perfect latex plugsuits (I LOVE THEM),
this will be about 2/3 of the money,
Next thing is to organize the photo shoots. There are at least 3 professional Photographers, who want to make photos of the Plugsuits.
If you will take a look on my Facebook page

Nana Kuronoma on Facebook

you can see that all of my photos are high quality and very professional.

These Photos you can get here are LIMITED, that means, this photos will never be able to be bought anywhere else. I hope you can trust my judgement enough, that I will only give the best photos to you.

Next thing you like to know is, "When do i  get my Prints?"

So after the goal is reached I will buy the plugsuits, and hopefully they are finished and shipped within 2 or 3 month.
After that I have to organize the photoshootings, and with photo editing I think this will take another month or 2.
You will be informed about every detail off this projekt over my Facebook Page,

When the shootings are done and the final photos were chosen, you will also get an email, that time has come and the day where you get your prints is near.

What If I don´t reach the Goal?

No problem at all, then I just buy one plugsuit.
This could be a hard decision, Asuka or Rei, but I think with your help this will be much easier.
And instead of one Photo of each Plugsuit you will get, 2 photos of one plugsuite.

After the shooting is not after the shooting!!!
I think I don´t said it enough, I LOVE THESE PLUGSUITS (and latex XD)!!!!
I will wear them, on Conventions, on so many Conventions.

And if I don´t wear them, they will be part of the EVA-Museum here in Austria. His owner is a very good friend of mine and this is what he would like to tell you about his museum:

EVA-Museum

More than a decade ago starting with some figures and merchandise.
By now it´s one of the largest private owned collections of Evangelion themed items, containing all kinds of merchandise.
From figures, keychains, trading figures, wearables, house hold items, office materials to costumes and much more it s a accumulation of thousands of different items. Located in Austria (Central Europe) it´s possible to visit it (only with appointment) and over the past years it´s also been used for several EVA themed photoshootings.
With getting more press coverage and raising a larger fanbase the plan for the coming years is to setup a proper public accessible museum. Till that happens you can find updates and info either at

https://www.facebook.com/EVA.Museum
or http://www.evangelion.eu

So that´s all I think, Enough words have been exchanged;
now at last let me see some deeds!
Thank you if you read all the text above and/or watched the video.
If there are some grammatical errors please send me a text on facebook.

Not only for the good feeling you have helped me to realize my dream, there will be some rewards for special amount of donations.What will I do with the money?First of all I will buy these awesome and perfect latex plugsuits (I LOVE THEM), this will be about 2/3 of the money,Next thing is to organize the photo shoots. There are at least 3 professional Photographers, who want to make photos of the Plugsuits.If you will take a look on my Facebook page Nana Kuronoma on Facebookyou can see that all of my photos are high quality and very professional.These Photos you can get here are LIMITED, that means, this photos will never be able to be bought anywhere else. I hope you can trust my judgement enough, that I will only give the best photos to you.Next thing you like to know is, "When do i  get my Prints?"So after the goal is reached I will buy the plugsuits, and hopefully they are finished and shipped within 2 or 3 month.After that I have to organize the photoshootings, and with photo editing I think this will take another month or 2.You will be informed about every detail off this projekt over my Facebook Page,

When the shootings are done and the final photos were chosen, you will also get an email, that time has come and the day where you get your prints is near.What If I don´t reach the Goal?No problem at all, then I just buy one plugsuit.This could be a hard decision, Asuka or Rei, but I think with your help this will be much easier.And instead of one Photo of each Plugsuit you will get, 2 photos of one plugsuite.After the shooting is not after the shooting!!!I think I don´t said it enough, I LOVE THESE PLUGSUITS (and latex XD)!!!!I will wear them, on Conventions, on so many Conventions.And if I don´t wear them, they will be part of the EVA-Museum here in Austria. His owner is a very good friend of mine and this is what he would like to tell you about his museum: EVA-Museum
More than a decade ago starting with some figures and merchandise. By now it´s one of the largest private owned collections of Evangelion themed items, containing all kinds of merchandise. From figures, keychains, trading figures, wearables, house hold items, office materials to costumes and much more it s a accumulation of thousands of different items.
Located in Austria (Central Europe) it´s possible to visit it (only with appointment) and over the past years it´s also been used for several EVA themed photoshootings.
With getting more press coverage and raising a larger fanbase the plan for the coming years is to setup a proper public accessible museum. Till that happens you can find updates and info
either at https://www.facebook.com/EVA.Museum or http://www.evangelion.euSo that´s all I think, Enough words have been exchanged;
now at last let me see some deeds! Thank you if you read all the text above and/or watched the video.If there are some grammatical errors please send me a text on facebook.

story:
As many of you know, Daniel Johnson and I released Daughter of the Mountain, Volume I of The Mantra Project, in January of this year. We've been blown away by the positive response, deeply moved to learn how many lives this music has touched. 

Daughter of the Mountain was a prelude; the cosmic clearing of our musical throat. After our long hiatus from recording, we initially envisioned a simple kirtan album. Once back in the studio however, the possibilities of audio technology inspired us to break new creative ground. As the music unfolded, we realized we were developing a unique 21st century sound for the ancient mantras we love and revere... and The Mantra Project was born. 

We've now begun developing music for Volume II. We're eager to get back to the studio, and can't wait to share the new music with you. This next album will be amazing, featuring mantras and chants of the goddess, and packed with rich layers of my vocals and Daniel's inspired tabla grooves. We're also inviting a group of incredible guest artists to be part of this recording. We want to weave traditional vedic chant, flute, cello, horn, and guitar into the musical textures. Imagine soaring vocals, reverberating mantra, lyrical melodies, and the driving pulse of the drum. This is what I hear when I close my eyes. This is what we want this album to be: a rich tapestry filled with awesome beauty and luminous power.

But we want to do it right. And for this we need to raise at least $25,000. After hearing Daughter of the Mountain, one listener wrote, "This changes everything!" With your help we can create yet another groundbreaking album, one that goes beyond what we were able to accomplish with  Volume I.

This is what your financial support can provide:

  • $2500 covers costs for recording, editing, mixing, and mastering one track. This album will feature at least 6 tracks.  
  • $250 pays a guest artist
  • $750 covers graphic design and photography for the CD and packaging.
  • $1000 pays for manufacture of 300 CDs
  • $2500-3000 pays for producing a music video. Absurd as it seems to make a music video for sacred chant, nowadays, this is required.
  • $5000 will underwrite a national workshop and concert tour.

Other Ways You can help:

  • Host a workshop and concert at your yoga center, festival, or other venue
  • Connect us with contacts in the music, yoga, or media industries
  • Spread the word by forwarding the link to this campaign to everyone you know
  • Click here to like us on Facebook

There are many ways to support this project and no contribution is too small.  Help us make this music. Help us reach a larger audience. Help us bring more music to the world.

We look forward to seeing you at the CD Release Party in 2015. In the meantime, thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your generous support of this work.

story:
Our Vision

Cabaret de Carmen brings you face to face with Georges  Bizet's classic opera, Carmen in one of Austin’s most dynamic performance spaces, The North Door. Originally conceived by GLOW Lyric Theatre in South Carolina, Cabaret de Carmen is a one-act opera.  This condensed version makes the action more sultry, more intense, and in many ways, more impactful.  It connects the audience with the beauty of Bizet's music and the fire of raw human emotion.

The story of Carmen takes us on a journey of love, independence, longing, and ultimately suffering.  As we look at this classic work with modern eyes, it cannot be ignored that themes of domestic violence and perhaps even PTSD are expressed in this storyline.  That is why 75% of the contributions raised  beyond our budget goal  combined with ticket sales will be donated to SafePlace, the domestic violence shelter and to the Veteran's Guitar Project here in Austin, Texas.

Performances:

February 13th at 7:30 pm 

February 14th at 7:30 pm with a special after show presented by Austin's own Spotlight Concerts

February 15th at 3pm 

Location - The North Door 502 Brushy Street Austin, TX  78702

Cast and Crew:

Liz Cass - Executive Producer/Carmen
Rebecca Herman - Artistic Producer/Stage Director
Hugo Vera - Don Jose
Julia Taylor - Micaela
Matthew Treviño - Escamillo
Cynthia Wilson - Piano
Lisa Filemyr - Stage Manager
Jeannie Lozano - Graphic Design


The Budget

$9,000 is an extremely modest budget for an opera production.  About half of the contributions will go toward artists' fees.   In addition, we have these expenses:

  • Venue Rental
  • Lighting design and operation
  • Stage Manager
  • Sets
  • Props
  • Wardrobe
  • Marketing and PR that includes a Graphic Designer
  • Video Recording
  • Photographer
  • Venue Rental
  • Super Titles Operator

If you have any questions at all about the budget, I will be more than happy to share the details with you.  Please email me at lizzie.cass@gmail.com

Impact

Changing the way we experience opera can deepen our understanding of the human themes and elements that are alive and well in these works.  There is a reason George Bizet's Carmen is one of the "most performed works" in over 200 years since its debut.  Cabaret de Carmen brings a modern look, feel, and message that will leave you humming this music and contemplating the complexities of life and relationships.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to donate financially.  You can still help us reach our goal!

SPREAD THE WORD! Tell everyone you know about this exciting new production. Get your friends, family, and colleagues excited to participate in a new version of this opera classic.  You can even share straight to your Facebook, Twitter, and other social media!

THANK YOU for being our partner in breathing new life into OPERA!

story:
"The finest meshes of Soulful Blues and melodic Pop you will hear this year" - The Blues Mag

After years of writing, rehearsing and performing all over the UK, we are finally ready for the next level! Come April, we will be taking our music to the studio, and putting our collection of Soulful songs on a record!

After a show late last year in the heart of London, we were approached by Stacy Parrish, a seasoned Producer who has worked with some of the biggest names in the history of music, including Robert Plant, Alisson Krauss, Randy Newman and T-Bone Burnett to name a few. He expressed his appreciation for our performance, and we soon found ourselves talking music, albums and recording over a beer!

"The Soul in Eddy's voice is where I want Music to be at." - Huey Morgan, Fun Loving Criminals, BBC 6 Music.

So, why do we need your help? Committing music to a recording is a daunting task; a little known fact is that the production will either make or break a song, so you have to put a lot of faith in who you are working with to make sure your record is the best it can be, and you most certainly get what you pay for! The money that you generously donate will go towards all costs, including Travel, Recording, Mixing, Mastering, Printing, Distribution (Physical and digital), PR, Promotion and all other incurring costs.

What will you get in return? The most important question of them all! The more you choose to Donate, the bigger and better the reward you get! From receiving a signed copy of the CD ahead of it's official release, to having us play a private gig in your back garden and everything in between! If you are unable to donate, you will still receive a message of thanks even for just sharing this page! Please do send us a message at info@eddysmithmusic.com if you have any queries!

"One of the most soulful voices we've ever heard!" - Matt Graveling, Best Of British Unsigned

So that's about all there is to it folks, don't forget to follow us closely on social media, as we will be releasing a series of vlogs, updates, photos and lots of other exciting things over the course of the next few months!

We look forward to seeing you at the album launch in the Summer!!

story:
BIO

Cheryl Rivera, una de las cantautoras sobresalientes de Puerto Rico, cuenta con una trayectoria de más de una década en la escena musical independiente de nuestra isla y con bachillerato en Música de la Universidad Interamericana de Puerto Rico. Con una voz privilegiada nos  trae una propuesta autentica, que fusiona varios estilos latinoamericanos con Jazz,  Bossa Nova, Bohemia y Folk. Su energía y pasión en vivo la han llevado a presentarse en importantes escenarios en Chicago, New York, Austin, Texas y Cuba, siendo parte de grandes festivales como SXSW y el LAMC. Su primer disco independiente “Matria” saldrá al mercado en Abril del 2019; este álbum en donde compuso todas la canciones, promete introducirnos a un despertar con nuestra unión con la madre naturaleza, el amor y lo primitivo. 

OBJETIVO

La intención de esta campaña es recaudar fondos para ayudar a completar los gastos de producción del disco (estudio de grabación, mezcla, masterización, carátula e impresión de discos). La carrera de la música ha cambiado drásticamente a través de los años y hoy más que nunca es importante para los artistas independientes recibir el apoyo de sus seguidores, amigos y familiares. Hacer un disco es muy retante en estos momentos, en tiempos donde la ayuda de las disqueras y sus presupuestos son cada vez menos accesibles y los artistas han tenido que asumir todos los roles que conlleva la carrera. Hoy día dependemos de la autogestión para poder sacar nuestros proyectos adelante, para mantener viva la cultura y la música de nuestro país.

DONATIVOS

1. Elige la cantidad a contribuir ("Perks")

2. Haz tu donativo

3. Recibe tu premio.

4. Ayuda a regar la voz.

story:
Who Are we?

 

Hi! my name is Cherine Amr. I'm the frontwoman and guitarist of the Egyptian band "Massive Scar Era" (www.massivescarera.com)

I started MSE back in 2005 with my band mate and music companion, Nancy Mounir.
I met Nancy in a jazz concert in 2005. I wasn't into Jazz but a friend of mine used to play the guitar in that band.
Nancy was sitting right next to me, at that time I didn't know her at all. She had her violin with her and I watched her as she was interacting with the music. 
I met her again at the backstage while we were congratulating our friend for the show, I was very curious to know her background in music and asked her to jam. 

In our first jam, the moment she picked up the violin, I thought we could NEVER be in the same band. She also felt the same; She wasn't into metal music at all and I was never into classical music. 

10 years later! I can't imagine playing music without her. We have developed a very interesting way in writing music together. We don't know how we did that! but we know that we enjoy creating music together.

For 10 years we have faced all obstacles together! I wasn't allowed to play music at all, Massive Scar Era was our "secret" project! 
I wasn't allowed to jam with boys, so Nancy and I had to look for every girl in the country to join the band.
We weren't allowed to play many venues as metal music as you probably know isn't really that "favorable" in Egypt, so we played underground shows without permits that most probably ended with being shut down by the police.... IT WAS NEVER EASY and it will never be! but it was always exciting and fun.. and we will cherish every memory of the journey in our hearts!

I moved to Canada and we managed to finish our new EP (thank you Mr internet!), being away from each other has also had an influence on the way we write music together ; we believe that our new EP is very different from any other music we wrote before. We have evolved our sound to incorporate more dramatic orchestration, heavy guitar riffs and intense lyrics. WE CAN NOT WAIT TO SHARE IT WITH YOU ALL! 

The EP " 30 Years" will be released on 15th August and will be followed by a mini tour in BC and I can't possibly imagine doing a tour with our new music without Nancy! it wouldn't make any sense, right? 
so please help us bringing Nancy to British Columbia to promote our new record and create more music! 

What We Need 

Touring is expensive! you probably have heard... but we aren't asking for much, we just need to cover Nancy's airline tickets from Cairo + her visa expenses.

The Impact

Canada is a new territory for us. We have played Europe and USA but never toured Canada.  Creating new audience in a new territory isn't always easy but it's ALWAYS FUN! 
We are very excited about this mini tour and we really feel the Canadians in the west coast will enjoy our music. It will also be our starting point to network within the industry. we have more music that we would like to record but we can't afford to! we want to play more around the world but we need to start somewhere! 
 

How you can help?

We assume that you want to listen to our new EP ! right? :)   so how about you help us out and in return we give you link for our music BEFORE IT GETS RELEASED?! 
We also got other cool perks!!!  and AWESOME MERCH!!!!
