story:
Hey, everybody!

If you had asked me a few years ago, I would never have called myself a songwriter. But ever since moving to New York City, I’ve been writing and performing more and more of my own music and gradually gaining confidence as a “singer-songwriter”.

And it has been such a blast (see here!).

It’s a real joy to get to share my music with friends here in the city at my live shows, and I’ve been looking for ways to share with more people far and wide. This winter, I’ll finally be getting in the recording studio so I can put together an EP for release on all of the music platforms – and, as it turns out, that requires a good chunk of change!

So, I’m launching this fundraising campaign to help underwrite some of the costs of recording, including booking the studio time and compensating the musicians – who include some of my dearest friends and collaborators. If you’d like to chip in, I’d be so grateful! I believe that music has the power to speak to people’s hearts and to bring joy into people’s lives, and that’s what I hope to do with the songs I write. I'm definitely *still on the journey* of figuring out who I am as a singer-songwriter, but I'm excited to record and share what I've been working on so far ––will you help me share it?

--Ian 

 

June 2016        **look how far we've come!**       Sept 2019         

 

What will you be helping to fund?

Your contribution will go directly towards some of the major expenses of recording in a studio:

  • Booking the recording studio time
  • Recording 5 songs with an engineer
  • Paying the musicians! 

 

** [updated 11/30] **

We've reached our initial fundraising goal! Further contributions will go towards:

  • Booking rehearsal studio time 
  • Mastering the album
  • Distribution to online music platforms (iTunes, Spotify...)
  • Producing physical CDs

 

I will be teaming up with some of my favorite collaborators on this project, including:

  • Chris Peters (guitar & producer) 
  • Shyamala Ramakrishna (vocals)
  • Shirley Paxton Fofang (vocals) 
  • Kevin Garcia (drums)
  • Sean Murphy (bass)
  • Kenyon Duncan (keys)
  • Dustin Beardsley (trumpet)
  • Caitlin Fitzpatrick (saxophone)
  • Hannah Hens-Piazza (viola)

story:
Liebe Fans, Leser sowie Crowdfunding-Enthusiasten - und ein herzliches Willkommen auf unserer Seite auch an jene, die sich nur zufällig hierher verirrt haben!

Wer sind wir, wo kommen wir her und was machen wir hier eigentlich?

Wir sind Enemy I, eine fünfköpfige Band aus Berlin, die ihre musikalische Wohlfühlzone im abwechslungsreichen Industrial/Dark Metal gefunden hat.

Wie abwechslungsreich unsere Songs ausfallen, wollen wir auch in unseren Videos zeigen – und so soll nach der Akustikballade "Suffer From Love"

                                                       


unserem Smash Hit "Red-head Bitch"

                                                      


und dem Lyric Video zum treibenden "Twinsight"

                                                     


mit der Produktion eines weiteren ambitionierten und professionellen Musikvideos zum Song "The Cage" nicht nur das erste Musikvideo zum neuen Album folgen, sondern auch der nächste große Meilenstein unter unseren visuellen Veröffentlichungen gesetzt werden, mit dem wir abermals eine neue Seite von uns präsentieren wollen, die man so noch nicht kennt.

Gewinnen konnten wir dafür bereits Produzent Francis Peter Kiefer, ein Künstler, der im Hip Hop und R&B Bereich erfolgreich tätig ist, sich mit uns aber erstmals an das Metal-Metier heranwagt, sowie Schauspielerin und Musicaldarstellerin Maja Sikora, die uns ein holdes Burgfräulein mimen wird.

Nun wollen wir auch Euch für die Sache gewinnen, mit Euch gemeinsam das Video umsetzen und zählen daher auf Euren Support!
Wir haben viele schöne Ideen! Helft uns dabei, diese zu realisieren und Unkosten sowie Locationmiete finanziell zu stemmen!

 

Geschenke – Geschenke – Geschenke

Als Belohnung für Eure Unterstützung haben wir uns ein paar nette Gimmicks ausgedacht.
So könnt ihr Euch zum Beispiel die Enemy I-Grundausstattung (für Sie und Ihn) sichern, die sich auch hervorragend zum Verschenken eignet.
Habt ihr schon? Dann wäre vielleicht eine Kneipentour mit uns interessant für Euch! Oder eine namentliche Erwähnung im Video? Oder heizt doch einfach Eure nächste Feier mit einem exklusiven Konzert von uns auf. Das und vieles mehr gibt es hier einmalig im Rahmen unserer Kampagne. Stöbert los!
 

Kostenlos helfen

Selbst wenn Ihr nicht das nötige Kleingeld habt, um uns zu supporten, freuen wir uns über jede Art der Verbreitung unseres Vorhabens. Auch damit helft Ihr uns enorm weiter!
 

Danke – Danke - Danke

Wir sagen schon jetzt allen Unterstützern DANKE!
(Und wer neugierig geworden ist, was wir sonst so treiben, schaut am besten mal bei www.enemyi.com vorbei oder stattet www.facebook.com/enemyiproject einen Besuch ab)

story:
Hello!  

My name is Jordan Hemphill, you probably recognize me from the Nasty Soul youtube channel, and I want you to make your guitar sound so soulful the people say, "oh you nasty!"

I have been analyzing and packaging Neo-soul and RnB guitar content on youtube and have gotten so many amazing responses from my teaching style.  So I decided to write a neo soul guitar book.

 

Exclusive Guitar eBook

This book is a starter kit to jam in the style of neo soul.  There are 7 chapters, each with a different chord progression, rhythm style, and common neo soul soloing tricks.  34 page PDF with audio samples. 

This book will have an exclusive limited release with this campaign in hopes to raise enough money to upgrade the equipment I use to make my free youtube videos.

 

Your Guitar Just Got Smoother

This book is not just a well organized arrangement of 7 different jam scenarios, each page is also a kick starter for any creativity you want to bring into your playing!  Is your major 7 chord sounding dull today?  Try this major 9 move!  

 

Free Lessons Beyond The Book

Of course, I made sure to pack a lot of juice in this book, but the benefits don't end there.  The whole point of this campaign is to INCREASE the QUALITY of my free youtube content.  With enough copies sold, I will be able to invest in a high quality camera and lens, and the hard work I do to develop exciting and fun neo soul guitar content will be graciously validated.

story:
* All funds raised beyond our goal will help cover some last minute additional costs & go towards supporting future albums produced by Rising Song Records! *

Who I Am // Where I Come From

My name is Batya Levine. I grew up in a Modern Orthodox home, where Shabbos meant sourdough challah on the table and singing nigunim (wordless melodies) into the night. I’m a lover of groove, a student of the heart, and a pun enthusiast. I care about building Jewish community that simultaneously reaches backward and forward in time, and is wide enough for our whole selves. 

 

I’ve been coming into my own music practice over the last four years, getting to know my voice and learning to let songs move through me. Many of you have been in it with me along the way, loving and supporting my music, and are the reason I’ve come to this moment. THANK YOU!

 

Why This Album?

This album is a collection of the music that has come through this queer Jewish neshama (soul). It’s made of Ashkenazi yearning, heartache, and emunah (trust/faith). There are songs that incoporate liturgy, nigun, dance parties with the divine, and english heart-prayers. This music weaves together the rooted ruach (spirit) and tradition of my upbringing with the expansive and empowering spaces I currently call home. It is an offering back to the Jewish musical landscape that has nourished and held me through so much.

Singing and the power of music has been used across cultures for healing and connection throughout time. And in a world that is burning, we need each other and we need to keep singing: singing the music of our ancestors and the music of right now.

It helps us tune in, so that we can feel into our hope, our grief, our longing, and our celebration. 

 

Where you come in!

This album will take the work of so many, and I want to honor the labor and care of all those involved. While it feels vulnerable to raise $18,000 (!!) for an album of my original music, what that number actually means is compensating a number of musicians, artists, and engineers in ways that strive to reflect the value of their time, energy, and gifts.

So, this fundraising isn’t just for the music: it goes towards compensating the work of artists who are creating and organizing for a more just and connected world. 

 

Batya’s Album Team:

Joey Weisenberg: Musical Director / Bass

Anat Hochberg: Vocal Director / Vocals

Arielle Korman: Violin / Vocals

Aly Halpert: Vocals

Molly Bajgot: Vocals

Richie Barshay: Percussion

Micah Shapiro: Percussion / Vocals

Don Godwin: Audio Engineer

Jess Benjamin: Videographer

Emily Glick: Photographer

Sol Weiss: Album Art & Graphic Design

 

Amidst the work that you do in the world, if you can afford to support the creation of this album, please donate.* Any amount that you can give is incredibly helpful. You can also share this with your networks as a way of giving.

*Donations are tax deductible.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to support this work, and thank you for already supporting in the ways that you do.

If financial support isn't feasible for you, you can help out by sharing this campaign!

 

Learn more at www.batyalevine.com

I’m a lover of groove, a student of the heart, and a pun enthusiast. I care about building Jewish community that simultaneously reaches backward and forward in time, and is wide enough for our whole selves.  I’ve been coming into my own music practice over the last four years, getting to know my voice and learning to let songs move through me. Many of you have been in it with me along the way, loving and supporting my music, and are the reason I’ve come to this moment. THANK YOU! Why This Album?
This album is a collection of the music that has come through this queer Jewish neshama (soul). It’s made of Ashkenazi yearning, heartache, and emunah (trust/faith). There are songs that incoporate liturgy, nigun, dance parties with the divine, and english heart-prayers. This music weaves together the rooted ruach (spirit) and tradition of my upbringing with the expansive and empowering spaces I currently call home. It is an offering back to the Jewish musical landscape that has nourished and held me through so much.
Singing and the power of music has been used across cultures for healing and connection throughout time. And in a world that is burning, we need each other and we need to keep singing: singing the music of our ancestors and the music of right now.
It helps us tune in, so that we can feel into our hope, our grief, our longing, and our celebration.  Where you come in!
This album will take the work of so many, and I want to honor the labor and care of all those involved. While it feels vulnerable to raise $18,000 (!!) for an album of my original music, what that number actually means is compensating a number of musicians, artists, and engineers in ways that strive to reflect the value of their time, energy, and gifts.
So, this fundraising isn’t just for the music: it goes towards compensating the work of artists who are creating and organizing for a more just and connected world.  Batya’s Album Team:
Joey Weisenberg: Musical Director / Bass
Anat Hochberg: Vocal Director / Vocals
Arielle Korman: Violin / Vocals
Aly Halpert: Vocals
Molly Bajgot: Vocals
Richie Barshay: Percussion
Micah Shapiro: Percussion / Vocals
Don Godwin: Audio Engineer
Jess Benjamin: Videographer
Emily Glick: Photographer
Sol Weiss: Album Art & Graphic Design Amidst the work that you do in the world, if you can afford to support the creation of this album, please donate.* Any amount that you can give is incredibly helpful. You can also share this with your networks as a way of giving.
*Donations are tax deductible.

Other Ways You Can Help
There are many ways to support this work, and thank you for already supporting in the ways that you do.
If financial support isn't feasible for you, you can help out by sharing this campaign!
 
Learn more at www.batyalevine.com

story:
(Poniżej wersja w języku polskim)

Who am I?

Hi, my name is Roman Wróblewski and I'm a polish pianist with classical training. I am playing piano since 1991 when I was a 6 years old kid, full of dreams and hopes. Nothing really changed and, as you can see, I am still kind of a dreamer. During my last 15 years of stage presence, I was involved in many different music projects. From punk rock bands, reggae, dub, experimental, pop to electronic music, I was always searching for new ways of self expression. I've recorded 10 studio albums and played hundreds of concerts in Europe and Asia, but I have never recorded an album with my own piano music. Now, after one year of hard work, I hope to finish my debut album with your support.

What I Need & What You Get

To finish this album I need to collect 8800 euro. All this money will cover the costs of:

  • printing CD albums - 560 euros
  • pressing vinyl - 1800 euros
  • professional photo session - 350 euros
  • graphic design for an album cover - 300 euros
  • mix and mastering tracks - 600 euros
  • production of two professional video clips - 3400 euros
  • digital distribution - 150 euros
  • marketing and promotion - 1200 euros
  • Indiegogo fees - 440 euros

Every euro generated will go into the album release, no matter what the campaign brings in. The money will not be used for personal needs under any circumstances.  

You can support the release of my album by choosing from many different perks. There is a simple pre-order option where you can choose between digital downloads, CDs, and 180-gram, high-quality crafted vinyl.

Two of my artist friends created very special artworks, inspired by my music. For music lovers, I offer online piano lessons and my 10 years of experience in this field. I could also compose a new piece of music inspired by your story. Or choose a live or online concert and I will play a special program just for you.

Where will your money go?

In December 2019 I recorded all 8 compositions after two very long days in Studio of Radio Gdańsk. All the tracks I performed on an amazing Steinway grand piano. After many months of research, I found all the people which I need to make this release much bigger, including two very talented teams of video producers and dancers to create video clips, a graphic designer for the album cover, and a photographer to shoot professional photo session. Your contribution will make a big difference because with good marketing, press release, and digital distribution I would be able to reach many people with my music.

Mission, Risks & Challenges

After many years of being independent artist, creating and playing my own music, I have to say one thing: it's not easy. I still believe in music and the last few months have been a strong test of my faith. Not only for me… I believe that music is much more, something we all need at times and as Pythagoras said: “Music is a harmonization of opposites; reconciliation of the fighting elements ”. This strong faith continues to guide me through my life. On my way, I met many amazing people and spent special moments with the audience. I'm just trying to be a useful tool and spread harmony among others. Hopefully, with your support, I will make it a little longer and much wider!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. You could easily help me by sharing this campaign with your family and friends. You can use the Indiegogo share tools, post about it on your social media page, or spread the word via word-of-mouth.

Your loving musical friend,

Roman Wróblewski

 

>>wersja w języku polskim<<

 

Kim jestem?

Nazywam się Roman Wróblewski i jestem polskim pianistą z klasycznym wykształceniem. Zacząłem grać na pianinie w 1991 roku jako 6-letni chłopiec, pełen marzeń i nadzieji. Skoro to czytacie to chyba za dużo się u mnie nie zmieniło. Podczas moich ostatnich 15 lat obecności na scenie jestem zaangażowany w wiele muzycznych projektów. Od punk rocka, reggae, dub, muzyki eksprymentalnej, popu aż do muzyki elektronicznej, zawsze w poszukiwaniu nowych form ekspresji. Nagrałem 10 płyt studyjnych oraz zagrałem wiele koncertów w Europie i Azji, ale mimo to nigdy nie udało mi się nagrać swojej solowej płyty z muzyką fortepianową. Teraz, po roku ciężkiej pracy, mam nadzieje dokończyć mój debiutancki album, ale potrzebuje do tego waszego wsparcia.

Na co zbieram oraz co oferuję w zamian?

Żeby dokończyć ten album potrzebuje uzbierać 8800 euro. Wszystkie te fundusze pokryją koszta związane z:

  • wytłoczeniem płyt CD - 560 euro
  • wytłoczeniem płyt winylowych - 1800 euro
  • profesjonalną sesją zdjęciową - 350 euro
  • projektem okładki - 300 euro
  • miksem i masteringiem ścieżek - 600 euro
  • produkcją dwóch video klipów - 3400 euro
  • cyfrową dystrybucją - 150 euro
  • marketingiem i promocją - 1200 euro
  • kosztami obsługi portalu Indiegogo - 440 euro

Wszystkie euro jakie uda mi się zebrać zostaną zainwestowane w wydanie tego albumu, bez względu na wynik tej kampanii. Pieniądzę nie zostaną użytę w żadnym prywatnym celu bez względu na okoliczności.

Możesz wesprzeć wydanie tej płyty poprzez zakup jednej z wielu różnych cegiełek (opisy w języku angielskim). Istnieje najprostsza opcja zakupu pre-orderu w trzech różnych wariantach: cyfrowej, płyty CD oraz 180-gramowego, wysokiej jakości winyla.

Ponadto dwójka moich przyjaciół z Lizbony przygotowała specjalne dzieła sztuki w postaci limitowanej edycji obrazu oraz trzech pocztówek z cytatami moich ulubionych pisarzy. Dla pasjonatów muzyki istnieje opcja zakupu lekcji pianina w wersji online i skorzystanie z mojego 10-letniego doświadczenia w nauczaniu. Istnieje też opcja zamówienia utworu fortepianowego, który od zera stworzę dla Ciebie. Poza tym możecie w ramach wsparcia albumu, zamówić prywatny koncert w wersji online lub na żywo.

Gdzie dokładnie idą wasze pieniądze?

W grudniu 2019, po bardzo długich dwóch dniach w Studiu Radia Gdańsk, skończyłem nagrania wszystkich 8 kompozycji. Wszystkie ślady miałem przyjemność nagrywać na świetnie brzmiącym fortepianie marki Steinway. Następnie, po wielu miesiącach poszukiwań znalazłem wszystkie potrzebne osoby do tego by zrobić ten album czymś więcej niż tylko nagraniami fortepianiu. Cały zespół tych osób składa się z dwóch utalentowanych grup tancerzy i producentów filmowych, z którymi już pracuje nad produkcją dwóch video klipów, zdolnej graficzki, która zajmie się całością okładki i indentyfikacji wizualnej oraz fotografa, który zrobi profesjonalną sesję zdjęciową. Wasze wsparcie jest kluczowe także by móc opłacić koszta związane z marketingiem, PR-em oraz cyfrową dystrybucją, co jest bardzo ważne jeżeli moja muzyka ma dotrzeć do większego grona odbiorców.

Zadania, trudności oraz wyzwania...

Po wielu latach bycia niezależnym artystą, tworzeniu oraz graniu własnej muzyki, muszę powiedzieć jedno: to nie jest łatwe. Cały czas wierzę w muzykę i ostatnie kilka miesięcy były wielkim sprawdzianem dla tej wiary. Nie tylko z resztą dla mnie... Wierzę że muzyka to coś więcej, coś czego wszyscy często potrzebujemy oraz jak powiedział Pitagoras: "Muzyka jest harmonizacją przeciwieństw; pojednaniem walczących elementów". Ta silna wiara wciąż prowadzi mnie przez życie. Na mojej drodzę poznałem wiele wspaniałych ludzi oraz dzieliłem wiele wzniosłych momentów z publicznością. Jako artysta staram się zwyczajnie być użytecznym narzędziem, dzielić się z Wami całym swoim talentem oraz szerzyć harmonie wśród innych. Mam nadzieje że przy Twoim wsparciu, uda mi się robić to nadal, z jeszcze większą mocą!

Jak inaczej możesz jeszcze pomóc?

Niektórzy ludzie nie mogą udzielić finansowego wsparcia, ale to nie znaczy że nie mogą pomóc. Możesz podzielić się z innymi informacją o tej kampanii i wesprzeć to wydawnictwo w ten sposób. Poprzez post na Twojej stronie social mediów lub zwyczajną rozmowę, możesz wesprzeć mnie i zrealizować razem ze mną moję debiutancką płytę.

Twój kochający muzyczny przyjaciel,

Roman Wróblewski

story:
Welcome 

Hi, my name is Erica. I am an improvisational singer and therapist in training. The first time I tried singing what I like to call "a now song," rather than something previously written, my whole being came alive. The feeling of being right on the edge of creation, literally singing alive something fresh and new in real time is what gets me out of bed in the morning. I always prefer singing "now songs," and meeting the moment with my heart and voice. It's no wonder that I am also in the healing arts world. The more I sing, and the more I deepen in my studies of Pre & Perinatal Birth Psychology, I see how therapeutic sound and music truly are. Your contributions will allow me to bring forth the music I carry and share it with the world at large. 

What I Need & What You'll Get 

I need $6,500 for recording, mixing, and mastering this 5 track album, traveling to my producers, distributing the album, designing album art, marketing and promoting the album, creating a music video (woop woop!), and accounting for taxes and fees from fundraising platforms. 

You, my dear, will get to receive the sweet nectar of the songs that pour forth from my heart to yours; designed to soothe, calm, and bring you ever closer to your essence.♡ 

Any and all donations, at any amount mean so much to me and truly make this dream possible! 

My 'Why' 

This project is so important to me because I see that many of us have not learned the tools to self-regulate our nervous systems. If I could help, even just one person feel connected to themselves and sense of calm through the songs that are ready to be born, I would know that I'm living my mission. 

I have already received an abundance of incredible feedback from my single, 'Welcome In,' released in February of 2021. People are saying that 'Welcome In' has given them the permission they longed for to be with all the parts of themselves. Go listen to it and see for yourself! 

https://open.spotify.com/track/0sztDpUSlYqtQylx...

Other Free Ways to Support 

If you are not quite ready to make a donation at this time, please consider sharing this link with your friends, family, and on your social media accounts. Thank you for spreading the word!

story:
About MOAT - Poison Stream

Marty Willson-Piper was an original member of Australia's the church, a former member of England’s All About Eve, and is a current member of Sweden’s Anekdoten. Famously able to be in ten bands at once, Marty has found a hole in the sky to slip through the clouds – holding a copy of POISON STREAM, the second MOAT album, a collaboration with Swedish-German composer Niko Röhlcke, multi-instrumentalist and member of Sweden's widely-known Weeping Willows. With more ongoing projects – Noctorum, Atlantaeum Flood, Space Summit, an unnamed project with Tangerine Dream’s Jerome Froese, and a production role and guitar contribution to Texan Salim Nourallah’s latest project, one wonders how he has time to tour with wife and violinist Olivia in a completely separate entity that incorporates songs from all the said projects.

The answer is desire. POISON STREAM has been cooked for a while - but the world hasn’t allowed us to open the oven door until now when the aroma proved too much and now it sits on the kitchen table waiting to be consumed.

The initial batch of songs released so far hints at a broad sonic palette: GONE BY NOON is a nostalgic slice of brooding, baroque pop, while ACID RAIN is a gorgeous blend of synth-driven psychedelia and shimmering 12-string folkiness. But those tracks are just brief waypoints on the long and enticing sonic journey that is POISON STREAM.

The album is currently scheduled for a February 2021 release, but pre-orders will be sent out as soon as they're available, which is likely to be before the actual release date. 

THANK YOU & TACK for all your support!
Marty, Niko, Olivia, Stephen, and Dare

PS: Signed vinyl/CD at no extra cost!
PPS: Since we're using 'Flexible Funding' we won't run the risk of not making our goal. That means we'll be sending out selected perks from October 7th.
 


 

Song List

ACID RAIN
GONE BY NOON
HELPLESS YOU
THE BALLAD OF SWEET MARIE
THE ROADMAP TO MY SOUL
JUDGEMENT DAY
BLACK AND WHITE
THE FOLLY
LOVER
TEARS WILL COME

 

THE BALLAD OF SWEET MARIE is a soft, silky and spacious piece of traditional folk brought into the modern world, BLACK AND WHITE offers an explosive slab of searing pop-rock and THE FOLLY is an effortlessly cool, chanson-style, orchestral ballad. There is even room for the dreamy, country tones of TEARS WILL COME, muscular indie-rock anthems in the form of THE ROADMAP TO MY SOUL, the Bacharach infused sounds of LOVER and the haunting and spectral tones of JUDGEMENT DAY.

 

How it all started...



...and continued:

08/03/16 - MARTY via Facebook

"I'm out in the country with unreliable internet, working with Niko on completing the demos for the next MOAT record."

10/11/17 - MARTY via Facebook

"Niko has been down to Penzance where we have shaped the beginnings of 12 songs in the VIP Lounge recording studios that we will continue to work on in the new year to spring, also with Dare."

22/04/18 - MARTY via Facebook

"In the studio this Record Store Day weekend recording the Welsh wizard Eddie John's drums for the new MOAT record, Poison Stream."

21/08/19 - MARTY via Facebook

"Adding a bass part whilst mixing the new MOAT album Poison Stream."

 

 

Teaser Tracks - GONE BY NOON & ACID RAIN


With the launch of this campaign we're releasing a second taster from the album. On September 9th we made GONE BY NOON available to audiences worldwide. As a follow up we're proud to now present ACID RAIN. You can listen to both songs here:

 


"Gone By Noon, a teaser from the band’s forthcoming second long-player Poison Stream, is a gloriously baroque slice of pop and here Mr W-P and multi-instrumentalist Niko Röhlcke weave together lush and languid sonic backdrops tinged with melancholy and regret. And there is something in the gentle, shimmering harpsichord riff which punctuates the song, something in the slightly world-weary vocals, which together conjures images of cold war trysts and central European espionage. Listen even closer and you can hear just the merest hint of the nostalgic tones associated with the likes Richard Hawley hanging over the song. It’s a gorgeous piece of chamber-pop, full of mystique and broken promises, lost romance  and relationships run aground; beguiling, strange and beautiful."  – Dave Franklin (Dancing About Architecture)​

 


"Filled with a lushness crafted by a pair of worldly worn songwriters and pieced together as an experience, Acid Rain has that instant ‘I got you’ moment from the first chord struck. Add to that the layered chord progression and that deep feeling of blending musical harmony and fusion of talent that you sense the contributions of both artists yet feel the individuality of their talents."  – Ryan Martin (Jammerzine)

 

The Artwork

 

MOAT on Facebook

MOAT on Spotify

 

This campaign is scheduled to end on December 5, 2020 11:59pm PST.
story_txt:
About MOAT - Poison StreamMarty Willson-Piper was an original member of Australia's the church, a former member of England’s All About Eve, and is a current member of Sweden’s Anekdoten. Famously able to be in ten bands at once, Marty has found a hole in the sky to slip through the clouds – holding a copy of POISON STREAM, the second MOAT album, a collaboration with Swedish-German composer Niko Röhlcke, multi-instrumentalist and member of Sweden's widely-known Weeping Willows. With more ongoing projects – Noctorum, Atlantaeum Flood, Space Summit, an unnamed project with Tangerine Dream’s Jerome Froese, and a production role and guitar contribution to Texan Salim Nourallah’s latest project, one wonders how he has time to tour with wife and violinist Olivia in a completely separate entity that incorporates songs from all the said projects.The answer is desire. POISON STREAM has been cooked for a while - but the world hasn’t allowed us to open the oven door until now when the aroma proved too much and now it sits on the kitchen table waiting to be consumed.The initial batch of songs released so far hints at a broad sonic palette: GONE BY NOON is a nostalgic slice of brooding, baroque pop, while ACID RAIN is a gorgeous blend of synth-driven psychedelia and shimmering 12-string folkiness. But those tracks are just brief waypoints on the long and enticing sonic journey that is POISON STREAM.The album is currently scheduled for a February 2021 release, but pre-orders will be sent out as soon as they're available, which is likely to be before the actual release date. THANK YOU & TACK for all your support!Marty, Niko, Olivia, Stephen, and DarePS: Signed vinyl/CD at no extra cost!PPS: Since we're using 'Flexible Funding' we won't run the risk of not making our goal. That means we'll be sending out selected perks from October 7th.  Song ListACID RAINGONE BY NOONHELPLESS YOUTHE BALLAD OF SWEET MARIETHE ROADMAP TO MY SOULJUDGEMENT DAYBLACK AND WHITETHE FOLLYLOVERTEARS WILL COME THE BALLAD OF SWEET MARIE is a soft, silky and spacious piece of traditional folk brought into the modern world, BLACK AND WHITE offers an explosive slab of searing pop-rock and THE FOLLY is an effortlessly cool, chanson-style, orchestral ballad. There is even room for the dreamy, country tones of TEARS WILL COME, muscular indie-rock anthems in the form of THE ROADMAP TO MY SOUL, the Bacharach infused sounds of LOVER and the haunting and spectral tones of JUDGEMENT DAY. How it all started...
...and continued:08/03/16 - MARTY via Facebook"I'm out in the country with unreliable internet, working with Niko on completing the demos for the next MOAT record."10/11/17 - MARTY via Facebook"Niko has been down to Penzance where we have shaped the beginnings of 12 songs in the VIP Lounge recording studios that we will continue to work on in the new year to spring, also with Dare."22/04/18 - MARTY via Facebook"In the studio this Record Store Day weekend recording the Welsh wizard Eddie John's drums for the new MOAT record, Poison Stream." 21/08/19 - MARTY via Facebook"Adding a bass part whilst mixing the new MOAT album Poison Stream."  Teaser Tracks - GONE BY NOON & ACID RAINWith the launch of this campaign we're releasing a second taster from the album. On September 9th we made GONE BY NOON available to audiences worldwide. As a follow up we're proud to now present ACID RAIN. You can listen to both songs here: "Gone By Noon, a teaser from the band’s forthcoming second long-player Poison Stream, is a gloriously baroque slice of pop and here Mr W-P and multi-instrumentalist Niko Röhlcke weave together lush and languid sonic backdrops tinged with melancholy and regret. And there is something in the gentle, shimmering harpsichord riff which punctuates the song, something in the slightly world-weary vocals, which together conjures images of cold war trysts and central European espionage. Listen even closer and you can hear just the merest hint of the nostalgic tones associated with the likes Richard Hawley hanging over the song. It’s a gorgeous piece of chamber-pop, full of mystique and broken promises, lost romance  and relationships run aground; beguiling, strange and beautiful."  – Dave Franklin (Dancing About Architecture)​ ﻿"Filled with a lushness crafted by a pair of worldly worn songwriters and pieced together as an experience, Acid Rain has that instant ‘I got you’ moment from the first chord struck. Add to that the layered chord progression and that deep feeling of blending musical harmony and fusion of talent that you sense the contributions of both artists yet feel the individuality of their talents."  – Ryan Martin (Jammerzine) The Artwork MOAT on FacebookMOAT on Spotify This campaign is scheduled to end on December 5, 2020 11:59pm PST.

story:
If you like anthemic, hopeful pop/rock music, then this project is for you!

 

Who, What, and Why?

Everybody needs connection. All people need understanding. Nobody is better alone. These are the themes that shine in the music I'm making.  My name's Grant Craig, and I have a background in multi-instrumentalism, songwriting, music production, and photography. Those gifts have served a wide base of clients for years. Now I'm using my gifts to tell my story. Would you join me in launching this project?

How

This campaign is intended to raise money to fund the production costs associated with producing my full length album and to help people find hope in their lives. I'm able to make an album mostly on my own, but there are things I still must pay for in order to produce a great sounding album. Things like:

  • Equipment costs/rentals
  • Mastering
  • CD, Vinyl replication
  • Digital Distribution Fees
  • Web Hosting
  • The list goes on!

As you can imagine, all of that stuff adds up quickly. I'd love to be able to fund this on my own, but I simply cannot. I need YOUR help!  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to this project, that's OK. Really.  Here are some other things you can do:

  • Spread the word on your instagram, twitter, facebook, or other social platform. Use the Indiegogo share tools! Use hashtags #grantcraig #goodtobealive
  • Call someone you know who is lonely, depressed or simply down, and take them out to lunch. Show them they're not alone, and that they are WORTH IT.
  • Call your mom! 

Also, please follow me on your favorite social platform(s)

Instagram: grantrichardcraig
Twitter: grantcraig
Facebook.com/GrantCraigTN

Thank you!

Your time is valuable. Since you've read this far, you spent a good chunk of time on my campaign page. I'm am so humbled and grateful for you. Thank you!

10% of money raised in this campaign will be donated to NNDC (National Network of Depression Centers, a non-profit charity) to help people overcome depression. 10% donation to NNDC will happen if this campaign meets or exceeds its $15,000 goal. 

By contributing to this campaign, you consent to your email being added to the official Grant Craig email subscriber list. You can unsubscribe at any time.

story:
What is Job's Trials?

This new work explores the powerful and timeless themes from The Book of Job. Job’s questioning of justice and his resolve to rise in resistance while holding on to his faith are essential lessons to all of us as we confront the issues that face our society and the world.  This music aims to bring new audiences to this important story and to give those familiar with it a unique and modern vantage point on an ancient story containing themes that are still vitally important to our time.

Job’s Trials uses a unique new format based on a classical song cycle recast using the passionate language of jazz amplified with theatrical narration. The performance examines the most perplexing and powerful themes from the story: the paradox of faith, the ephemeral value of a virtuous life and the injustice of suffering. The narrative is propelled forward by the questions and themes that emerge from the text.

This work aims to leave listeners with a desire to fearlessly examine the difficult questions in their life and perhaps to begin to stand up to them with a deeper sense of courage and faith. 

 

Where We Are. And Where We Are Going.

This project is funded up through the last day of recording. Amazing! ... but of course the production after recording is where most of the cost of album-making lies. We still need the funding to mix, master, design, reproduce, distribute and promote the recording. 

We aim to bring this music to spaces of faith to amplify, deepen and challenge the traditional reading of this powerful story. Furthermore this recording will help to bring this universal theme to secular spaces as a potent model for resistance and endurance.

We would love your support as an early adopter. If you have read this far you are interested, right?? Please support by pre-ordering a CD, beautiful vinyl or signing on for a elite supporter package.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks so much for learning about this project! I appreciate your support! Even if you can't sign on for a reward right now, I would really appreciate if you can tell your friends about this project on social media or even better in real life ;) And I would love to talk to you more about the project. Please reach out to me with any ideas or questions.

Find me Instagram and Facebook with @doomisbass 

Thank YOU!

story:
Who We Are? 

A.R.A.P. (Aspiring Rap Artists Program) was created in 2016 to inspire the youth to learn how to express themselves in ways not often available to them. There's a lack of artistic opportunities available in the community. The company provides a comfortable setting and atmosphere for artists as they grow. Within the past year, getting the youth involved in our activities has been an enjoyable experience and many have been impressed on how superb and  contemporary the program has been. This campaign is to raise money for copyrighting the curriculum, contributors will help us achieve our goal in owning our curriculum to teach the youth. 

 

What We Need & What You Get?

ARAP's goal is to have $1,000. We are investing it into the copyright's for our curriculum. This is a significant requisition for teaching kids for the workshop. We've piloted our workshop several times, now we need a full curriculum that is copy-written before we launch the full program. Even if we don't reach our $1,000 goal, the curriculum will still be apart of the investment. A reward to whoever donates to the cause will receive a video from Traiquan and Abdul spitting 16 bars, or if we get to teach kids this summer, we will have a video of them saying "thank you" and also showing the progress we'll be doing in class.  

The Impact

What makes us stand out the most to our primary consumers is our determined objective in facilitating to the children how to spread substance through the art form of rap. Rap is a form of urban literature that some of us we listen to, can relate to, and can identify with regardless of your background. We have created a comfortable setting for our students to embrace their individuality and expressions through their own lyrics. We build a strong relationship with our students through communication and interaction within the class. Students will learn how to uplift and support one another and respect each other's creativity, in and out of the classroom.

  • ARAP received 2 grants as well as piloted the workshop at both Edwards Middle School in Charlestown and The Mattapan Teen Center. 

Risks & Challenges

With recent art funding cuts of 55% in Massachusetts, it is becoming more difficult for the art community to provide opportunities, such as ARAP, to the youth. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Rehash; If you know anyone who's involved in community centers, schools, local or rising artists, or other organizations who would like to get involved with ARAP, please contact us at our email at arapworkshop@ gmail.com

story:
What is needed for the album to become real?

We need about 1500 euros to make our first album a reality. This includes studio recording, mixing, mastering, digital form of our album including music tracks and a pdf with pictures, credits and info on Flamarabenco music project, and of course an actual cd. The cd will be in a digipak case with an 8 page booklet.

How can you help us?

You can actually buy our album through this campaign, and wait just a few months so we can finish recording, mixing, mastering and send it to you as soon as it is printed (or just electronically published if you choose to buy just the digital audio version.) We have already started recording our album, so we will send a couple of preview tracks as soon as you give us a chance of continuing our studio sessions with your contribution. Other than that you can also help us by sharing this campaign with your friends on social media and mouth to mouth, so we can have a better chance at reaching our goal.

 

 

 

 

What happens if we don't reach our financial goal?

Well, this is something that it is not very likely to happen, but since you ask: Your investment will not be for no reason, as we will continue recording our album for the next few months, and maybe cut some expenses regarding cd packaging and maybe fewer tracks on the studio. Nevertheless this will not be a hindrance for the Flamarabenco album experience you will receive.

story:
What you are helping fund

  • I’m Rob Finlay a Singer Songwriter from Hertfordshire in the UK. The music industry is evolving, gone are they days of major record deals for artists like me. Now it's down to us to support new music and the artists we love. I've done it for others and now I'm asking you to do it for me. Here's why:
  • In 2014 I suddenly lost the hearing in my right ear following a vaccination that went wrong. Doctors said it was Sudden Sensorineural Hearing Loss (SSHL). Anyone suffering with this will know it changes your life. I was very sick and have since battled with balance problems, depression and tinnitus. These symptoms make playing live difficult and so I've focused my energy on writing a new five track EP.
  • By funding this EP you will help me to raise awareness of SSHL.  You will also be helping me share my story, which I believe will inspire people who have yet to come to terms with their own hearing loss.
  • I have no problem in telling people that I wear a hearing aid.  It’s made a massive difference to me and I want to encourage more people who are worried about the stigma around wearing a hearing aid to give it a go.
The music
  • The EP will contain five new songs.
  • All the songs tell stories with strong female characters at the centre. 
  • Compared to my first album the production will more stripped back. I'm planning on building a soundscape with instrumentation from additional guitars, bass, cello, and percussion. 
  • The style will be singer songwriter / folk with the focus on storytelling. 
  • You can watch two live video examples of the songs I will record in my Indiegogo gallery. 

What I Need & What You Get

  • Your money will be spent in the following way:
  • £2,400 for 2 weeks studio time to record and mix (£220 per day for the producer and studio hire)
  • £600 toward musician fees for playing on the EP (percussion, cello, and bass).
  • £500 for mastering (adding the final sonic touches and preparing the EP for distribution)
  • £200 travel and expenses
  • £300 CD manufacture

I will be producing this record whether I reach my goal or not. However the amount of money raised will dictate how much time I can spend in the studio. Reaching my goal will allow me to do this sooner and produce a higher quality record allowing me to spread my story more effectively.

The Impact

  • I’m hoping that by producing this EP I will raise awareness of SSHL
  • By sharing my story I hope to inspire people around the world who suffer with hearing loss not to let the condition get the better of them.
  • I’ve already proved that I can see a project like this through. My first self funded album “These Words Aren’t Meant For Me” had radio play on BBC Introducing, the video for Sister to a Brother has 150,000 hits on YouTube and Call Back the Day was a finalist in the St Albans Film Festival. I've grown as a writer and I believe the songs on this EP will make an even bigger impact.

Risks & Challenges

My main concern when I lost my hearing was will I be able to sing in tune? My producer Adrain has reassured me that I am still able to accurately pitch. Mixing is more difficult because sound is distorted in my right ear. However, my brain is adapting to this and I’ll rely on Adrian’s golden ears to mix the EP.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute don’t worry! You can still help. Spread the word about this campaign and the new EP on your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, blog, or whatever your preferred method of social media is.

Thank you for your love and support.

story:
To hear Danny's Music, check out his YouTube page:  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYaXx0ikeW_xj5...

Project Summary

A little bit about myself and the project:

  • Hey guys! I'm Danny Santos, a young 22 year old from Detroit, MI, currently living in Los Angeles and studying film at USC. My passion for music and film are the driving forces of my life, and I am looking to score films while also pursuing my dreams of becoming a traveling singer-songwriter!
  • With this campaign, I should have a fully developed album by December 2016! Creating my first album has been something I've been dreaming about since I started writing songs at age 15. Since I couldn't find anyone else to produce an album for me, I figured it was time to take matters into my own hands.
  • With your help, I'll go through the process of producing, recording, and arranging the songs for my album while also officially starting my music career!

What Is Needed & What You Get

Details, y'all:

  • The project is being funded for $10,000 due to the prices of producing a 12 song album, recording in a studio, hiring professional musicians to perform on the tracks, paying for a professional arranger in assisting me in composing the project as well as the software to arrange the music on my own, printing CDs, packaging the album, creating a logo, album art,  paying for song royalties for the cover songs going on the album, creating my own publishing company to release my work under, and any other funds that may pop up in production process.
  • If the entire goal is not achieved, the album may have to be cut in length, the cover songs may not be included, and the arrangements will have to be simplified to save money in terms of paying for musicians, arrangements, and studio time.

Let's Get Metaphysical!

Some info about the perks:
  • You may notice the perks "Tarot Card Reading" and "Star Chart" listed in the campaign. With my background as an intuitive spiritual advisor, I'm experienced in realms such as card reading and astrology.
  • A Tarot reading is a basic look into one's current life situation and psyche in which the querent (the person receiving the reading) is offered advice on their life. 
  • A Star Chart is an astrological portrait of where the planets were at the time of one's birth. It explains the intricacies of one's human nature and their natural inclinations while also exploring love, career, money, family, and among many dynamics. 

The Impact - Why Your Help Is Important!

Your contribution to Danny's $10,000 Album Fundraiser:

  • Help a young up-and-coming musician break way into the music industry as both a singer-songwriter and a film scorer.
  • If this album is successful, it may help me gain attention from people within the industry and help launch my career.
  • Regardless of the success of the project, I have complete gratitude and appreciation to all the family, friends, acquaintances, and strangers who have been willing to help out in this entire project. I would not be where I am without the support of everyone, especially my parents!

Risks & Challenges

The risks of the project are not being able to finish it due to not having enough funds and having difficulty meeting the time restraints of having an album finished by December 2016.

  • If proper funds are not raised, instead of hiring professional musicians and arrangers, I will be reaching out to students at USC's film scoring program and USC's music students.
  • I'm qualified to overcome these challenges due to my optimism, determination, and resourcefulness from working in both the music and film industry within Detroit and Los Angeles.

Other Ways You Can Help

It's completely understood that some people are not able to donate at this time, however you can still help in the following ways:

  • Sharing the IndieGoGo campaign link on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and other social media pages (hit that "Share" button on the IndieGoGo page!)
  • Subscribe to my YouTube Channel:  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYaXx0ikeW_xj5ynvwSOcAQ
  • Follow me on Instagram: @DannySantosMusic
  • Follow "Danny Santos Music" on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Danny-Santos-Music-283...
  • Find me on SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/danny-santos-5  

And that's all there is to it! Thanks for taking a look at this page and please share!
story_txt:
To hear Danny's Music, check out his YouTube page:  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYaXx0ikeW_xj5...

My passion for music and film are the driving forces of my life, and I am looking to score films while also pursuing my dreams of becoming a traveling singer-songwriter! With this campaign, I should have a fully developed album by December 2016! Creating my first album has been something I've been dreaming about since I started writing songs at age 15. Since I couldn't find anyone else to produce an album for me, I figured it was time to take matters into my own hands. With your help, I'll go through the process of producing, recording, and arranging the songs for my album while also officially starting my music career!

Find me on SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/danny-santos-5     And that's all there is to it! Thanks for taking a look at this page and please share!

story:
Who Are We?

We are a four-piece music collective that formed in the earlier part of 2016. Our band name, Lucid City, stems from our interest in clashing narratives between dreams and reality. Let us score your dreamscape! 

This campaign will help us be heard in a world full of aspiring artists. It will give life to our art and our vision, which we are dying to share with all of you. 

Somos una Banda conformada por cuatro miembros formada al comienzo del año 2016. De nuestra Banda, llamada Lucid City, proviene nuestra pasión por cruzar los sueños y la realidad. 

Esta campaña nos ayudara a ser escuchados en el mundo de aspirantes y músicos. Le dará vida a nuestro arte y vision, por lo que no podemos esperar para compartirlo contigo.


What We Need & What You Get

Starting a band is like starting a company. Both time and money need to be invested, and with your help, we can grow and expand our start up properly and successfully. 

This money will help fund our: 
-Debut self-titled EP 
- Music Video for our first single "Mockingbird"
- Website Launch
- Photo Shoot
- Branding Initiatives (Logo, Album & Concept Art, Merchandise) 


By helping us take the first steps on our musical journey, we want to give back to you. Your generosity will (obviously) not go unnoticed :)

Some of our fun perks include: 
- Music Lessons
-Catering & Private Performance 
- Tickets to Upcoming Shows 
- Personalized Jam Sessions
- Album & Concept Art Posters 
- Digital copy of our EP
 
Please make sure to e-mail us at lucidcitymusic@gmail.com to claim your perks! 


Aspire to Inspire

Our four members have been writing and playing music for a long time. Some of us have solo projects, but we have all been looking for a group of passionate and committed musicians to establish a steady band. Lucid City was formed in hopes of creating a lifetime experience that could potentially transcend ourselves and inspire the world around us. We aspire to inspire. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest current challenge is aligning our perspective lives to coincide with our passion of music. The four of us work very hard, some of us are also in school, and we each make it a point to dedicate and allocate time to create. Time presents a challenge for us -- not allowing us to play as many shows as we like, busk, and generate income with our music. Therefore, we turned to crowd funding. We hope our friends and families will give what they can to catalyze the birth of our projects!  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute, but would still like to help us, there are a few things you could do! 

- Share this indiegogo page with your friends and families

- Come to see our live shows and bring friends that don't know us so we can build our fan base. 

- If you are in the the music entertainment field, help us make connections with booking agents, venues, etc. 

- If you are an artist, photographer, videographer, producer - wanna collab bro?

story:
TX Chip

We're a group of misguided artists and musicians making art using the hardware and aesthetics of outdated computers. Gameboys, Commodores, NES, Sega Genesis, Amiga, and anything generally found at Goodwill or garage sales.

Primarily based out of Austin, acts like Sievert, IAYD, The Mysterious H, I, cactus and prince_s have been writing and performing for nearly a decade.
 


On very special occasions we get to book touring acts, and in the past we've hosted Knife City, Boaconstructor, Ovenrake, Mega Ran, and now Goto80.


Goto80

Goto80 (Anders Carlsson) is a Swedish old media artist and researcher who works with music and text. His live shows are usally an explosion of genres, seamlessly mixing pop, acid, electro and punk together in his own particular 8-bit style. Catchy, noisy, funky and fearless.

After his 1990's schooling in the demoscene hacker culture, he was one of the first to bring chip music to the stage around 2000. He has performed around the world and released thousands of songs for free download, on C64-cartridge, in cheese burgers, in the wall of the Museum of the Moving Image in New York, etcetera.

As an artist he usually takes a critical look at how humans and computers interact, and has shown his work at Transmediale and Aars Electronica. In his Dataslav-project he creates music live, based on requests from the audience. When he makes ASCII graffiti he turns himself into a cursor who sprays text characters on walls.

As a researcher he has published texts about chip music and the demoscene at Ashgate and Rhizome. Currently he studies collective retro archiving together with associate professor Jörgen Skågeby, and writes books and papers about text graphics. Goto80 also curates t3xtm0de, an archive of text graphics, and blogs at Chipflip. 

goto80.com
text-mode.tumblr.com
chipflip.wordpress.com
internet2008.se
 

Loud Speakers and Airplanes cost money

We are a completely volunteer and DIY-minded collective, but some things just cost money.

The 4th Tap venue is literally a warehouse, and has no built-in sound system. Also Goto80 has to get here.

So let's keep it extremely simple:

  • PA rental with 4 huge speakers, stands and subwoofer - $150
  • Travel expenses to get Goto80 to Austin - $350
     

That's all we need! It's so achievable!

Printing merch like posters, stickers and buttons also costs money, but we'll just gamble on the fact that we'll make that money back during the show or down the road.


What do you get?


Poster designed by Zeke Guadiana
http://zekeg.tumblr.com/
Beautiful 13" x 19" robo unicorn and monster posse poster, printed on glossy photo paper.



5" die-cut skull sticker designed by Sean Horton 
https://soundcloud.com/himsypimsy


 


---UPDATE ADDITIONAL STICKER DESIGN FINALIZED---
4" square-cut hungry skull designed by Sean Horton

1.5" buttons designed by Mike Bautista, @milkbarista
http://milkbarista.tumblr.com/
Button pack of cursed modern technologies.

 

 

 

What if we fail?

Everyone in the community in Austin is ecstatic to see Goto80 perform – but unfortunately we will have to charge admission to get to the show if we do not hit our funding goal.

The ethos of TX Chip has always been "free and all ages," and bending that mentality is a last-ditch effort.

Our primary goal is to get the most people having the most fun possible at shows, and taking a ticket price out of the equation is always the first best step to achieving success.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just tweet and share and bring your friends. Goto80 is a global gem, tell people about his work.

 

What if we succeed beyond our minimum costs?


All money raised beyond our immediate costs will go straight back to the artists and performers. It would be amazing to ensure every act got at least a little bit of compensation for their unbelievable work, their time, and their continuing endeavors in the Austin art community.

story:
We are a small group of four from the Netherlands, midwifes, a doula and a fire man, who are committed to supporting those gathered and camping at Standing Rock. We ask for your help in arranging the gear needed to strengthen the winter camp at Standing Rock, where we will be traveling to in the end of December. We bring midwifery skills, woman's care and community skills to a camp which has kept itself strong for weeks on end; where a woman's tent has been set up; and where . We are called to stand with our fellow brothers and sisters in support of their actions to protect the waters.

Together we will make a difference. 

Background to what's happening at Standing Rock
"Water is life" is a truth that resounds within each of us, but this phrase has particular resonance at this moment in time. North Dakota, USA, is bearing cradle and witness to a standoff at Standing Rock: "Thousands of Native Americans repressing over 200 tribes from across the Americas are resisting the construction of the $3.8billion Dakota Access pipeline, which is slated to carry oil from North Dakota's Bakken oilfields through South Dakota, Iowa and Illinois." (Amy Goodman of Democracynow.org)

This resistance to the oil pipeline is being expressed through peaceful prayers, gatherings and ceremony; people are gathering to support Standing Rock are coming together with the intention of protecting the life-giving substance of Mother Earth.

Why now?
WATER IS LIFE
What's happening at Standing Rock extends beyond the human need for clean water. It is speaking to the enduring and blatant effort to smother people and cultures. The water protectors are being met with increasing violence by those drying their right to the land - there is incredible strength that is standing in the face of incredible cruelty. Yet there is barely any media covering what is going on in North Dakota. Despite the lack of coverage, there is this momentum that the protectors, and those that are connecting with them, are creating. And momentum there is; on the 14th of November the US army corps of engineers has released a statement that calls for a halt of the construction of the pipeline and for in depth talks with the Standing Rock Sioux tribe. This follows directly from the action of so many individuals coming together to say no! to the destruction by the Dakota Access Pipeline. This is good news, but we are not yet there!

This support needs to be sustained. The time to take action, whatever that might look like, is now.

Our aim
We aim to serve in any way we can; committed to supporting camp life and the water protectors there; bearing witness; helping out building the camp; making it winter proof etc.

Our decision is founded in our intention to offer what we can. We all work with women's health in some way - midwifes, doulas, birth pool providers- but have other communal and community skills that we carry to Standing Rock.

Winter is on its way and we hope to fly to North Dakota end of December with materials to help fortify the camps that are already established there. We will stay in North Dakota for four weeks, perhaps longer.

We have contact with people that are currently camping out at Standing Rock and are in touch with them and soon also with camp officials to direct our presence to the work and support that is needed.

How you can help us
We need support in preparing well for this journey; collecting and buying the needed winter proof gear which will support us and others in the camp; stocking up supplies for the medical and midwifery tent and other tents in need, thus contributing to a safe and supported (winter) camp. 

In the weeks we will spend there we pledge to commit ourselves to protect the water in any way we can; to work wholesomely and in culturally appropriate ways with others in camp and to actively contribute to the momentum of the movement. 

Your donations would help us with the journey, housing, safe camping in harsh environment, car rental, supplies and donations to the camps. We will be leaving all our equipment and the yurt with those staying in permanently.

here's what we need

1) financial

we aim to raise 17.500 dollar for:

6.000,-        for travel to and from Standing Rock, flights and renting a car
6.000,-        for buying a Yurt, a wood stove, transporting is to Standing Rock camp and making            
                       sure it is winter proof
2.500,-        sub-zero camping gear to use for our time there and extra to share with people at the
                      camp
3.000,-        for buying first aid medical gear needed for the medic & healer council and food and
                       day to day supplies to share in camp

2) sub-zero camping gear donations
Instead of buying the camping gear, it would be very helpful if you have sub-zero camping gear that you would be willing to donate to the protectors at Standing Rock. All gear we are bringing in, we will leave there, for further use. We will pick up the gear donations before the 15th of december. Please email us for details.

3) anything else you want to offer 

What if we don't manage to raise the full amount?
In case we don't succeed in raising the full amount of 17.500,- dollars, we will review the possibility of physically going there ourselves and what supplies we will be able to gather with the funds raised. Otherwise ALL donations will go directly to the Oceti Sakowin camp (http://www.ocetisakowincamp.org) and the medic and healer council there (https://medichealercouncil.com ). 

Our blog
We will keep a blog about our journey to report on our experiences, please visit our website http://mni-wicon-i.jouwweb.nl/

We ask your help in collectively strengthening the growing momentum of peaceful water protecting.

 

thank you,

 

with love and gratitude,

 

Flory, Arjan, Marjolein & Lievnath

Otherwise ALL donations will go directly to the Oceti Sakowin camp (http://www.ocetisakowincamp.org) and the medic and healer council there (https://medichealercouncil.com ). Our blogWe will keep a blog about our journey to report on our experiences, please visit our website http://mni-wicon-i.jouwweb.nl/We ask your help in collectively strengthening the growing momentum of peaceful water protecting. thank you, with love and gratitude, Flory, Arjan, Marjolein & Lievnath

story:
I have always known that my life is about inner growth, healing and transformation and I have chosen music and song as a  tool to support my self on this path. This journey has been sprinkled with intense challenges but they transformed them selves into gifts. 

www.maureenji.com

Life is constantly gifting me with the pleasure of meeting so many special people and beings. I have been able to travel around the globe sitting and singing in some of the most beautiful places. My devotion to sacred space and song has been inspired by all of you! 

https://maureenji.bandcamp.com/music

In the last 9 years I have been recording 5 Cds and realized that this music is touching so many people all over the world. My last album 'Lullabies for the soul' was recorded and produced in England by my dear friend Nick Barber together with Camille Marie a wonderful musician and harp player and got released in 2011.  People have been asking me in the last year when there will be a new one. I have written and composed for the last 2 years listening to the new vibration within my heart and trying to capture it.

It is a sweet duty to feel to be in service to deliver this music to support people on their path of transformation because this music has been delivered to me to support my own journey. 

I feel very grateful to have met Narayan and that he fell in love with these songs and that he is willing to create this new album together with me. 

Thank you all for participating in this project and co creating this album together. Because I am not a signed musician with a record label in the back it is the community of all of us financing this new CD. You can do this by simply pre ordering the new album for $15 and if you feel to donate more you can do that as well.

My love to all of you.

Bettina Maureenji 

“Bettina  Maureenji  has  visited  my  home over  the  years  and  given  the  most beautiful  experience  with  sacred  sounds. This  devotional  music  has  been  the perfect  medicine  to  go  on  an  inward journey  of  healing.  These  moments  have been  very  precious  and  I  feel  very blessed  to  have  found  this  divine  friend and  to  share  her  music  with  others.  She doesn’t  need  any  recommendation  you just  have  to  listen  to  her  to  know  that you’re in the presence of an Angel…..” The Viscountess Marina Cowdray/ UK


"Bettina's music is magic and has been able to brighten up my life even more. It comforted me in one of the most painful moments of my life by showing me the simple way of life and happiness.
Bless you and your music." Jose Melo, Portugal


Why $12.500

The amount we are all going to generate with this campaign will cover costs for the following:

$7.500 for recording, mixing, master and guest musicians (tba)

$2.000 for CD printing (incl. shipment to Hawaii)

$1.000 for video clip campaign + music video for new CD release

$1.000 for artwork album and new website

$1.000 fees & perks


How to contribute?

If you are called to donate you can choose any amount you like to and receive a gift for your contribution. 

Here is how else you can help:

  • share the 'Ceremony' campaign video on your FB page.
  • direct people to the Indigogo campaign.
  • send an email to your friends and friends of the friends.
  • coconut wireless - talk about 


Who is going to record us?

We are going to start recording in the beginning of September 2016 here in Kauai the garden island. And we estimate to have the album ready for you by the end of October 2016. This is our talented recording engineer and on top a wonderful person Will Lydgate. 
http://willlydgate.com/


Our commitment  

In case we do not reach the total campaign amount we will still produce and print the album and follow up on the perks! We are always happy to answer any questions you have about this campaign. You can write to bettina@maureenji.com or maureenjimusic@gmail.com



Biography Bettina Maureenji

"I sometimes say to people that Bettina MaureenJi saved my life through her teaching. And sometimes they think I am joking, but I am not. Her work is beautiful, profound, heart opening and full of magic. She works in the space between worlds where music weaves it's majestic beauty and connects all things." Moshe Halperin, UK

Bettina Maureenji is an internationally certified sound healing practitioner, teacher, traveler, unique musician and shamanic practitioner with accreditation in sound, voice and music healing from the California Institute of Integral Studies in San Francisco.

Bettina Maureenji has been travelling through Central and South America, Asia, Australia, Israel, England and Europe for the last 14 years. Weaving her musical expertise, her studies in Sufism, Taoism and Buddhism and the modalities of sound healing, plant medicine, conscious breathing, meditation, guided imagery and movement she supports people to access altered states of consciousness through using their voice and singing. She creates a safe space for healing to bring about transformative experiences.

Born 1971 in New York and of Germanic descent, Bettina Maureenji grew up in Syria and Germany. She completing University of Applied Science in Hamburg Germany in 1992. She worked for many years in the music business being educated in organization management and administration. During a journey to Varanasi (India) in 2003 she decided to devote her life to music and began to study Indian Classical Music with Pandith Shivanat Mishra at Benares Music Academy. She discovered her love for singing and using her voice as her main instrument and developed her own style in contemporary sitar playing.

Bettina Maureenjis encounter with the Brazilian musician Carioca Freitas in 1999 and the studies with her sitar guruji Pandit Shivnat Mishra in India, has influenced her very own musical language.

She lived in Ibiza, Spain for 13 years and moved to Hawaii in 2013, where she continues to devote her live to create union with the divine through music.


Biography Narayan Dass 

Narayan picked up a guitar in 2013 after meeting Bettina in a sacred prayer circle where she was supporting with music. He was so inspired, and impressed by what he heard and felt in that circle, that he made it his intention to play music and be in service to the divine. Once the intention was set, the universe supplied the necessary ingredients to manifest his intention.

In just a few short months, Narayan had learned to play these devotional songs, and began playing with Bettina in events and concerts.

Narayan's history as a Hare Krsna devotee had already taught him to have the heart of a servant, and once he began playing music the breath of spirit was already there.

He began acquiring instruments eager to learn how to play them all, he spent all his time in the first 6 months after their meeting playing his harmonium, Native American flutes, clay pot drums, and his guitar. Together Bettina and Narayan combined their voices and instruments to bring the vibrations of heaven to earth, and to share these gifts to help others relax and lift their own vibrations by bathing in the sound of the sacred.

When Narayan isn't playing music with Bettina, building websites, or houses, he will either be out surfing in the bay, or flying his glider in the mountains.

Narayan reaching the age of his mid forties is finally learning how to be in service, and the importance of giving, and the unbelievable blessings that are associated and given back to us when we decide to help others.

Service brought Narayan and Bettina together, and service brought them to Kauai where they intend to keep practicing giving it away.

story:
Overview

We are Doctors and Lawyers, an indie band formed in Massachusetts, whose members are currently scattered across the country. You can listen to some of our work here and here. Though we've had some runaway success as a band (including being featured in both American and international blogs, the Mercedes-Benz Mixed Tape, MIT Radio and a cover by Honeyblood), we were unsure whether we would be able to keep making music once we separated.

However, with hard work and despite the distance, we've managed to put together our best work to date. After reuniting for the first time in years to record the songs, we've gotten a hold of David Barbe and Harris Newman, two post-producers who have worked with notable bands that have been very influential to us. Mixing and mastering in a professional studio setting is something we've never had the chance to do before; it will make a huge impact on the quality of our music, and finally allow us to make the album we've always wanted to make.

Where the Money Goes

While we've covered much of our budget ourselves already, we need help closing the gap and completing this project. Whatever you decide to donate will go towards:

  • Studio mixing time with producer David Barbe
  • 3 to 4 rolls 1/2" tape on which to mix the tracks
  • Shipping charges to send the tape to Montreal, CA
  • Studio Mastering time with Harris Newman

The most important result of all of this work is that people listen to the album! So, anybody who contributes any amount to our campaign will be sent a digital copy of the album as soon as it's done.

We want to keep this campaign simple and direct--think of it as a pay-what-you-want pre-order. We want to make this album as great as we can, and, hopefully, you'd like to hear the result. Just make sure to include your email address so we can get it to you once it's complete!

Risks Involved

Since we've already finished recording the album, and have already booked time with both producers, the risks for this project are relatively low. The main risk is that, should we not be able to close our budgeting gap, we may not be able to complete the mixing and/or mastering processes, in which case we would have to postpone the release of the album indefinitely.

We've already handled many of the risks, both financial and otherwise, ourselves, including travel costs, the cross-country shipments of multiple musical instruments, and booking and reservation fees for studio time. We just need one final fiscal push in order to make our budgeting goal and the rest is taken care of!

Other Ways You Can Help

As we mentioned before, above all we just want people to hear what we've made, so whether you decide to donate or not, we thank you for taking the time to listen. And if you'd like to tell other people about us, or share this page with friends, well, we thank you for that too!

story:
Short Summary

Kevin Heinen is a Singer Songwriter from Luxembourg who has been around on stages and festivals since July 2014. He’s been inspired by his big idols Ed Sheeran, James Blunt, Damien Rice and Jimi Hendrix and tries to put as many elements from their music as possible into his compositions and covers he plays, but while still putting his own writing, singing and guitar playing style in first position.

He got joined by Lalo Sorbelli on drums in August 2015 and by Benny Remiche on the Bass in November 2015 to complete a dynamic, rhythmical and also melancholic trio that will start soon to record their first EP.

What We Need & What You Get

Unfortunately the Production of an EP cost over 2000€ which is hard to pay as a young musician and student without any income. If you support this young project, you don’t only help Kevin finally get his first EP, but you will also get some really cool gifts from Kevin himself (Hand Signed EP for instance..) Plus you get the EP already before the official release Party delivered to your homedoor. And if you’re very supportive, you may even get a private gig in your own living room! Isn’t that something?


Risks & Challenges

Kevin will start recording in December 2015, and is very thankful for every little support! If the goal isn't reached though, the release of the EP could be postponed to a later date, which doesn't mean it will not be recorded at all: it only means it will take a bit longer. The big challenge is to reach the goal before the deadline.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word. Encourage your Friends or Family. You can even share our campaign on your Social Networks.
Visit Kevin concerts, there you can make a donation too, by giving the amount you wish to donate directly to Kevin Heinen.

story:
PEP originally began as the solo project of Starlight Girls drummer Karys Rhea. In the fall of 2011, after hearing 'Runaround Sue' playing in a clothing store, Rhea became nostalgic and downloaded over 100 albums from the 50s and early 60s. She started humming doo-wop style melodies while practicing monotonous drum rudiments for hours at a time. These drum parts and vocal melodies became the foundation for two out of the four songs on debut EP, My Baby and Me, released February 11th, 2014. 

PEP has now settled into a tight knit act with an exciting and dynamic live show. With choreography by Ilana Webber, PEP completes the picture with an army of back-up singers and moves reminiscent of 1960s girl groups The Shangri-La's, The Ronettes, and The Angels, who all clearly provide an inspirational spring board. PEP has played extensively throughout the NYC area as well as completed a national tour with R&B/Soul artist Nick Waterhouse. 

******

After years of playing live, we are almost ready to release our debut album. But we still need YOUR help! We cannot wait for our music to tittilate your earbuds, but we still have a lot of hard work to do to make it happen. Please join in on this PEP-tastic journey and contribute today! Thank you for being a part of our story.
Love,
PEP

story:
My name's Don Vedda. I've recorded and toured for bands such as Dev, Jamie's Elsewhere, Casino Madrid, etc. & released my solo EP in late 2014. My band (Richie King & Jared Baez) and I, are trying to take this project to the next level, by doing a brand new album with legendary producer KRIS CRUMMETT! (Issues, Sleeping with Sirens, Dance Gavin Dance, etc.) We are doing this all without the help from a record label, which is so hard to do. Ever since our latest release, we've been quietly writing together to release the best group of songs possible, with the producer it deserves, Kris Crummett. We are so proud of the new material we have to offer on this new upcoming album, we can't wait to get in the studio and get to work! (: We promise this will be by far our best music to date!

 

Costs 

  • Full album (10 brand new songs) with Kris Crummett

  • Flights, gas, hotels, & equipment needed to get the album done

  • Guest Vocalists we have in mind (;

  • Music videos, marketing & promotion for the new record

  • Candy (just kidding)

 

All these costs are WELL over what we are asking. We will pay for whatever remainder we will have after our campaign. ANYTHING HELPS! To help make our new album possible, please donate or get yourself an awesome perk!!
