story:
The reason we're so excited is this: The Extreme Tour is not about music. It's not about gaining exposure/building a career, and it's not about making money. In fact, it's only by the grace of God working through generous donors that this cause is even possible. Every year, a staff of 30 or so unpaid volunteers organize tours that take place both in the US and internationally. So what is the Extreme Tour all about? It's about reaching youth who desperately need to hear the message of Christ. The tool used to do that? Music. However, we've been instructed to think of this tour as more of a Mission Trip than a "music tour", and that's what it is. Check out theextremetour.com for more information on the tour itself.

     The point of this fund raiser is this: we can only do this with additional financial support. Without putting ourselves in debt, we need the help of fellow Christians who believe this to be a worthy cause. Fortunately, a good portion of our food and lodging will be taken care of by the Extreme Tour. Gas will need to be paid for by us. In addition, we won't be making money on the road aside from merchandise sales. So, even in a best case scenario, we'll be going into August having lost significant income that we could have made had we stayed home. From a worldly perspective, a venture like this doesn't make sense. There's little to gain for us. There's no money to be made. But we, along with everyone involved in this cause, aren't just musicians. Like many of you reading this, we are warriors for the kingdom. We are servants of the Lord. We will go where God leads us to serve his people.

     With everything accounted for, our goal is $5000. However, if we don't reach our goal, we won't be worried. As He always does, our God will provide. If you feel called to help us out with any gift large or small, please do. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to contact us!
story_txt:
The reason we're so excited is this: The Extreme Tour is not about music. It's not about gaining exposure/building a career, and it's not about making money. In fact, it's only by the grace of God working through generous donors that this cause is even possible. Every year, a staff of 30 or so unpaid volunteers organize tours that take place both in the US and internationally. So what is the Extreme Tour all about? It's about reaching youth who desperately need to hear the message of Christ. The tool used to do that? Music. However, we've been instructed to think of this tour as more of a Mission Trip than a "music tour", and that's what it is. Check out theextremetour.com for more information on the tour itself.
     The point of this fund raiser is this: we can only do this with additional financial support. Without putting ourselves in debt, we need the help of fellow Christians who believe this to be a worthy cause. Fortunately, a good portion of our food and lodging will be taken care of by the Extreme Tour. Gas will need to be paid for by us. In addition, we won't be making money on the road aside from merchandise sales. So, even in a best case scenario, we'll be going into August having lost significant income that we could have made had we stayed home. From a worldly perspective, a venture like this doesn't make sense. There's little to gain for us. There's no money to be made. But we, along with everyone involved in this cause, aren't just musicians. Like many of you reading this, we are warriors for the kingdom. We are servants of the Lord. We will go where God leads us to serve his people. 
     With everything accounted for, our goal is $5000. However, if we don't reach our goal, we won't be worried. As He always does, our God will provide. If you feel called to help us out with any gift large or small, please do. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to contact us!

story:
Welcome!

My name is Rosa Pullman.  I am a singer, song writer, keyboard and guitar player based in Los Angeles, California.  That's me in the video up there (made by yours truly).  

I am currently working on finishing my second solo EP. 

(The music you hear in the video above is from the new EP!)

The first EP, called 'Dusty Road' (2011), was an acoustic recording made out in the high desert of Wonder Valley, CA.  The second recording I made was with the band I was in for three years called 'The Lovers' (2013).  That was a full length studio album made in Studio City, CA.  While playing with that band we enjoyed a two and a half year weekly residency at The Piano Bar in Hollywood and had many placements from that album on network TV shows such as 'Nashville'.  The most recent single under my own name, 'Daydreaming' (2015) was featured on the Australian TV show 'Wentworth' and was on Starbucks' in-store playlist earlier this year and has now been heard all over the world:  https://soundcloud.com/rosapullman-1/daydreaming-1

As life has its way of always changing, I have decided to make a new EP and its ALMOST DONE!

I was able to work with some of my favorite people and studios in Los Angeles (and Nashville) and have a put together a very beautiful and inspiring set of songs.  I can't wait for you to have them!

BASIC COSTS TO FINISH:

To finish this record and have it ready for you in both digital and physical form, the following costs remain:

$250 - studio time

$1500 - mix 5 songs

$500 - master 5 songs

$250 - CD manufacturing

Grand Total: $2500.00

As you can see, it is not going to take that much!

With your support and encouragement I hope to have this finished and delivered to you digitally next month (JULY).

MAKE HISTORY WITH ME!


By joining with me now on this effort we will be forever connected.  Some of you will have your name in the liner notes for all time (see the 'Benefactor' perk).  Your help and support will allow me to give this music to the world and you will be one of the very first to have it.

Any amount over the initial goal will go towards artwork and publicity and possibly more recording - we'll see how it goes!

Special Thanks to:

Matty Alger: co-producer, arrangement, drums, guitars, vocals, claps
Lindsay Lohden:  photography, claps
Clay Blair:  Boulevard Recording:  recording engineer, mixing
(thanks Omar and Sam!)
Frank DiVanna: bass, claps
John 'JT' Thomas: hammond organ, synthesizers
Brad Dujmovic: recording engineer, synthesizers, vocals, claps
Eric Holden: bass
Maesa Pullman: vocals, creative support, claps
Jason Hiller: creative support, claps
Natasha Agrama: creative support, claps
Frances Viggiani: executive producer extraordinaire

THANK YOU FOR COMING!


CHECK OUT THE SWEET PERKS!


LETS DO IT!


XOX

ROSA

story:
Short Summary

At the beginning of 2020, Stephen Court and I published STAYED, a short devotional book about the peace of God, with simple principles on how to maintain it. The book concludes with a 21-day devotional, and 7 songs for use in personal meditation and worship. I recorded the songs as demos with the intention of having them professionally produced and released at the same time as the book. Due to time constraints, the demos had to suffice! I'd love your help to get these seven songs professionally recorded.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the deal.

  • I'm aiming for at least $3500, which includes recording, mixing and mastering; the more that is pledged, the higher the quality of recording (all pledges go towards the cost of recording)
  • All pledges receive immediate downloads of all 7 demos
  • Pledges of $10 or more receive a 7 Ps of Perfect Peace bookmark
  • Pledges of $25 or more receive a copy of the STAYED devotional book
  • Pledges of $35 or more receive both bookmark and book

The Impact

You'll be helping me to create a quality worship soundtrack for people to play during their devotional time.

Risks & Challenges

Even if the goal is not reached, we will still go ahead with the recording, making use of whatever funds are pledged to make the highest quality recording possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with your friends!

Thank you, guys. Looking forward to bringing these songs to you.

story:
Set Me Free - By Janie Worm 2016  

The songs included on the upcoming CD are:

  • Shine
  • Love’s Embrace
  • Set Me Free
  • Cherokee Wisdom
  • Wake Up
  • Forgiveness
  • Fly
  • The Field
  • More Than Words
  • S-O-U-L, Soul
  • A Gift
  • Camp Nor’wester
  • Give a Little Love
  • Thy Own

Preview the first 2 songs at:

janieworm.bandcamp.com

About Janie

Open the link to this slideshow to learn more about Janie.  It is a pictorial version of the story written below, since... well, you know... a picture is worth a 1,000 words.  I am so grateful for all who have touched my life in any way.  Thank you!  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hwnvY-UwxJo 


My Story

Why am I recording a CD?

The one consistent activity in my life over the years in all my varied experiences, is creating music.  One of my earliest memories is of writing songs on my swing set with my guardian angels.  On our family dairy farm, I made musical instruments out of anything I could find, and often serenaded our cows and calves.  I think it must have been calming and healing for all concerned, as they would often relax and go to sleep.

When I was 11 years old, my mom asked what I wanted for Christmas, and I still very  clearly remember my response.  I said, “We probably can’t afford it, but more than anything I would love a guitar.”

Lo and behold, that year I received my first guitar!  Woohoo!  My mom said something to the effect of this being a $20 guitar from Walmart and that if I was serious, she would buy a nice guitar later. 

I was so thrilled with this little guitar that I could hardly put it down.  Even though I didn’t have song books or know how to read music, I doodled for hours on end.  Then, a couple of my older sister’s friends sketched some chord diagrams and showed me a few things.  That was the launch pad I needed to really get going.

After a year, my mom honored her promise and bought Aria, a full size guitar, for $178.  I was really smitten and continue to play this beautiful guitar today. (Check out the song titled, “Aria” on the Closer to Home CD.)

Music became part of our gatherings and time with neighbors.  I also began writing original songs and playing them for others.  The first real sharing was an original song I wrote in junior high for the girls basketball team, which I was part of.  

In high school, my twin brother and I sang with a handful of friends.  Soon we were leading a church folk choir for the high school services at the school we attended.  We were also asked to sing at weddings, parties and other events.

I am ever grateful for the amazing communities I have known and shared music with over the years.  Of course, that includes many sweet animals, my very large family, friends, athletic teams, school clubs, and church groups.  In college I continued to sing, performed with a band, and played for Parks & Recreation activities.  I also harmonized with fellow landscapers, and led sing-alongs as a Park Ranger.  

When I moved across the country, I began writing original songs with more focus and learned a lot from fellow musicians, sound engineers, poets and song writers.  In 1995 I recorded my first CD, The Journey, on a shoe string budget with recording engineer, Gary Mula.  It was an amazing experience! 

                                   Janie Worm & Gary Mula, 2015

Then, I began performing at festivals, coffee houses, spiritual seminars, and other venues on a regular basis.  A few years later, in 2003, I recorded two more CD’s, Closer to Home and Higher Ground.  Common sources of inspiration for my songs are nature, relationships, personal life experiences and spiritual exploration.  

A move to the midwest for a graduate degree in counseling and wilderness work, was also conducive for honing my skills.  While continuing to write and perform, I learned about music therapy and healing.  My internship included music and drumming with seniors, which I thoroughly enjoy.

No matter what I am doing… whether painting, gardening, hiking, or cooking… there is always a song in my heart.  I often whistle or sing through daily activities when alone.  In the morning when I wake up, I usually have a tune on my lips, or a melody lightly coming through.

So, music has been a constant companion throughout my life.  Regardless of what line of work I am in, or however many jobs I am doing, music is present and vital to who I am.  In fact, I like to think that it is the primary gift that I am to share with those around me.  

Now, in 2016, it is time to record another CD called Set Me Free.  Many of you know these tunes, as I have played them over the last few years.  And for those who have gently asked time and again when they will be available, the answer is, “Real soon.”

Thank you so much for supporting my work and who I am.  It  is an ongoing adventure to pursue what I love to do in this world, and an honor to share it.  I appreciate all who have encouraged me, sung with me, and have asked me to write songs for their weddings and worship services.  I am truly blessed and grateful.

In the words of one of my completed songs for this CD, “Shine”, I want to say, “My love is yours, and yours is mine.  Together we shine, shine, shine, shine, shine.”*

May we all support each other in finding a way to do what we love.  Thank you again!  May the blessings be!

Janie

*You can listen to “Shine” and “Love’s Embrace” on Janie’s Band Camp page.

Shine

Love's Embrace

Cost of the Recording Project

Below is an image showing the estimated minimum cost of recording this full-length CD.  The nutshell version of the diagrams below:
Studio Time ($500 per day X 12 days) = $6,000                                                                                                                                         Mixing $2,500                                                                                                                                      Mastering $500                                                                                           CD Duplication (standard run) $1,000
                                                     Total = $10,000 

This is the minimum cost estimated for this recording project. There is the possibility for fluctuation in what is needed, but a base goal of $10K will get us in the ballpark of creating a high quality, professional product.

Thank you so much for your generous love and support!

The Impact

My goal, when writing music, is to be a clear instrument for divine love.  Just as I wrote songs on my swing set with the guidance of my guardian angels as a child, I continue to write with inner guidance today.  I firmly believe that we all have something beautiful and unique to contribute to the world, and we owe it to ourself to discover it.  Whether sharing music or helping a friend in need, I am most happy when I am engaged with life.  Each day offers opportunities to learn, grow and practice being more loving than the day before.  My hope is that the music on this CD will also touch, uplift and inspire others in some way.  

Chance & Coincidence

The goal of this IndieGogo campaign is to raise the funds needed to record a full-length CD in a professional recording studio.  It is a possibility that more money is needed than estimated.  In such a case, I have some ideas.  Coming from a "can do" farm family, I know that there are many ways to achieve a goal.  So I am prepared to get creative and make this work one way or another.  That may involve some DIY strategies, bartering/ trading, accepting generous offers from professionals in the music field, noticing amazing coincidences and saying "yes" to miracles, and other options.  Either way, the show must go on.  I trust that each step of the way will be perfect! As my song says in the video, "About Janie", I must "have a little faith."

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who are not able to contribute monetarily at this time, there are others ways to support the efforts of this campaign.

  • Please help to get the word out about this project!
  • Introduce my music to those you feel would enjoy it! 
  • Download songs for $1 from my other CD's at my Band Camp page!
  • Check out the Indiegogo share tools!  They are easy to use.
  • Consider me for professional, interior painting!
  • Send a little love!

Thanks so much!  May the blessings be!

story:
WHO WE ARE ?

Steinway Piano Artist and multiple Juno award winning Canadian composer, David Braid, is thrilled to collaborate with the daring Epoque String Quartet from Prague. Called "The Czech Kronos" by the Prague Post, Epoque truly links the beauty of "old-world" string quartet sound with "new-world" contemporary music. Between March 26-April 6, 2016, Braid and Epoque together embark on a debut tour in Canada to perform in Concerts Halls, Conservatories, Music clubs, and schools to inspire audiences and students alike.

The goal of their performances is to provide a sensual experience in acoustic sound that is artistically presented, narrative-driven, and rendered in the most beautiful colours of strings and piano. They want their program to "get under your skin" in a fresh way that engages and complements your imagination.

Their recording of Braid's works was completed in November 2015 at the Czech National TV studio, and mixed and mastered in the United States by multi-grammy award winning engineer, Dixon Van Winkle. The CD artwork features the stunning oil painting "Qi" by artist Sophia Gao, great-great granddaughter of Xu Yefen, one of "The Eight Grandmasters" of Qing Dynasty art.


                                               Preview the recording here!


The  natural  state  of  a  musician  is  to  be  a  freelancer  and  a self-employed, self-organized artist - many other forms can be constrictive to the flow of creativity.  This campaign explores an avenue to overcome financial constraints holding back the creative pursuit to put engaging and accessible art music back into the mainstream.



                                                           ----------------------

             "In the classical scene, The Epoque Quartet earns the nickname

                                      the Czech Kronos "  - The Prague Post


          "...one of Canada’s true renaissance men when it comes to music

                                     is pianist David Braid" - Ottawa Citizen


                                                            ----------------------


S ČÍM SE NA VÁS OBRACÍME ?

Kanada si nás doslova našla. Skvělý kanadský klavírista a komponista David Braid nás jednoho dne vyzval ke spolupráci a my neřekli ne :-) A to bylo dobře ! CD "Flow", které jsme spolu natočili v Praze, míchá v těchto dnech v New Yorku několikanásobný nositel ocenění Grammy Dixon Van Winkle a nás čeká za pár týdnů cesta za oceán, kde tento projekt představíme kanadské veřejnosti !



TROCHU PODROBNĚJI...

Na přelomu března a dubna 2016 letí hrát náš ansámbl Epoque Quartet poprvé na severoamerický kontinent. Potvrzeno je osm koncertů s klavíristou Davidem Braidem v různých koutech Kanady (Toronto, Ottawa, Montreal, Antigonish...) Turné , na kterém budeme křtít naši novou společnou desku, se dostalo záštity ambasády ČR v Kanadě a podpory tamního Československého krajanského sdružení, jakož i podpory několika kanadských univerzit a dalších institucí. Nebýt několika posledních ekonomických úskalí mohli bychom se nyní už jen těšit na podařené CD a skvělé turné, plné nové muziky. S vaší pomocí tato úskalí jistě překonáme !!!


CO NABÍZÍME

Za Vaši finanční podporu, která nám pomůže dostat CD na svět , jsme pro Vás připravili celou řadu benefitů. Doufáme, že Vám některý z nich padne do oka a udělá Vám radost ! Nemějte obavy z částek uvedených v amerických dolarech,  Váš příspěvek bude technicky velmi snadno realizován a poplatek za transakci nepřesáhne 3 procenta z poukázané částky. Pro lepší přehled vždy uvádíme i orientační hodnotu v českých korunách. Pro jakékoliv dotazy nás neváhejte oslovit zde v sekci "comments" , nebo na adrese epoque@post.cz !



       PODPOROU TOHOTO PROJEKTU UDĚLÁTE RADOST MINIMÁLNĚ PĚTI

     HUDEBNÍKŮM  A PŘEDEVŠÍM SAMI SOBĚ ! VŠEM MOC DĚKUJEME !!! :-)





                 David Braid Facebook                                        David Braid website

    

                                                      Epoque Quartet Facebook
story_txt:
WHO WE ARE ?
Steinway Piano Artist and multiple Juno award winning
Canadian composer, David Braid, is thrilled to collaborate with the daring Epoque String Quartet from Prague. Called "The Czech Kronos" by the Prague Post, Epoque truly links the beauty of "old-world" string quartet sound with "new-world" contemporary music. Between March 26-April 6,
2016, Braid and Epoque together embark on a debut tour in Canada to perform in Concerts Halls, Conservatories, Music clubs, and schools to inspire audiences and students alike. 

The goal of their performances is to provide a sensual
experience in acoustic sound that is artistically presented, narrative-driven,
and rendered in the most beautiful colours of strings and piano. They want their
program to "get under your skin" in a fresh way that engages and
complements your imagination. 
Their recording of Braid's works was completed in November 2015 at the Czech
National TV studio, and mixed and mastered in the United States by multi-grammy award winning
engineer, Dixon Van Winkle. The CD artwork features the stunning oil painting "Qi" by artist Sophia Gao, great-great granddaughter of Xu Yefen, one of "The Eight Grandmasters" of Qing Dynasty art.

                                               Preview the recording here!

The  natural  state  of  a  musician  is  to  be  a  freelancer  and  a self-employed, self-organized artist - many other forms can be 
constrictive to the flow of creativity.  This campaign explores an avenue to overcome 
financial constraints holding back the creative pursuit to put engaging and accessible art music back into the mainstream.



                                                           ----------------------
             "In the classical scene, The Epoque Quartet earns the nickname 
                                      the Czech Kronos "  - The Prague Post

          "...one of Canada’s true renaissance men when it comes to music
                                     is pianist David Braid" - Ottawa Citizen
                                                            ----------------------



S ČÍM SE NA VÁS OBRACÍME ?
Kanada si nás doslova našla. Skvělý kanadský klavírista a komponista David Braid nás jednoho dne vyzval ke spolupráci a my neřekli ne :-) A to bylo dobře ! CD "Flow", které jsme spolu natočili v Praze, míchá v těchto dnech v New Yorku několikanásobný nositel ocenění Grammy Dixon Van Winkle a nás čeká za pár týdnů cesta za oceán, kde tento projekt představíme kanadské veřejnosti !




TROCHU PODROBNĚJI...
Na přelomu března a dubna 2016 letí hrát náš ansámbl Epoque Quartet poprvé na severoamerický kontinent. Potvrzeno je osm koncertů s
klavíristou Davidem Braidem v různých koutech Kanady (Toronto, Ottawa,
Montreal, Antigonish...) Turné , na kterém budeme křtít naši novou společnou
desku, se dostalo záštity ambasády ČR v Kanadě a podpory tamního
Československého krajanského sdružení, jakož i podpory několika kanadských
univerzit a dalších institucí. Nebýt několika posledních ekonomických úskalí mohli bychom se nyní už jen těšit na podařené CD a skvělé turné,
plné nové muziky. S vaší pomocí tato úskalí jistě překonáme !!!



CO NABÍZÍME
Za Vaši finanční podporu, která nám pomůže dostat CD na svět
, jsme pro Vás připravili celou řadu benefitů. Doufáme, že Vám některý z nich
padne do oka a udělá Vám radost ! Nemějte obavy z částek uvedených v amerických
dolarech,  Váš příspěvek bude technicky
velmi snadno realizován a poplatek za transakci nepřesáhne 3 procenta z
poukázané částky. Pro lepší přehled vždy uvádíme i orientační hodnotu v českých
korunách. Pro jakékoliv dotazy nás neváhejte oslovit zde v sekci "comments"
, nebo na adrese epoque@post.cz !


       PODPOROU TOHOTO PROJEKTU UDĚLÁTE RADOST MINIMÁLNĚ PĚTI 
     HUDEBNÍKŮM  A PŘEDEVŠÍM SAMI SOBĚ ! VŠEM MOC DĚKUJEME !!! :-)

                                                      Epoque Quartet Facebook

story:
The rundown

As I've said before, my name is Henry Cline and I'm an author/musician in Mustang, OK. Ever since I was seven, I've always been big into writing novels and short stories and such... but when I finally felt that I was good enough at guitar, I really became serious about the idea of making a full ten track album of my songs. Even though I've written twenty-seven songs, I feel that the ten songs on this debut album fit together perfectly. 

 

Although the album doesn't actually have a song titled, Resilience, the ten songs on this album seem to have a common theme. That, no matter what challenges we may face in our lives, we must power through with resilience. 

 

I won't go too much into my personal life, but I will say that I've already faced some intense challenges and loses. But although this album was made because I wanted to do it, I know that my father would've wanted me to make it as well. So, this album is for him, it's for me, and, of course, it's for you.

 

Resilience is for anyone who loves and appreciates music. I think there's a song for every kind of person on this album, whether it's someone who wants something soft and comforting, maybe something more rock oriented and heavy, or maybe both in the same song! ... No screaming vocals, though... just singing :) But we have one acoustic track (Ups & Downs), a mildly silly song (Mr. Murphy), and the rest are a mixed bag of goodies! Trust me! But, they all fall under the genre of rock... so don't think that this is some reggae-pop album or something.

 

This album was quite a shot in the dark when I first started pursuing it, but as I said, fans of mine demanded it and I wanted to deliver. So, with the help of Russ, Joshua, Addam, and Ivan, we bring you my very first album, Resilience.

 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read all of this. All funds are greatly appreciated and will be used for the production and distribution of my album. 

 

-Henry

 

If I meet/exceed my goal...

 

As I've looked at other Indiegogo pages and campaigns, I've noticed something... most of them make promises to do other events or awesome things if they meet or exceed their goal! Or even if they just get close to their goal! So, in that case... here we go:

 

$500 raised: I plan on doing this anyway, but I will make sure our promo video (coming soon) is the bees knees.

 

$800 (goal) met: CDs will be put on the fast track to production, and might be available sooner than October 14th (target release date for the album, or maybe the 21st depending on how fast the Indiegogo funds come in.

 

$1,500-$1,600 raised: Not only will we have an awesome promo video, but we will make a music video for one of the other songs on the album! Don't worry, the music video won't be too wacky... unless you'd like that.

 

$2,500 raised: If this happened, I would be pretty blown away! Not that I think it's impossible, however... anyway! If this happens, why not make a second music video, with a professional cast and explosions and such!? (Explosions may be hazardous and not included). I'd be lying if I said I didn't have any cool ideas for music videos... just need the help of Russ and such.

 

$5,000 or more raised: Multiple shows in Oklahoma at different venues! The money would help me hire professional musicians and market the show and all that good stuff!

 

$10,000 or more raised: At this point, I'd just temporarily quit my job and go on tour if it really does this well... haha! I'll just have to put a band together.

 

Special thanks

 

I meant to put this information the first time around, but I'd like to thank a few people real quick, if I may! Of course, I want to thank my family and friends. Their constant support and love has given me the confidence to do a crazy project like this, and I know that anyone who listens to the album will be pleased!

 

I'd like to thank Molly Jameson, who made a generous donation at the very beginning of the recording process! Your kindness and friendship will always be remembered.

 

I'd like to thank my Uncle Roy, who has been playing the bass forever and taught me how to re-string a guitar for the first time! His influence and help over the years have definitely helped me in my musician life! Also, my very first guitar teacher, Mike Satawake, for getting me started and sending me down the right path! And, the great Will Galbraith, for extending my guitar playing knowledge to brand new levels! I wouldn't be anywhere near as good at guitar if it wasn't for the three of you.

 

I'd like to thank the following music stores for all their advice/help: Guitar Center, OKC Music & Sound, and Larsen's Music Co.! Without the professionals at these establishments, my path to recording this album would've been a lot more skewed... or, I might've been dumb enough to use an instrument cable as a speaker cable. We don't have to specify which one they helped with more than the other.

 

And... I think that's everyone for now! If I missed out on thanking you, then you can yell at me later and I'll update this section!

story:
A HOME CONCERT TOUR 

EUROPE and CANADA



After playing over 75 intimate home concerts around the world, Jesse Macht has again been invited to play in homes throughout Europe and Canada.

Embarking on this kind of refreshing concert experience, we're making an unconventional proposal to help make it happen this coming summer. 


  • We are hoping that Jesse's fan-base, past hosts, potential hosts and other friends and family who have already experienced the intimacy and power of these home concerts will Pay It Forward and support this new venture. 

  • We're looking for contributions to help CROWD-FUND these concerts for fans who may not be able to cover the costs of the concert on their own (and will also help defray Jesse's travel expenses). 

YES THIS IS A BIG ASK - HELP SOMEONE ELSE HAVE A CONCERT! We are reaching out on behalf of new audiences for Jesse Macht who want the experience of a home concert, but have the challenge of getting him across the Atlantic.


GOALS

  • $10,000 will facilitate concerts in England, Scotland, Ireland, Germany, Netherlands, Switzerland, France, and Canada. 
  • $7000 will create concerts in England, Scotland, Ireland, Germany, Switzerland, and Canada
  • $5000 will create concerts in England, Scotland, Ireland, and Canada
Our heart-felt appreciation for your monetary support will enable you to get live on-line performances from hotspots around the world during  this tour. We will also include access to streams of each home concert.

You will be a very vital part of the Home Concert experience as we share our trip and living rooms with you. And, another added bonus is that you can connect with new people who share the same love for music and for Jesse's songwriting along the way.


IF we are UNABLE to reach the first $5000  goal, the concerts will not be able to happen on this go-around and YOUR DONATION WILL BE REFUNDED back to you. Of course it would be unfortunate, but hopefully another time soon we will be able to do so. 



FOR THE HOSTS:

If you are a host in the first goal set and you can afford the $700 donation or portion thereof, we ask that you contribute to the INDIEGOGO campaign as soon as possible to help us reach our goal faster and start the momentum. If you are not a host in that "goal set", please feel free to donate, but know that it does not guarantee a show in your sets. If we reach the $5000 then the hosts in the second goal set should contribute their $700 or portion thereof to try and reach the $7500 goal. If we reach the $7500 goal, then the hosts in the third set should contribute their $700 or portion thereof to try and reach the $10,000 goal. 

First Goal Set:

May 27th - Torbay, Southwest England. with Peta

May 28th - Wolverhampton, England with Nigel

May 29th - Manchester, England with Penni

May 30th - East Anglia, England with Adele

June 3 (preferable) or 4 - Edinburgh, Scotland with Deb


Second Goal Set: 

June 6, 7, or 8 - Antwerp, Belgium with Sara

June 10 - Cologne, Germany with Verena

June 11 - Cologne, Germany with Marcia

June 12 or 13 - Munich, Germany with Swantje


Third Goal Set

June 15th - Montreal with Annie or Stephanie

June 16th - Montreal with Annie or Stephanie.

story:
Project Summary

Requesting your valuable sponsorship for the Third Musical Project of the Venezuelan composer Abraham Gustin.

My name is Abraham Gustin and I am a Venezuelan Composer and Visual Artist. By means of this proposal I would like to invite you to join me at my crowdfunding campaign in Indiegogo in order to help me to produce & record my new musical project.

By the time being I have already released two previous albums.  The first was “La Casa de David” released in 2006 and the second was “Blue” released in November of 2009. I am ready to launch this new CD, my third album, which includes a compilation of my most recent composition in which I will also be playing the piano in some of the tracks.

I’m really excited about this, for the past 4 and a half years I have been working on the whole project that includes 12 tracks. I think it would be a great opportunity to present my music to the world and promote it at an international level.

My music is a kind of instrumental music with a symphonic structure. Usually in all my pieces I have been using a string quartet as a basic format joined with my piano and other guest soloists of the woodwind or brass instruments. My work is a kind of world music with a strong flavor of soundtrack.

All the recording channels are mostly played by live musicians, and the majority are invited from the Symphonic System of Orchestras in Venezuela.  Furthermore and for this particular project I have invited the well-known arranger Franco Castellani who currently lives and works in San Diego, California. Also will participate in some arrangements the Venezuelan composer and orchestrator José Baroni, internationally recognized by the Chamber Music Prize of the Berlin Opera in 2011.

Besides, being the composer of all the music of this CD, I will make my debut as orchestrator in one of the pieces of this album.

These kind of projects usually needs many recording channels for each track. I feel that I am proposing a real soundtrack of an imaginary story as the conductor of each composition. I am creating in this new CD multiple textures developed in different marvelous melodies.

The sample video herewith enclosed reflects my musical proposal.  You will therefore listen to the quality and style of my music, soundtracks are taken from my previous albums. Also feel free to do any research on the style of my music on the Internet.

These projects involve usually many people such as guest musicians, the recording studio (approximately 120 hours of recording), recording engineers, the arrangers, the mix engineer, mastering, the designer of the discs and of course the final print of the CDs. I am setting a goal to raise $10,000 USD. This money will be used to pay the musicians, the studio time, mixing and mastering the record. Funds will also be used to pay the physical product (CDs).

These are complex processes that require financial support for its implementation, and that is why my crowdfunding campaign in Indiegogo would be a perfect way to make it a reality.

I have the feeling that this project is a higher octave over my past production. That is why I need your support to complete all the funds necessary for the completion of this wonderful album. I can assure you that at the end you will receive as a reward a final product that you will love and enjoy.

The estimated date for the public release of my new album is the month of December 2016.

I do look forward with great interest your valuable support to receive the necessary impulse to fulfill this new production. Just make up your mind and contribute now to my project by choosing between one of the perks that appear on the right side of the screen. Join me in this great musical journey toward a new pulse of life.

Thank you for your support!


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if contributing financially is not for you, there are other important ways you can be an important part of my project. 

Simply use the Indiegogo share tools and let your friends on social media know about this wonderful project.

story:
Keep the Electric (Music) On!

Electric Berea exists to promote live local amplified music in the Berea, Kentucky area.  Although our small Appalachian town is best known for its bluegrass, folk, and other acoustic-based musical acts, there's so much more that you can hear here.  In order to bring diverse genres of plugged-in music (country, funk, jazz, reggae, rock, etc.) to our hometown audiences at no cost to the public while still paying fair compensation to local performers, we need your financial help. 

What We Need & What You Get

Thus far, anonymous donors and private sponsors have enabled us to meet 60% of our fundraising goal for our next event on May 16, 2020.  But we still need $500 to be able to pay all of the performers that we hope to bring to you!

  • All funds raised go directly to the performers.
  • Donors at the $100 level and above will be recognized publicly through all advertising for the event as well as during onstage announcements at the event!
  • If we are unable to meet our target amount, whatever amount is raised will be used to fund a reduced version of the event.  

 

Why You Should Donate

Back in the 1960s and '70s, many Americans grew up with live music all around them -- and not just celebrity performers, but their next-door neighbors.  It has been estimated that, at one point in the late 1960s, 1 out of 4 young Americans were playing in a garage band.  When kids went to their middle and high school dances, they often were entertained by local musicians. 

These days, most kids grow up seeing live music only on YouTube or some other screen.  Their school dances feature music provided by DJs.   Much of this music is produced electronically using computers, drum machines, and audio samples rather than directly performed on actual musical instruments held in the hands.  All of this music is made by people whom they've never met and who may seem impossibly talented and remote from their own experience and potential.  Many kids today simply don't know how powerful, inspirational, and above all, fun it can be to see folks who are not too much older than they are making live music in a variety of genres on real musical instruments, singing without AutoTune.  If we want there to be next-generation-equivalents of Hank Williams, Elvis Presley, Aretha Franklin, Stevie Wonder, Prince, or Kurt Cobain, then we need to show youth in our community that it's possible (and, again, FUN!) to pick up a guitar, a keyboard, or a drum kit and make music in public.

Donating to support Electric Berea performer fees not only helps to bring live, local amplified music to the community free of charge.  Your donation also contributes to fair wages for gigging musicians in our community, many of whom are frequently asked to play "for exposure" (i.e., no financial compensation).  In our community, where almost 1 out of 4 residents live below the poverty line (a rate which is more than twice the national average of 13%), arts events must offer free admission in order to attract an audience.  

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone is able to spare the fund to contribute to our campaign, but there are other ways in which you can help:

  • Spread the word about Electric Berea on social media and everyday interactions!
  • Encourage your friends, family, and neighbors to donate!
  • Share the link to this campaign online!
  • Show up, listen, and clap your hands on May 16, 2020!
story_txt:
Keep the Electric (Music) On!
Electric Berea exists to promote live local amplified music in the Berea, Kentucky area.  Although our small Appalachian town is best known for its bluegrass, folk, and other acoustic-based musical acts, there's so much more that you can hear here.  In order to bring diverse genres of plugged-in music (country, funk, jazz, reggae, rock, etc.) to our hometown audiences at no cost to the public while still paying fair compensation to local performers, we need your financial help. 

What We Need & What You Get
Thus far, anonymous donors and private sponsors have enabled us to meet 60% of our fundraising goal for our next event on May 16, 2020.  But we still need $500 to be able to pay all of the performers that we hope to bring to you!


All funds raised go directly to the performers.

Donors at the $100 level and above will be recognized publicly through all advertising for the event as well as during onstage announcements at the event!
If we are unable to meet our target amount, whatever amount is raised will be used to fund a reduced version of the event.

Show up, listen, and clap your hands on May 16, 2020!

story:
I need a bit of help to get to the finishing line

In October 2019 I recorded a few demos in my friends' house while they were on holidays. I then sent these recordings to Stefan Breuer in Bilthoven, the Netherlands. He saw their potential, and I wish I could say the rest is history, but we're quite there yet. So much work has gone into adding instruments, re-recording guitar here and there, and then there was the minor barrier of the global pandemic.

If my music is new to you, allow me to introduce myself -

  • I'm Geri van Essen, living in the east end of London, a folk singer with some soul and blues influences. I do also have a day job but despite this there are not quite enough funds for the last lap of the process to bring my new album into the world.
  • The working title of the album is Cleaned the Windows
  • These songs are all new, and written by myself. Main themes: connection, loneliness, distance, home life. The sound is a mix of melancholy and groovy soul.
  • The first single came out in June 2020: 23/32 (see the video)
  • My debut album was well received and resulted in a Radio 6 live performance and interview in March 2018

 

I only need £490 

The break-down is simple -

  • 270 euro for the mastering
  • 270 euro for the printing of 200 cds

 

The impact

The direct result of your support for my project will be that I can set the mastering and printing process in motion. Please back my project because:

  • Whilst it is a personal document of the last few years, I hope it will speak to others and enable reflection on the themes of the album. Since March 2020 my songs about loneliness, distance and connection have received a new layer of meaning. We've all had to adapt to new ways of connecting to others since March 2020.
  • Mastering is an important part of the process to release an album and I'm pleased to have selected one of the best for a very reasonable price.
  • If you back this project, not only will you receive a copy of the album (either digital or physical), you will also enable others to discover, stream and buy my new music.

 

Risks

There are little to no risks involved in this project because the recording and mixing have been finalised. The person who will carry out the final mastering, is ready to go once I have the funds. Following that there are no obstacles to getting 200 cds printed.

 

Other ways you can help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • I'd be grateful if you could spread the word about this campaign to people
  • Do use the Indiegogo share tool

story:
Hi there, my name is Chris Rattie. I’m a songwriter living, working, and creating in Central Pennsylvania. I’ve been a touring musician since my early 20’s; music is my life and I am fortunate to get to do what I love. In 2013 I independently released my debut album All These Things. I put together a band and off we went. We hit the road and met so many great people- curious about a band they’d never heard of and willing to check us out. It’s one of the best parts about playing music.

Around this time I moved into an old farmhouse with my lady and began writing some new songs. For the first time in years I felt at home; I had found my place. The essence of our country home was the front porch. We drank our morning coffee there. It was where friends met on summer nights, music from the record player drifting through our screen door. We talked about our future and argued about politics. We smoked too many cigarettes on that porch. One time, a traveling folk-punk string band used it to put on a show for our neighbors.

I wrote most of these new songs sitting there, eyeballing the occasional car that drove by a little too fast and waving at those that kept it in the friendly speed range. The songs on Porch are direct reflections of what was happening that first summer and winter in our new home. They are about finding our place, about our joys and worries, and our dubiety at the world we watched changing so quickly from that well worn porch. The songs are about facets of life that ring true for everyone, no matter where your porch is.

In 2015 the band and I began recording these songs. Some like-minded folks we knew started a label and we decided to make a record with them. It was all quite exciting; unfortunately the record label folded- It happens- Often times our dreams are much bigger than our billfold and we slam hard into brick walls of reality. My band and I are now left with a complete album, but lack the funds to release it. We are so proud of this new music and are excited and eager to share it.

We need you, the good people we’ve met along the way, and maybe some who we’ve yet to meet, to help us get this record out. It would mean so much to us. We’ve worked so hard and can’t stop now.

How It All Breaks Down

Mastering: $1,000:

This is the final step in the process. Mastering is often referred to as a “Dark Art”, as it is so difficult to describe what a mastering engineer actually does. Simply put, it’s the final layer of polish. It’s what makes a song jump out of your speakers and rumble your floor.

Printing Vinyl: $2,000

Is there anything better than dropping the needle on a great record? We are really excited about ours and feel that everyone needs to hear it in the best possible way.

CDs and Digital Downloads: $600

Hey, you can’t listen to vinyl in your car…. And we hope you’ll take this record with you everywhere.

Graphic Design:  

We are working with H6 Design on our new website as well as artwork for the album and will be setting aside a portion of the funds raised to help pay for this.

Campaign Expense:

We will be setting aside a percentage of the funds raised to pay our good friends Dave Metty and Denis Alan for making an excellent campaign video, and to cover the cost of shipping our pledge packages to you!

Van & Touring Expense:

Touring is our business and livelihood. We are excited to be working with our new booking partner at Blue Moon Management and we have some big release shows planned this fall. We just need a way to get there! Any remaining funds we raise will go towards buying a van and the expenses of hitting the road. We want to come to your town and play for you. Nothing would make us happier!

Check out the perks available here in return for your pledge or simply use the  ‘BACK IT’ button to make a donation in an amount of your choosing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, I totally understand that even a few dollars can be really tough for some of us to do. If you’d still like to help, please share our campaign on social media or with anyone you think might be interested. We’d really appreciate it!

 

Thank you so much for taking time out of your day to visit the campaign and consider a pledge toward Porch. It is a huge help if you decide to get involved.

-Chris

story:
Pryvit!

My name is Auresia and it is my dream to record a Ukrainian Reggae Album in Ukraine! The album will be called Korinnya (meaning roots in Ukrainian) and I will be mixing traditional Ukrainian instrumentation with roots reggae rhythms. I have already been in contact with some of  the top  World, Jazz and Reggae musicians and studios that Ukraine has to offer and am very excited as they have expressed a lot of interest in working together on this album. I cannot wait to share  the positive vibes of reggae with the Ukrainian people.

I plan to record at one of Ukraine's most prestigious recording studios in Kiev- ISTOK  under the reknown producer/engineer, Aleksy Krivosheyev (Skay, Jamala, Ivan Dorn, Oleg Skrypka, Bahroma Band, Poshlaya Molly, Dilara & Samra(Eurovision)).

Marina Krut (from my latest music video-Raíces) who was recently a semi- finalist on XFactor is one of the top Ukrainian Bandura  players and will be performing on the album. I have been in touch with Denis Shvets on drums (SunSay), guitarist Roman Kucherenko (SunSay/ 5Nizza), bassist Nikita Astrakhantsev (Antytila, MamaRika), amoungst others who are very interested as well. The goal of the album will be 10 songs with 4 of them to be recorded with these top musicians. The other 6 songs  I will be re-releasing Ukrainian versions translated from some of my favorite songs from my previous albums adding Ukrainian ehancements. Other than the Bandura , I would love to incorporate other Ukrainian traditional instruments such as Sopilka (wooden flute) and Cimbalom (dulcimer). As well I will make space on the album for a couple song tributes to the Ukrainian tradition , including my dad and his wonderful accordion:-)

 

So...this is where you come in. I actually need your contributions & help to make this happen! This album will cost me about 12 K to make.  In Ukraine the expenses for the album will be much less than my other albums cost but still a lot of funding to come up with and not possible without your help. As a solo and independent artist, I will not be able to do this without YOU!

Here are some of the major costs involved:

  • Translation (of the songs and make sure they flow like poetry and make sense and beauty)
  • Recording studio time
  • Engineer
  • Producer
  • Musicians fees
  • Rehearsal Space
  • Mixing engineer
  • Mastering
  • Transportation ( Plane, Trains, Buses, Taxis) & Accomodation (for myself and the musicians in the city where the studio is located).
  • Professional Photo shoot for the album and press.
  • Graphic designer ( for the design and layout of the album and download cards).
  • Manufacturing of CD's and digital download cards
  • Music Video for the first single.

 

FUN PERKS FOR YOU for YOUR GENEROUS SUPPORT!

  • Ukrainian Pottery personalized by the artist
  • Essential Oil Blend made for your personal needs 
  • Organic vegan chocolate truffles and treats by yours truly
  • Many more things you can check  out on the platform!

BONUS: Everyone who contributes 15$ or more a FREE DIGITAL DOWNLOAD FOR THE  NEW ALBUM- “Korinnya’!”  & FREE AURESIA  Lioness Sticker.

  • All Contributers will receive 1st access to the new Record- “Korinnya” before the rest of the world.
  • After I reach my goal I will be donating 40 % of my proceeds to the Multiple Sclerosis Canadian Foundation, one of the causes that is most dear to me!

If everyone on my Facebook fan page donated 5$, it would be more than enough to make this goal happen.

To record this album- Korinnya in Ukraine tickles my soul, and  would make my dreams come true!  I will get to connect to my Ukrainian roots and culture on a deeper level and it will be a great opportunity to break into a new international market-  one that makes sense.  I look forward to pushing my boundaries as an artist as I challenge myself to write, create and deliver this music from my heart.

Reggae is the music of positive transformation and Ukraine is ready for reggae music to break and spread positive vibes. After many years of turbulence, there is a desire for a peaceful revolution of the heart and mind through music, and reggae vibes are at the heart of that.

Thank you so much for reading, supporting and sharing this campaign with your friends and networks. That is really the only way I'll be able to do this! ONE LOVE!

Merci beaucoup! Muchas Gracias, Duje Dyakuyu!

 

If you can do only one thing- please share with your entire social networks!

Need some ideas?

  • Email!, Facebook!, Instagram! Blogs!, YouTube! Music! Forums!

Thanks a million! I can't wait to get started!!

XOXO

<3 Auresia

story:
Hello there metalheads and headbangers of the world! We are The Silent Wedding from Athens, Greece and we are pleased to meet you. So far we have released an EP and two full length albums "Livin' Experiments" and "Enigma Eternal”. Moreover,  we have, five official video releases: To Them, The Return, A Dream of Choices, Silence, Loneliness. Since 2012 we have participated in four European tours and mini tours with bands such as Threshold, Maiden United and Voodoo Six. We have also shared the stage with Iced Earth, Saxon, Epica, Firewind, Fates Warning, Warrel Dane, Timo Tolkki (ex. Stratovarious), Tygers Of Pan Tang, Caravan, Lizzy Borden.

Touring is obviously our favorite part of playing in this band. Every single show is important to us because there’s no better way to share our music with the world. In 2014 we toured with Threshold across Europe in over 10 countries and 19 shows in total. Now we are getting ready to rock Europe again on our next tour with this amazing band from Oct. 10th till Oct. 21st (tour dates bellow). So far we have made all of this possible with our own efforts, the incomes of our live shows, albums, T-shirts and variable merchandise. As you probably know, things have been difficult in Greece for pretty much everyone and it hasn't been any different for us. For those of you who know us or have seen us perform live, you know we always give 100% of our energy in every show, no matter the difficulties we face. In the case of this tour, we are thrilled to share the stage with Threshold once again but in all honesty, we were also concerned what that means for our budget.

This is why we turn to you, our friends and fans. We've created this page offering a series of perks and some indiegogo exclusives which you can purchase. This will not only help us with our tour alongside Threshold but also with the release of our third album which is already in the process of pre-production. The smallest contribution will be invaluable to us. We hope to see you soon on the nearest gig. Until then, rock on and stay heavy!

 

 

Tour dates:

10.10. DE Aachen – Musikbunker

11.10. CH Pratteln – Z7

12.10. DE Aschaffenburg – Colos-Saal

13.10. NL Zoetermeer – Boerderij

14.10. DE Hamburg – Markthalle

16.10. DE Jena – F-Haus

17.10. CZ Prague – Nová Chmelnice

18.10. DE Munich – Feierwerk

19.10. DE Mannheim – MS Connexion Complex

20.10. DE Essen – Turock

21.10. UK London – Islington Assembly Hall

In the case of this tour, we are thrilled to share the stage with Threshold once again but in all honesty, we were also concerned what that means for our budget.
This is why we turn to you, our friends and fans. We've created this page offering a series of perks and some indiegogo exclusives which you can purchase. This will not only help us with our tour alongside Threshold but also with the release of our third album which is already in the process of pre-production. The smallest contribution will be invaluable to us. We hope to see you soon on the nearest gig. Until then, rock on and stay heavy!
 
 
Tour dates:
10.10. DE Aachen – Musikbunker
11.10. CH Pratteln – Z7
12.10. DE Aschaffenburg – Colos-Saal
13.10. NL Zoetermeer – Boerderij
14.10. DE Hamburg – Markthalle
16.10. DE Jena – F-Haus
17.10. CZ Prague – Nová Chmelnice
18.10. DE Munich – Feierwerk
19.10. DE Mannheim – MS Connexion Complex
20.10. DE Essen – Turock
21.10. UK London – Islington Assembly Hall

story:
Vian dans les dents!

Misses Satchmo, c'est Lysandre Champagne (voix, trompette), Yvan Belleau (sax et clarinettes), Blanche Baillargeon (contrebasse), Marton Maderspach (batterie) et Jeff Moseley (guitare).

Dans le plus grand secret, le groupe a trimé toute l’année sur un projet tout particulier: un premier album en français! L'idée de reprendre le fabuleux Boris Vian s'est imposée à nous tout naturellement. On est bien fiers du résultat et on a préparé un beau spectacle bien éclaté pour vous le présenter.

Cependant:

La vie du musicien moderne étant ce qu'elle est, l'argent se fait rare pour financer les productions d'album. Nous l'avons déjà entre les mains, tout beau tout chaud, et on en est bien fiers, mais il est venu avec sa petite dette bien à lui que nous aimerions bien voir fondre comme neige au soleil avant son lancement. 

Donc!

Prêtez l'oreille à ces extraits:

https://blanchebaillargeon1.bandcamp.com/album/vian-dans-les-dents-extraits

Puis contribuez selon vos capacités: en gros il s'agit d'acheter le disque en prévente... ça nous aidera grandement. Évidemment, tout don, aussi gigantesque soit-il, sera bienvenu! 

Immense merci! 

De la part de tout le groupe.

story:
What This Is About

Hello, I'm Cody!

 To put it simply, I make music inspired by my experiences digging in the trenches of the heart and soul with the Father, Son and Spirit. I've been singing all my life, and started writing songs at a young age.  I fell head-over-heels in love with a musician about six years ago, we had two beautiful kids (with one on the way), and now we feel is the time to dive into the process of recording my songs - because we're insane!

This campaign will allow us to record and publish songs that I've been writing and cultivating for years. This music has lifted me out of my darkest times, and I believe it can do the same for anyone who hears it. Partnering with us means you are helping create an album that is meaningful, powerful, and crafted with excellence.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $12,000 to cover the cost of hiring musicians, studio time, producing, mixing, and publishing the album. We realize this seems lofty, but if we're doing this, we're doing it right!

Each contribution will receive perks such as an EARLY DIGITAL DOWNLOAD of the album, HANDWRITTEN LYRICS of one of the songs, a PERSONALIZED SONG ABOUT YOU, and more awesome stuff!

If the full amount doesn't come in (but it will, because it has to), all funds will still be used for creating the album or an EP of selected songs and fulfilling perks.

The Impact

When you give toward this project, you are investing in a dream to bring hope, freedom, and truth through every lyric and melody coming out of this record. What amazes me about these songs is that I hadn't the slightest idea what they would mean to me at the time they were written. Some of them are declarative, vertical praise overflowing from heart of gratitude, others are straight from the dialogue that takes place when you start to question why you believe in a God who seems like He couldn't care less. They are real, raw, and honest. I can look back and see how I was interceding for my own heart, as well as the hearts of others, while feeling completely numb to the love that continued to carry me. I have tried to keep these songs to myself and I can't any more. They are begging to be released on the world, and YOU can help them make the greatest impact possible.

Risks & Challenges

Here's where it gets real:

I am a stay-at-home mom, and my husband runs his own business. This project will not get all our attention every day. HOWEVER, we are committed to making this happen, and our spare time will be focused on arranging songs, consulting with a  producer, and practicing, practicing, practicing! Once the funding goal is reached we will be able to work with musicians and smooth out every detail before recording. We want this music in your ears as soon as possible!

Other Ways You Can Help

While we definitely need money (duh) we also need to get the word out! Share, share, share this project on social media and utilize the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
If you are someone who would like to have our new album, be in an upcoming music video, or tell us which songs to cover (each donor also receives Blue Lane stickers and their name in the album liner notes)- consider preordering our album, among other assorted Blue Lane novelties, here to help fund our recording and tour expenses <3

Friends- getting from the mountains to the ocean and back will be tough. But! With a bit of help from you we hope to bring our new album over to our pals on the coast in-person (after sharing with you here at home of course). 

To do so we need some help covering costs on the front end, so that we have some left in our pockets to eat on tour and possibly pay for a group surf lesson during which we can finally get the chance to hug a shark. Our goal is $500, as anything will help to lighten the financial load up front, though expenses will certainly amount to more; if you are feeling generous, thank you dearly for making a donation in exchange for sweet prizes, and of course even if you cannot contribute monetarily we still greatly appreciate the love and support!

story:
As supporters of my work you are contributing to the gross capital of happiness in the world.

The total estimate for production is 4.000€. That includes the estimated cost for the studio, mixing, a producer, the band, printing, and digital design. 

I am very lucky to be backed up this year by the wonderful musicians of Die Libellen. http://www.dielibellen.de/

Jan Wien, Oliver Glück, and Christian Schober have been so supportive of my music, I can't say enough about them. They are excellent musicians that I'm very lucky to have met.

I had a really good feeling while recording at Highline Ton Studio in Gronsdorf last year, so of course I'm attacking that vintage Neumann microphone and Franz Erl's precise and steady head again this year.

http://www.highline-tonstudio.de/

Inge Landmann, at Studio Ping Pong in Westend, was absolutely perfect when she designed the album sleeve for my EP last summer. Her work was flawless and beautiful and I am so excited to see what she does this time around.

http://studio-pingpong.de/

 

As for the music..

My new LP, Tiny Little Prisons, features 8 new songs I wrote in the spring and summer of 2017, and a few old original songs re-recorded. In contrast to my original EP, Short Stories, this album is more grit and dirt. Long live rock and roll and hard learned lessons.

It's not a secret that my vocal range changed after an operation in 2014. I never enjoyed my singing voice before then, but now I can sing a few steps deeper and it's got power to it. I want to put a lot of time into the vocals for this album, made possible with more studio hours.

...

I'm not a person that asks for help easily, I'm stubborn like a mule, but I understand that now is the time to ask. Anything you can spare to help me create my life's work is deeply appreciated. I will give my everything to create an album for you to enjoy listening to. 

Thank you so much for considering support. 

Big love, Amanda Marie

story:
Join the Christmas Party!

Hello, I’m Rocky Paterra. I’m a NYC-based songwriter recording an album of original holiday music featuring a different artist singing every track that I’ve written.

We’ve been recording and making this thing since January. I’m working with some amazing producers, musicians, and vocalists to bring my festive musical visions to life!

What I Need In My Stocking

I’d love your help to make this happen. Here’s a list (check it twice!) of what I’m hoping for:

  • I’m trying to crowdfund $2,500 to help support my time in the recording studio, compensate my collaborators, and get my album the marketing and promotion that it deserves.
  • In addition to festive ‘thank you’ messages and holiday cards and song covers, my perks include merch such as pins and polaroids, exclusive demo files of my songs pre-production, an opportunity to hear yourself on the album, and the opportunity for a songwriting session with me!
  • This campaign is flex funding, so even if I don’t make my goal, I can keep what we raise. And it will indeed be put to use!

Jingling All The Way

This album is going to happen no matter what! And your contributions will help it so much towards becoming the fully realized version of what’s been in my head for many months:

  • The holiday season keeps on giving. This project can be something that more and more people can enjoy every year!
  • Making my last album was an incredible journey, and I’m coming into this project even more focused and prepared.
  • I have made a commitment to myself that this album is top priority, and I have been recording regularly since the very beginning of the year. 

The Naughty And The Nice

Coordinating schedules and availability on such a collaborative project can be difficult. I’m working tirelessly to stay one step ahead. 

  • Booking studio time and paying for promotion/distribution is expensive. Hype can be a hefty sum in marketing world. 
  • I plan on making a few music videos for the album and planning for special aspects like some vinyls and various merch items, but the main priority from a financial standpoint is getting the album recorded and promoted.
  • I have been working steadily throughout the year to plan ahead for the expenses that accompany an album release.

Please Do Put A Penny In The Old Man’s Hat

Times are hard. Money is tight. I get it! If you can’t donate, here’s what you can do:

  • Share this campaign on your social medias. Share the link on Facebook. Email some people you know that love the holidays!
  • Get the word out to those who might be able to donate to independent artists/musicians!
  • Hook me up with some connections that might be able to help in any way towards making this album experience all that it can be!

Thank you all SO MUCH and STAY FESTIVE!

story:
Bakgrund samt vinyl-, cd- och dikttryck

Jag heter Rickard Eklund. Frontman och låtskrivare i dialektrockbandet Schlagwerk och nu även soloartist. Detta år släpps det efterlängtade studioalbumet "1. (ätt)".

Hösten 2016 släpptes låten Finland, en låt om utanförskap och fördomar, som blev röstad till årets finlandssvenska låt. Samma år belönades jag även med första plats i Solveig von Schoultz dikttävling. 2017 fortsatte framgångarna med låtarna Tuva, Adrian och Sömntåg, vilka alla har mottagits positivt. Arbetet med detta album har varit långt och rigoröst. Låtarna på det kommande albumet, som bla. har jämförts med musik av storheter som The Band, Tom Waits och Billy Joel, kommer att innehålla trumpeter, tuba, cello, eufonium, trombon, trummor, piano, flöjt och sång på Närpesdialekt. Min förhoppning, och målet med projektet, är att tillsammans lyckas finansiera ett tryck på 250 vinylskivor och 500 cd-skivor.  

 

Ok! Låter bra, men vad får vi ut av det här?

Detta kan knappast förklaras enklare än så här:

  • Ni har den unika möjligheten att reservera era egna exemplar av albumet i antingen digitalt, LP och/eller cd-format.
  • Det finns även specialförmåner med att beställa från denna sida
    • Billigare
    • Unika erbjudanden såsom dikttryck och personliga tack tryckta i LP-fodralet
  • Ni får fungera som en aktiv och viktig del i processen. 

Kom ihåg att inga vinylskivor trycks, om inte målet på 3100 € uppfylls.

 

Men hur?

På denna sida hittar ni bilder på omslaget, där det t.ex. står "Dubbel-LP + nerladdning 25 €" eller "CD-album 20 €". Om ni trycker på dessa bilder, öppnar det en ny sida där man kan skriva in kontokortsuppgifter. 

Ni kan även trycka på "Back it", om ni vill donera en valfri summa.

 

Mer detaljer, tack!

Crowdfunding (som detta heter) är inget nytt, utan har använts av många artister före mig. Jag anser detta vara ett tryggt och säkert sätt för både artist och kund. Jag behöver inte trycka något i onödan och ni kan få en produkt som ni kan känna er delaktig i.

För att få igång skivtrycket behövs 3100 € , vilket kommer att ske via Mobineko. Tryck och leverans sker i Nederländerna och tar ca. 4-6 veckor före slutprodukten levereras hem till er med ett handskrivet tackbrev från mig personligen.

250 LP-skivor och 500 cd-skivor kommer att tryckas. Efter detta säljs de resterande skivorna via utvalda affärer i Finland, Sverige och i webbutik.

Jag hoppas innerligen och verkligen, att ni vågar och vill vara med i finansieringen av detta unika musikprojekt!

 

Tusen tack för er tid!

story:
SINCE PRODUCTION IS NOW COMPLETE, YOU ARE 100% GUARANTEED TO RECEIVE ANY PERK THAT YOU CHOOSE! 
 

CLICK EACH PERK BOX TO SEE WHAT ALL IS INCLUDED INSIDE!

It's your final few days to pre-order and get the album a week early before it is released!

Check out the new single / video "The Mess We've Made" - released this week!

The long awaited follow up album to Sin Shake Sin's 2014 album "Lunatics and Slaves" will be released on March 6th 2020.   What started as a personal project of producer/songwriter Stacy Hogan, has now surpassed 30 Million streams, been featured in multiple movies + TV Shows including "Vampire Diaries" and Netflix's "Little Evil" , reached #5 on Billboard's Most Added Rock Radio Charts,  featured in rotation on Sirius/XM Octane, chosen as the pick of the week on multiple nationally syndicated FM programs including Lou Brutus's Hard Drive and L.A Lloyd's Top 30 Countdown... all of this while being unsigned.   

  • Now, it is time for chapter 2. 
    So many ask.. "What took so long?"  Just after the 1st album came out, I became a father.  My daughter was born extremely premature (weighing 1 pound 15 ounces)..and the next year was full of hell for her including eye surgeries, a hole in her heart, multiple blood transfusions, and more..  Fast forward to 2020, and I have a perfectly healthy amazingly intelligent 4 year old daughter who already knows the words to many of these songs which I can't wait to share with you!
     
  • This campaign is important because this is how it all started.   The 1st album was funded this way.   Now, with your early contributions, I can not only bring you consistent official music videos for the project, but offer new merch never before available - (The new record on  180 GRAM colored VINYL, etc..!)   The new album is already recorded.  Now, it's time to package, print, and deliver.. then, promote, tour, and spread this music as far as I can.  That's where your contributions help the most!

Fast Release - after your contribution!

Unlike many "crowd-funding" scenarios, this project is moving forward no matter what.  I've set the lowest possible funding goal allowed by IndieGogo simply as a way to personally involve you all in this new album and assure all who contribute that they will receive all the perks they choose.

Rather than a simple -pre-order, you can earn perks like :​   

  •  early digital download of the album (one full week before the March 6 release to the public)
  •  a signed colored Vinyl of the new album.
  •  meet and greets at future shows
  •  your name in the CD artwork/credits. (Early Perk only!)
  •  your likeness included in the CD artwork. (Early Perk only!)
  •  be a featured extra in our upcoming music video (Early Perk only!)
  •  personal chat or interview on Skype
  •  receive actual studio gear used during the recording of both albums
  •  own the sheep mask used in the "Lunatics and Slaves" artwork + "Idiocracy" video
  •  first look at song previews, lyrics, and artwork.
  •  personalized shout outs on socials!
  • and much more.

    Plus...  every $1000 milestone reached, I'll upload a video of me in the studio and share with you a new exclusive clip of an unreleased song from album.

The Impact

The message is loud and clear.   This is another concept album from start to finish.   Regardless where you side politically, you must know there are systematic powers in place whose sole job is to create division.   This is nothing new.   This corruption effects our daily lives more than you know.    A huge percentage of local news outlets are now owned by one corporation who feed slanted scripts to affect your opinion while you are waiting on tonight's lottery numbers.   The memes shared millions of times...  all created by a company as propaganda so that you feel love towards one side and hate towards another.   This division is highly profitable for a select few.   They use your fear.  They use your religion.  They use pure falsehoods.... all to make us label and hate our fellow countrymen.   Those who profit from this just happen to be the ones who skillfully lobby and pay our politicians to bend things in their favor, not ours... not the citizens.  We must stop taking the low hanging fruit.  We are smarter than that.   Let's work together so that these songs are no longer relevant in any administration. 

Risks & Challenges

None!  -  The products will be delivered no matter what level of funding is achieved. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help this very moment:

  • Just getting the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • sign up free to join the SSS Army at www.sinshakesin.com
  • Share daily on all of your socials - until your friends can't help but wonder what the hell you are so excited about.    SERIOUSLY!  Spreading your LOVE for this project and shouting it from the rooftops is BEYOND helpful and appreciated.  These are free, quick, and easy ways to contribute.   It won't go unnoticed.

Contribute today... and let's begin this new chapter of Sin Shake Sin together.
story_txt:
SINCE PRODUCTION IS NOW COMPLETE, YOU ARE 100% GUARANTEED TO RECEIVE ANY PERK THAT YOU CHOOSE!  
CLICK EACH PERK BOX TO SEE WHAT ALL IS INCLUDED INSIDE!It's your final few days to pre-order and get the album a week early before it is released!
Check out the new single / video "The Mess We've Made" - released this week!
The long awaited follow up album to Sin Shake Sin's 2014 album "Lunatics and Slaves" will be released on March 6th 2020.   What started as a personal project of producer/songwriter Stacy Hogan, has now surpassed 30 Million streams, been featured in multiple movies + TV Shows including "Vampire Diaries" and Netflix's "Little Evil" , reached #5 on Billboard's Most Added Rock Radio Charts,  featured in rotation on Sirius/XM Octane, chosen as the pick of the week on multiple nationally syndicated FM programs including Lou Brutus's Hard Drive and L.A Lloyd's Top 30 Countdown... all of this while being unsigned.   

Now, it is time for chapter 2. So many ask.. "What took so long?"  Just after the 1st album came out, I became a father.  My daughter was born extremely premature (weighing 1 pound 15 ounces)..and the next year was full of hell for her including eye surgeries, a hole in her heart, multiple blood transfusions, and more..  Fast forward to 2020, and I have a perfectly healthy amazingly intelligent 4 year old daughter who already knows the words to many of these songs which I can't wait to share with you! 
This campaign is important because this is how it all started.   The 1st album was funded this way.   Now, with your early contributions, I can not only bring you consistent official music videos for the project, but offer new merch never before available - (The new record on  180 GRAM colored VINYL, etc..!)   The new album is already recorded.  Now, it's time to package, print, and deliver.. then, promote, tour, and spread this music as far as I can.  That's where your contributions help the most!


Fast Release - after your contribution!
Unlike many "crowd-funding" scenarios, this project is moving forward no matter what.  I've set the lowest possible funding goal allowed by IndieGogo simply as a way to personally involve you all in this new album and assure all who contribute that they will receive all the perks they choose.
Rather than a simple -pre-order, you can earn perks like :​   

 early digital download of the album (one full week before the March 6 release to the public)
 a signed colored Vinyl of the new album.
 meet and greets at future shows
 your name in the CD artwork/credits. (Early Perk only!)

story:
Years ago, a friend told me a metaphor that has stuck with me ever since.  It goes like this: everything in life is either an anchor or a balloon.  Anchors can keep you grounded, humble, calm, and safe; but when they become too heavy, they can be burdensome, weigh you down, and make you feel stuck and unable to continue your journey.  On the other hand, balloons lift your spirits, bring you self-worth, and make you feel joy and even ecstasy; but when they get too full of air, they can give you hubris and bloat your ego until the point that you soar into the sun and get burned up like Icarus.  This is the inspiration for my third studio album, ANCHORS AND BALLOONS. 

       This album is all about dichotomies: the juxtaposition between light and darkness, hope and despair, love and loss, the cerebral and the emotional, gratitude and yearning, holy and profane, tradition and innovation, memory and dreaming for the future, longing to be heard and remembering to listen.  ANCHORS AND BALLOONS will contain 13 songs, some of them re-imaginations of liturgical gems that have been inspired by my studies in Cantorial school, as well songs that come straight from my imagination and my heart.

    My last album, ONE, was released almost three years ago.  Since then, I have worked on producing records for over a dozen Jewish artists from around the country, helping them to realize their creative visions.  Now, I humbly ask for your help to allow me to achieve my creative vision with this project.  For those of you who supported the creation of my last album, ONE, several years ago, I hope you will continue to join me on my artistic journey.  And for those of you who have come into my life more recently, I would be eternally grateful for your support as well.

    Reading the news lately breaks my heart.  Every week seems to bring more bloodshed and injustice.  But as maestro Leonard Bernstein once said, “This will be our reply to violence: to make music, more intensely, more beautifully, more devotedly than ever before.”  This music is the best way I know how to respond to this broken world.

Sincerely, 

Josh
