story:
I’m Maya Law, a songwriter and solo artist based in Norwich. For the past four years, I’ve been working on and refining the sound that this forthcoming concept EP will convey; ‘Hitchhiking’ will begin acoustic, an homage to where I began, and throughout the five tracks will progressively become full band tunes. The idea - to show where I’ve come from and where I’m heading; but I need your help on my way!

 

In 2016, I released my debut album ‘Her or Him’ and went on to tour around the UK, playing to crowds at the Roundhouse and supporting the likes of Loyle Carner and Connie Constance. This campaign will be the pivotal moment for me as an artist that I’ve been waiting for. With your help, I’ll be able to follow on from these achievements and take more steps forward than ever before. 

 

My goal is to raise £1500. This money will be going towards the budget of vinyl pressing, merchandise, and pushing this EP to a wider audience by transforming my solo performance into a band set up. Your backing will allow me to work with GearBox Records to press vinyls and work closely with jazz artist and vinyl cutting expert Caspar Sutton-Jones to create the experience I intended the audience to have when listening on a hard copy. 

 

In return for your kind donations, you’ll get an exclusive invitation to a private party in Norwich where you’ll be able to hear the EP on vinyl before anyone else gets to and enjoy a line up of Norwich DJs! Exciting stuff!

 

With your help, I’ll be able to give justice to the music and all the wonderful people who have been supporting me and working so hard around me thus far. I’ve been pretty quiet since the release of my debut album back in 2016 and now it’s time for more content, more music, and more steps forward. This can only happen with your help! Any size donations that you guys feel comfortable with will push me towards my goal!

 

Please donate what you can and share this all over!

 

Cheers, 

Maya x

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hi, I'm Rosco Levee and have been a musician all my life since starting playing guitar at 5 years old. I've been the lead singer, guitarist and song-writer in my own band, Rosco Levee & The Southern Slide for the last 5 years and it's been one hell of a ride, with 2 critically acclaimed albums under our belt plus a live album, headlining festivals and with worldwide radio play and a great fan base and following. Anyway, for one reason and another, we've put the Southern Slide on the shelf for a year and I'm  gonna be concentrating on my own album which takes my own blend of psychedelic blues infused rock n roll and push it further and explore some great new ideas and sounds.... 

This campaign is massively important to me because without it, I would be unable to fund the 'SOUL-ROLLER' album. I have poured every single penny I possess into being the player and song-writer I am today and yet... it still ain't quite enough y'know? Everything I have gets re-invested into the music and although it pains me to say it, I kinda need a helping hand to get this album (which I think is some of my best work yet!) out to you. I'm pretty fired up and excited about this Album and once you hear the sounds, I'm certain you will be too.... Pre-production is well underway, the band are rehearsing and the songs are sounding fresh and taking on a life of their own! 
Those of you that have heard or watched the Southern Slide will know I like a big fat, round, vibey, vintage kinda sound and this new record will be no different in that, so don’t be scared because I’m not gonna change too much from that!  I intend to use a different group of musicians, some you will have heard before on previous RLSS albums and some guys completely new to you. I’ve got a full horn section coming down to help capture some of the brass sounds in my head, these will be the same guys from the last RLSS album so we know they are world class! Add to that a few choice girl backing singers willing to lend their harmonies and energy...  we really are gonna be creating that big band sound on some of these tracks. I’m inviting a few more guest players down and I fully intend to replicate that Phil Spector 'wall of sound' production kinda vibe, so multiple instruments all playing at the same time on one track! 

At heart, I’m a live playing musician, so this album will be recorded 'live' in the studio, by the core musicians and the only overdubs will be added for solos where needed, but I really like to get the raw grooves down as best as possible first without a load of computer trickery, so the studio I propose to use is a fantastic, bespoke vintage kind of place way out in the country so we can really focus. 

There will be a video diary most days of recording which we’ll put up here so you can see and hear what goes on and find out how we’re coming along and what goes into making a record! 

As much as I believe this is gonna be a proper modern day rock n roll record, I haven’t forgotten my roots in the Blues music I so dearly love so I’m planning on recording one of the more 'traditional' blues songs I've written. I’ve been re-visiting some of my early demos in the run up to this album, and I’m really pleased I did. Again like my previous work, this album will be a fairly eclectic mix of songs and sounds, something for everyone. This is from my soul to yours and I’m so excited to have you guys along with me and being part of it all together. I gotta get these songs out there, you people have gotta hear them....and if you dont like it, (sorry no refunds) well I’m sorry.....but we all know you're gonna fucking love it and just wait until we play it live!! 

I’m looking to raise £4000 and this will be split between studio and  production costs, paying the professional musicians and the actual manufacture of the record. I want you to know that EVERY penny raised by this campaign will go into getting 'Soul-Roller' out to you good, good people, that really is my focus and so as well as the usual perks like the album, T-shirts, and signed posters, lyric sheets etc. I’m gonna be offering some very special and exclusive items when we launch the campaign AND adding others during the 40 days we’ve given ourselves! These include a Fender Telecaster body from a guitar I loved, now long retired. I have photos of myself playing her before I stripped her for different parts. She’s white, beaten up, but she would look great on someone’s music room wall and is a piece of my history! I’m also offering a day in the studio with myself and the band, this is one of my favourite perks as the lucky person that grabs it, will get a unique look into the work and effort that go into making a record these days, we'll have a lot of fun, and who knows, you may even get to lay down a part if you can play, or if you add some kind of idea, you could end up with a producer credit!! Either way it’ll be a lot of fun. There are exclusive house concerts on offer and if you club together with some friends, I’ll even come and perform in your garden or your local pub! There’s access all areas passes for our shows, hand written lyric sheets, producer credits and all sorts up for grabs so take a look and see if there's something you'd like!
SOUL-ROLLER is is NOT a generic, run of the mill, safe or polite album; it’s a rock n roll shin-dig captured in time, souped up with a super-charger of cosmic, swirling gusto, top musicianship and limitless imagination. It’s gonna make you wanna dance and move your hips like a crazy loon on a hill – there’ll be no rhythmic foot tapping here, you’re gonna stomp a hole through the bloody wooden floorboards! Whatever happens, however much money we raise.... SOUL-ROLLER is coming so get on-board, spread the word, share like crazy and let’s make it happen! 

Stay frosty – Rosco.

story:
Project Summary:

Here's a few things about us and what we hope to accomplish with the fundraiser:

  • We are Cosmogram, a five member post-hardcore funk band hailing from Riverside, California. We started back in late 2014 as a few friends who got together just to jam and play some good music. Soon after our formation however, we realized that music was our collective passion and that this was something we would all love to do for a living.
  • We started playing shows in the winter of 2015 and have continuously brought in larger and larger crowds who enjoy and generally relate to our music. It is our hope that we can continue to do that for a very, very long time.
  • We self-produced and released a 5 track EP back in 2015 and have since gone on to write several more songs. It is our hope that this fundraiser will help raise enough money for us to see those songs professionally produced and released.

What We Need & What You Get:

What we need:

  • While the band members are all working tirelessly to raise funds for studio time and post processing, we can only do so much in such a short matter of time. So that's where you guys come in. We're asking for any bit of money you can donate in order to help us accomplish what we've dreamed of our entire lives.
  • All funds raised with this campaign go directly towards studio time, recording, producing, mixing, and mastering. Funds raised will also go towards printing hard copies of the EP, as well as merchandising and promotion.
What you get:
  • Sometimes it's difficult to really express how amazing our fans make us feel, and how much you all mean to us. We'd like to take a moment and thank every single one of you who has supported us in this journey so far. Whether it was a simple "good luck" to us the day before a show, buying or downloading our first EP, coming to support us during one of our live shows, or even following us on social media, your support means everything to us and we wouldn't have come this far without you all. Now, onto the perks!! 
  • Anyone who donates $5 or more will receive a digital download of the EP FOR FREE!
  • Anyone who donates $10 or more will receive a hard copy of the EP signed by all of us. Maybe we'll even write a cool story for you on the inside of the cover!
  • And finally, anyone who donates at all will have their name put on the EP's Bandcamp, as well as having it printed on the inside of the hard copies. 

The Impact

So why should you contribute?

  • For one, you'd be helping a few up and coming musicians continue doing what they love. We aren't in this for the money, nor are we in it for the fame. We genuinely just love playing music for people and putting on a great show. 
  • This EP will mark a new chapter in our lives as a band. With the release of this EP, we hope to gain even more momentum and maybe even grab the attention of local labels and venues.
  • Once again we'd like to thank every one of you. We wouldn't even be making this campaign if it wasn't for your continued support and encouragement. Even if this is something that never really takes off or gets us to the big time, we certainly won't forget what a wild ride it's been up to this point. In just a year, something we had all once only dreamed about has become a reality, and we couldn't be more grateful for such an amazing time in our lives.

Risks & Challenges

So what are the challenges?

  • Well, first and foremost is raising enough funds in order to do this in a timely manner. Right now, we sit at a pivotal point for the band. This is our make it our break it moment. It's our now or never. We're more popular than we've ever been, and we want to do something with that momentum while we still have it.
  • We understand that funding a band that says "they're going to make it big one day" is a huge risk on your part. It's possible that we won't be able to raise the funds in time to record and release this EP. But hopefully, we can show people how dedicated and motivated we are to make this a reality. We hope you can see that and will help us make it to where we want to one day be.

Other Ways You Can Help

What if I want to support you guys, but just don't have the funds to do it?

  • We understand not everyone has the funds to hand out money, and that's okay, we get it! But we aren't asking for much. Even a $1 donation means a lot to us. It doesn't have to be a lot. We just ask that you give whatever you can.
  • If you choose not to donate, however, we ask that you at least give us a chance and check us out on social media. You can find us on the following sites:
  • Here's our Youtube if you wanna check out recordings of us playing shows: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpN0ZJHLBQJDVUspPRmcWMQ
  • Here's our Facebook if you want to give us a "like" and keep up with the band: https://www.facebook.com/cosmogramofficial/
  • Here's our Bandcamp if you'd like to check out our first EP: https://cosmogram.bandcamp.com/releases
  • Here's our Instagram if you'd like a look at what goes on behind the scenes of Cosmogram: https://www.instagram.com/cosmogram_official/
Thank you all again for checking out this fundraiser, and for your continued support. Our fans, friends and family are the best and none of this would even be remotely possible if it weren't for all of you. Our Cosmofam is amazing and we wouldn't trade it for anything in the world.

Project Summary: Here's a few things about us and what we hope to accomplish with the fundraiser:


We are Cosmogram, a five member post-hardcore funk band hailing from Riverside, California. We started back in late 2014 as a few friends who got together just to jam and play some good music. Soon after our formation however, we realized that music was our collective passion and that this was something we would all love to do for a living.
We started playing shows in the winter of 2015 and have continuously brought in larger and larger crowds who enjoy and generally relate to our music. It is our hope that we can continue to do that for a very, very long time.
We self-produced and released a 5 track EP back in 2015 and have since gone on to write several more songs. It is our hope that this fundraiser will help raise enough money for us to see those songs professionally produced and released.
   What We Need & What You Get: What we need:


While the band members are all working tirelessly to raise funds for studio time and post processing, we can only do so much in such a short matter of time. So that's where you guys come in. We're asking for any bit of money you can donate in order to help us accomplish what we've dreamed of our entire lives.
All funds raised with this campaign go directly towards studio time, recording, producing, mixing, and mastering. Funds raised will also go towards printing hard copies of the EP, as well as merchandising and promotion.

What you get:

Sometimes it's difficult to really express how amazing our fans make us feel, and how much you all mean to us. We'd like to take a moment and thank every single one of you who has supported us in this journey so far. Whether it was a simple "good luck" to us the day before a show, buying or downloading our first EP, coming to support us during one of our live shows, or even following us on social media, your support means everything to us and we wouldn't have come this far without you all. If you choose not to donate, however, we ask that you at least give us a chance and check us out on social media. You can find us on the following sites:
Here's our Youtube if you wanna check out recordings of us playing shows: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpN0ZJHLBQJDVUspPRmcWMQ

Here's our Facebook if you want to give us a "like" and keep up with the band: https://www.facebook.com/cosmogramofficial/

Here's our Bandcamp if you'd like to check out our first EP: https://cosmogram.bandcamp.com/releases

Here's our Instagram if you'd like a look at what goes on behind the scenes of Cosmogram: https://www.instagram.com/cosmogram_official/

story:
BONJOUR À TOUS!

Je me nomme Ariane-Zita Pouliot-Castonguay et je suis une chanteuse, compositeure et auteure professionnelle mais non-connue. Bien que vous ne me replaciez pas pentoute, je gagne ma vie uniquement en vivant de mon art. Parmi les aspects de mon art figurent entre autre plusieurs tournées dans plus de quatre pays du globe, composition de musique pour film, publicité, théâtre, participations à des festivals de renommée internationale... n'est-ce pas là le rêve de plusieurs artistes?

Si je fais appel à vous aujourd'hui, c'est car bien que j'aie derrière moi un bon bagage professionnel et un bon lot d'expériences tout aussi dynamiques qu'enrichissantes, il y a quelque chose qui me manque vraiment: payer pour travailler. 


Lorsque j'ai appris que notre Annie Villeneuve nationale cherchait à financer son album (la pauvre n'a probablement pas obtenu de subventions pour mettre au monde son 5e opus, car elles sont toutes allouées à de jeunes artistes de la relève qui désirent colorer le paysage musical provincial et fédéral), et que je pouvais l'aider en lui versant 350$ pour qu'elle puisse me faire l'honneur d'avoir le droit de déposer ma voix sur ses mélodies à l'eau de rose: je n'ai pas su comment résister. 

Je suis consciente qu'à moins d'être au même calibre que Mme. Villeneuve (être invitée à Belle & Bum dès que je pète une note de musique), le métier de musicienne n'en est pas vraiment un. Certes, chanter n'est pas travailler, ce n'est que divertissant loisir et nous savons que divertissement ne devrait pas rimer avec rémunération. Bien sûr, je suis une vocaliste professionnelle, et certains diront que je devrais laisser la chance aux autres (pour une fois). À ceux-là je réponds que ce n'est pas parce que j'ai déjà partagé une loge avec Luc de Larochellière que je ne peux pas moi aussi tenter MA chance. 

Aidez-moi à réaliser le rêve d'une vie!

Mille mercis,

Votre futur choriste-vedette,

Ariane Zita

Ps: Si Annie ne veut pas de moi sur son album (j'imagine qu'il y en a de meilleur(e)s que moi parmi les plus offrants), je réinvestirai chacune de vos cennes sur mon propre prochain mini-album qui devrait paraître en mai. Étant donné que le temps des fêtes arrive, je ferai un don à un organisme de charité. Vos suggestions sont les bienvenues!

story:
Summary

My name is William Peacock (a.k.a. Tony), a Mississippi-born composer who finished his ungraduated degree at Belhaven University under Dr. Andrew Mark Sauerwein and currently resides in Indiana, finishing his Master’s degree in Music Composition at Butler University under Dr. Frank Felice and Dr. Michael Schelle.

I recently applied for and was accepted to take part in the Composition Workshop of the Charlotte New Music Festival. The CNMF is a two-week celebration of new music held at various locations across Charlotte, North Carolina, partnering with many fine ensembles and living composers to make new music across the city. The Composition Workshop is held during the festival and includes:

- Two professional performances of your music:

1) A commissioned work written for the festival.

2) A speedwriting assignment, written and performed during the festival.

- Opportunity to work with guest musicians in rehearsing your music.

- High-quality audio and video recording of the performances.

- Option to perform an additional piece on our “New Music Open Mic Night.”

- Lectures by eminent guest composers and musicians.

- Two private lessons with guest composers.

- Admission to all festival concerts.

- Making new friends and being part of a supportive artistic community.

- New professional headshot photos for portfolio/website use.

While everything above is wonderful, especially the lessons with the composers and rubbing shoulders with fellow artists, I’m most excited about working with the professional musicians. I have been asked to write for Erin Rodgers (saxophone) and Jay Sorce (classical and electric guitar) of the HYPERCUBE ensemble, creating a new piece to be premiered during the festival. I will also be participating in a speed-writing assignment (creating a new piece in a matter of days) during the festival for performance by the Beo String Quartet.

Quality recordings of performances by professional musicians are almost priceless for emerging composers like myself. And receiving the feedback and instruction of these and the other two ensembles (the Red Clay Saxophone Quartet and the flute duo Duo Zonda) about writing for their instruments is similarly valuable. Last summer, I attended Zae Munn’s Summer Composition Intensive at St. Mary’s College in South Bend Indiana, where I received advice from Dr. Courtney Miller, the guest oboist. She told me that music that looks boring on the page can sound incredible in the hands of a performer, and that tidbit of wisdom has significantly altered my composing for the better.

What We Need & What You Get

While I would, ideally, love to fund opportunities like this myself, I need your help to take part in the Composer’s Workshop. The total cost, including tuition for the Workshop, housing, meals, and travel, is roughly $2800.

What I will be covering from this total is housing (at UNC Charlotte with a room mate) during the Festival ($600), meals ($200), travel ($100), and the less tangible lack of an income for two weeks.

Ideally, my wife and I would like to raise $2000 to cover the tuition for the Workshop ($1885), taxes, and the cost of using IndyGoGo’s platform. If we do not meet that goal (and do not experience a sudden windfall during the campaign), your contributions will be kept separate from our general finances as a down payment on the next professional development opportunity. Perks (see below) will, if at all possible, be fulfilled regardless of the outcome.  

Perks for Donating

Sarah (my lovely wife) and I would like to offer you rewards for certain amounts of donations; incentives and “thank you’s” for giving. Those are...

-$5+ A Sincere, Handwritten Thank-You Card

Sincerely expressed gratitude for your contribution, and, most likely, some doodling in the margins. Like all good artists do. Every contribution matters!

MUSIC:

-$15+ Score of Guitar and Saxophone Duet for Erin and Jay of HYPERCUBE

You'll receive a signed, well-engraved score of the work I'm currently composing for Erin and Jay for the Festival, as well as a link to its performance.

-$15+ Score of String Quartet Music for Beo String Quartet

You'll receive a signed, well-engraved score of the work I'll be speed-writing during the festival for the Beo String Quartet, as well as a link to its performance.

-$25+ BOTH Scores!

You'll receive BOTH the above scores, signed and with links to their performances! Double the music, double the fun!

-$300+ New Music Written for You!

Commission me! I will write a new piece of music for you, featuring 1-3 instruments, 3-7 minutes in length, and I will arrange its performance! You'll receive a well-engraved score bearing your name (or whoever you'd would like to dedicate the piece to) below the piece's title and receive a digital copy of its performance.

(These will be completed and performed during 2018 and 2019. Instrumental preferences, the use of text(s), etc., we will sort out together beforehand.)

CLICK HERE to see more examples of my work.

ARTWORK BY SARAH (MY LOVELY WIFE):

4x6 Ink and Paper Drawings:

Produced as a part of Inktober 2017 (making a new piece every day during October), each work is framed, titled, and signed by Sarah:

-$25+ Circuit Flowers

 

-$25+ Closed Circuits

 

-$25+ Commerce

 

-$25+ Community

 

-$25+ Cords & Chords

 

-$25+ Current Growth

 

-$25+ Energy Cells

 

-$25+ Energy Mirrored

 

-$25+ Fall

 

-$25+ Flow

 

-$25+ Fractured

 

-$25+ Fuses

 

-$25+ Gates

 

-$25+ Home

 

-$25+ Sacred City

 

-$25+ Structured Harmony

 

-$25+ Wired Unity

 

-$25+ Wires & Veins

 

Paintings from the Community (Little Paintings) series:

Statement from the Artist about these works - "Community is a series of 'little paintings' arranged and framed together either by likeness of difference. This process was done over several months, and over seventy 'little paintings' were created, as an exploration of the intangible nature of community."

-$100+ Wind and Flowers

 

-$200+ Back Around Again

 

-$200+ Catching the Light

 

-$200+ Relational

 

-$250+ Three Associations

 

All works will ship for FREE!

 

The Impact

I Corinthians 13:12 (OEB) – As we yet see, in a mirror, dimly, but then – face to face! As yet my knowledge is incomplete, but then I will know in full, as I have been fully known.

My compositions most often explore the mysterious nature of the Divine, as well as the goodness, truth, and beauty that flow out from God. Sarah and I left our familiar lives in Mississippi and paid for further education in Indiana because we value that exploration and its impact on our lives, and we desire to faithfully share that same exploration and impact with others. The CNMF's Composition Workshop is a further step in developing the professional acumen to "let [my] light shine before men," and your assistance in this endeavor would be greatly appreciated!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please use the links on this page to share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc., and help spread the word! And if you have other ideas for unique ways you'd like to help, please message me, as I'd like to hear them.

Thank you!

story:
WHO IS IT?

We are Von Wildenhaus from Seattle, WA. In the early-mid ‘10s in NYC, I released mostly instrumental records and cassettes as Ben von Wildenhaus and Ben von Wildenhaus with Professional Band. After moving to the Puget Sound I reconnected with my favorite musicians and weirdos from Bellingham, Jon Sampson (saxophone, piano, guitars), Andru Creature (suitcase kit), and Aaron Harmonson (bass, synths). Where the east coast professional band’s sound was crisp, studio, muso, and elegant, the northwest band developed an organic burble, fluid and breathing, burping, dreaming, and sometimes screaming in sleep. Everything changed when the vocalist and performer Amanda Bloom, another creature of Bellingham’s haunts, joined us. We focused on writing songs with Amanda. It was pop noir, broken machinery, pink sunsets, heavy vibes, and life in psychotic litewaves.

 

WHAT IS IT?

The first six songs we wrote are big ones – life, death, apocalypse, love, and the epic sadness of a walmart parking lot. Each is a fine brew of melody, feeling, and vibe aged in the late hours of dark Seattle bars. We began recording slowly, track by track, at Aaron’s house off Aurora Ave in winter. Amanda stood in the cold wood room and bared their soul. We added new noises to these organic recordings, and kept adding and subtracting until each was done.

Doug Krebs (another Bellingham specter) mastered the record. Two paintings by Matthew F Fisher adorn the front and back of the vinyl jacket. An original metal logo by Christopher Baird states the name. We almost called it:

EASY LISTENING FOR DEMONS

but we want you to know the songs are meant to bring you hope and love so we call it:

EVERYTHING IN FLOWER

 

WHY ARE YOU HERE?

We, the fine people of Von Wildenhaus, humbly ask you, our fan, our friend, our colleague, to help put EVERYTHING IN FLOWER on quality virgin black vinyl. Yes, it will live on the internet most likely until society crumbles. But these 6 songs, 2 sprawling sides, should be held in the hand, the cover art considered, the needle slowly wearing the grooves until it plays like a conversation with an old friend. We want you to love it, not just hear it. This is how we express our love to you. And, in the end, when the data centers in the deserts of northern California are nothing but dead architecture, the guts salvaged and the doors wide open, we want this Von Wildenhaus record to remain as an artifact, its melodies and words, though distorted with time and translation, played to the children and family around a modest bonfire of Ikea furniture and plastic bottles. Can you please help us realize our dream?

 

HOW MUCH?

We would like to press 500 copies of EVERYTHING IN FLOWER and only enough T-shirts to fulfill this pre-order.  Remaining copies of the album will fund our touring efforts in the US and Europe.

 

WHAT ARE THE SONGS?

  1. WORKING ON MY NOVEL

Sample lyric: “A grown man on a child’s bike…”

Sample chord change: D° | Fm | Dm | G

Fun fact: Every August across the great northwest region of the US, forest fires smog the skies for hundreds of miles, creating unsafe air and making the sky turn bright pink.

 

  1. DRONES

Sample lyric: “Your dick, your chest, your neck, your head / Are lying in the middle of the bed.”

Sample chord change: C| Ab|F| E

Fun fact: “Zenana” is Palestinian slang for Israeli drones. It is an onomatopoeia that describes the omnipresent buzzing sound in the skies over Gaza, as well as a dismissive term for a nagging wife.

 

  1. FLOWERS

Sample lyric: “The dawn breaks / prepares a bloom / its perfume / is your blood.”

Sample chord change: C|C/Ab|F6|Asus4A

Fun fact: We wrote this song for a Northwest Film Forum grant (which we ultimately lost to Zen Mother) to live score a famous Mexican film that rhymes with “Spicoli fountain.”

 

  1. SUMMER’S DREAM

Sample lyric: “Take my hand / if I could never dance again / you could never see me fall.”

Sample chord change: Bb|F#maj7|Bb|F#maj7|C#maj7| B|Bbsus4|Bb

Fun Fact: It turns out, when you spend hours learning a melodic phrase backwards on the sax so you can record it, reverse it, and layer on top of the regular melody, the results are underwhelming and hardly worth the effort. A recording of a saxophone played backwards sounds nearly indistinguishable from the instrument being played forward.

 

  1. FAREWELL

Sample lyric: “You are the morning sun / you are the shepherd’s spring / you are the sound of rain on wheat.”

Sample chord change: Cm|F|Bb|G7

Fun fact: The chorus of this song borrows a translated line from the song Isırgan Otu by the famous Kurdish Alevi singer and songwriter Kıvırcık Ali.

 

  1. LOW GREY

Sample lyric: “The sirens in red / awash in low grey / and the feet falling slow in a walmart parade.”

Sample chord change:C| Gm| F|C#|Fm

Fun fact: We are ultimately all alone in this world.
story_txt:
WHO IS IT?
We are Von Wildenhaus from Seattle, WA. In the early-mid ‘10s in NYC, I released mostly instrumental records and cassettes as Ben von Wildenhaus and Ben von Wildenhaus with Professional Band. After moving to the Puget Sound I reconnected with my favorite musicians and weirdos from Bellingham, Jon Sampson (saxophone, piano, guitars), Andru Creature (suitcase kit), and Aaron Harmonson (bass, synths). Where the east coast professional band’s sound was crisp, studio, muso, and elegant, the northwest band developed an organic burble, fluid and breathing, burping, dreaming, and sometimes screaming in sleep. Everything changed when the vocalist and performer Amanda Bloom, another creature of Bellingham’s haunts, joined us. We focused on writing songs with Amanda. It was pop noir, broken machinery, pink sunsets, heavy vibes, and life in psychotic litewaves.
 
WHAT IS IT?
The first six songs we wrote are big ones – life, death, apocalypse, love, and the epic sadness of a walmart parking lot. Each is a fine brew of melody, feeling, and vibe aged in the late hours of dark Seattle bars. We began recording slowly, track by track, at Aaron’s house off Aurora Ave in winter. Amanda stood in the cold wood room and bared their soul. We added new noises to these organic recordings, and kept adding and subtracting until each was done.
Doug Krebs (another Bellingham specter) mastered the record. Two paintings by Matthew F Fisher adorn the front and back of the vinyl jacket. An original metal logo by Christopher Baird states the name. We almost called it:
EASY LISTENING FOR DEMONS
but we want you to know the songs are meant to bring you hope and love so we call it:
EVERYTHING IN FLOWER
 
WHY ARE YOU HERE?
We, the fine people of Von Wildenhaus, humbly ask you, our fan, our friend, our colleague, to help put EVERYTHING IN FLOWER on quality virgin black vinyl. Yes, it will live on the internet most likely until society crumbles. But these 6 songs, 2 sprawling sides, should be held in the hand, the cover art considered, the needle slowly wearing the grooves until it plays like a conversation with an old friend. We want you to love it, not just hear it. This is how we express our love to you. And, in the end, when the data centers in the deserts of northern California are nothing but dead architecture, the guts salvaged and the doors wide open, we want this Von Wildenhaus record to remain as an artifact, its melodies and words, though distorted with time and translation, played to the children and family around a modest bonfire of Ikea furniture and plastic bottles. Can you please help us realize our dream?
 
HOW MUCH?
We would like to press 500 copies of EVERYTHING IN FLOWER and only enough T-shirts to fulfill this pre-order.  Remaining copies of the album will fund our touring efforts in the US and Europe.
 
WHAT ARE THE SONGS?
WORKING ON MY NOVEL
Sample lyric: “A grown man on a child’s bike…”
Sample chord change: D° | Fm | Dm | G
Fun fact: Every August across the great northwest region of the US, forest fires smog the skies for hundreds of miles, creating unsafe air and making the sky turn bright pink.
 
DRONES
Sample lyric: “Your dick, your chest, your neck, your head / Are lying in the middle of the bed.”
Sample chord change: C| Ab|F| E
Fun fact: “Zenana” is Palestinian slang for Israeli drones. It is an onomatopoeia that describes the omnipresent buzzing sound in the skies over Gaza, as well as a dismissive term for a nagging wife.
 
FLOWERS
Sample lyric: “The dawn breaks / prepares a bloom / its perfume / is your blood.”
Sample chord change: C|C/Ab|F6|Asus4A
Fun fact: We wrote this song for a Northwest Film Forum grant (which we ultimately lost to Zen Mother) to live score a famous Mexican film that rhymes with “Spicoli fountain.”
 
SUMMER’S DREAM
Sample lyric: “Take my hand / if I could never dance again / you could never see me fall.”
Sample chord change: Bb|F#maj7|Bb|F#maj7|C#maj7| B|Bbsus4|Bb
Fun Fact: It turns out, when you spend hours learning a melodic phrase backwards on the sax so you can record it, reverse it, and layer on top of the regular melody, the results are underwhelming and hardly worth the effort. A recording of a saxophone played backwards sounds nearly indistinguishable from the instrument being played forward.
 
FAREWELL
Sample lyric: “You are the morning sun / you are the shepherd’s spring / you are the sound of rain on wheat.”
Sample chord change: Cm|F|Bb|G7
Fun fact: The chorus of this song borrows a translated line from the song Isırgan Otu by the famous Kurdish Alevi singer and songwriter Kıvırcık Ali.
 
LOW GREY
Sample lyric: “The sirens in red / awash in low grey / and the feet falling slow in a walmart parade.”

story:
A nine-piece, foot-stomping, beer-swilling, raucous and rowdy band from Sydney Australia, The Bottlers are releasing their first ever full-length folk punk album: Advance Australia Fear.

Tearing jigs and reels, and expansive ballads, intertwined with roaring chords and choruses forged from Australian bush poems and convict tales, the sound of The Bottlers hearkens to the past to bring forth a high-energy, all-acoustic modern folk sound.

Advance Australia Fear: A full-length, high-energy flagship album of one of Folk Punk's finest emerging bands.

"G'day!

We're bloody excited.

After quite a time touring across Australia we've had many a sing, swig and a sway with a heap of other fine folk and musical friends. Be it DIY punk gigs, epic metal shows, pub storming sets or the home spun grandeur of folk festivals we've drawn it all together for this auspicious musical occasion.

This album - Advance Australia Fear - is chocka block full of music that has been forged, honed and hurtled to live audiences from all walks of life from all around the country. We've cultivated an album that captures our high-impact, energetic live music in high-fidelity studio quality. 

We're stoked that this album is so very close to send home to all of you, wherever you hail from!"

 

Pre-order the album. Snag sweet merch packs & Indiegogo exclusive experiences. Fast-track the release. Get it a month early!

We've put in the hard yards already via the capable hands of our good mate Daniel Natoli from one of Sydney's finest recording facilities - A Sharp Recording Studios. We honestly feel we've captured every last drop of all the blood, sweat and beers that we and our music has to offer.

Recording a great album isn't cheap. All contributions will be going towards fast-tracking all the final touches of mixing, mastering and distributing the album. Not only that, but through pre-ordering your album and getting your hands on a bunch of merchandise, you will be offsetting our studio recording costs, helping us to get back on the road and playing in your neck of the trek as soon as possible. 
 

Show us the swag!

Anyone who pre-orders Advance Australia Fear will get it 4 weeks early before it is distributed.

For our album CD pre-order perk and above, all contributors get the album shipped directly to you 4 weeks before the album is distributed to the public. That's our little way of saying "You legend!".

We have a number of great merch packs available, including CDs, vinyl, t-shirts, bottle opener keyrings, buttons, patches, stubby holders and posters. 

Got merch already? No worries, we've got you covered.

Some perks include a 'Secret Show' ticket. At a cheeky little venue in the heart of Sydney, a VIP gig with The Bottlers, acoustic performancesand who maybe a musical mate or two.

"Carrrrn! I want MORE!"

You sound parched. 
Lets head along to Australian Brewery - an amazing place where Aussie legends make legendary brews. To celebrate our album we are brewing our top secret, brand new collaboration beer and we are having you along to experience it all!

Experience first hand our beer being brewed, get a tour of the whole brewery and we'll down a few along the way as well as play a few tunes.

Last but not least, we have a top-tier perk for those with a party idea of their own: The Bottlers play your house party! You hold the shindig, we'll bring the noise and the brews. 


Pass the bottle 'round!

Know anyone who might be keen to get amongst it for a bit of pre-order action? Tell your mates, tell your neighbours, spruik it down the local!

story:
What The Projects About

Collaborations Volume 2 is the second album where i've weaved around the world and selected some of my favourite musicians/humans that I've either had the pleasure of playing with before or i've been inspired by them.

I take each artist or group the skeleton of one song to do what they want with it. The idea of the project is to do as much of it live and all together as possible. There are exceptions though if it's just not possible or someone has an idea after the session that they feel they need to include then i'd never stop them!

Collaborations Volume 1 was made in 2016 across the UK with 34 musicians and It's taken 3 years in between many tours with different projects to finish the next 9 songs for Collaborations Volume 2 with 38 musicians this time from New Orleans, Los Angeles, Brighton, Bristol & Rabastens-Couffouleux! I just need some help to get it out there finally!

The List of Songs/Musicians

Thanks - Jackson Lynch, Sam Doores, Nickybob Shoulders, Cameron Snyder.

In A While - Shaye Cohn, Nathan Wolman, Tomas Majerski, Alejo Majerski, Sarah Weinstein, Coleman Akin, Aaron Gunn, Moses Nelligan

Doux Rêves - Ophelie Luminati, Bots Leonard, Quentin Bardi, Nicolas Laroza, Pierre Jean Mecri

Sleep - Lewis Fitzjohn

Moving - Kassia Zermon, Jules Arthur, Lee Westwood

Time - Craig Flory, Carver Baronda, Gina Leslie, Chelsea Moosekian, Eric Robertson, Dave Hammer, Camille Weatherford, Max Bien Kahn

We'll Never Know - Daniel Truen

Game Of Love - Casey Jane Reece-Kaigler, Zachary Thomas, Bill Howard, George Aschmann

Sigh In My Heart - Patrick Morrison, Brandon  Armstrong, Carlos Reynoso, Charles De Castro, Justin Rubenstein

I'll be doing the Artwork myself with the help of Lewis Fitzjohn.

What You Get

A choice between a download of the album, a CD, Vinyl, Online Singing Lesson (as i'm all over the place it's usually difficult to arrange in person) a Personalised song (Only condition is that we'd chat before i make it about what subject or occasion you'd like it for)  2 Tickets to one of the launch gigs and i have a limited amount solo concerts available if you'd like me to play in your venue/home/wherever (Uk prefereably but as long as its somewhere in Europe and ill find a way to weave it into a tour to save on expenses).

What We Need

 =£5023 (Fees/Mastering & PR are Estimates)

If i raise anything more than the target then i'll put some more into PR to spread the word about the project properly & (if they'll let me) give the musicians some money for the time they've given me already for free!?!?

The Impact

You'll be helping me to continue connecting musicians that i love together from all over the world. Also to push people i trust out of their comfort zones and into fresh, stress free recording sessions. Then helping me tour my original music around the world with different groups at each concert. (which i also record and upload to soundcloud)

I've successfully crowdfunded for 3 albums before this one, each one I'm more proud to share and I'm so grateful to everybody that's supported me over the years.

Risks & Challenges

The Hardest part is already done! I have the stems and a few people interested in Mixing it and the companies i trust to make the cds and & vinyls for me again so I'm confident i can make this happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to pre order something to help with the project right now but want to help then sharing it on social media or emailing people the link that you think might be interested would still make a big difference!

Thankyou so much in advance for helping however you can! x

story:
Hello! 

Our names are Lily and Evan and Alex and John, and together we’re a band called Long Neck. Nice to meet you! If you’re here, you’ve probably seen us play or heard our music or maybe just like Googling different body parts/adjectives. That’s weird of you, but we’re not here to judge—we’re here to ask for some help. 

For the last five years, we’ve been playing music and touring and recording albums. For the last two and a half years, we’ve done so under a record label. We put out our first album as a full-band (called Will This Do?) in January of 2018, and people seemed to like it! From the touring (and merch-slinging) we did on that record we were able to put together some money and go back to the studio to record another batch of songs with our wonderful producer Tom Beaujour. We got them mixed and mastered and then sent them to our label and got set to release them as a new record in the spring of 2020. 

Pretty proud of ourselves—both for how the songs came out and for the fact that we raised the money ourselves by playing an insane amount of shows (which we mostly booked ourselves)—we sat back and looked forward to our impending release date. But then, in the fall of 2019, something happened. We don’t want to rehash anything here, but the upshot is that we found ourselves left with few other options than releasing our new album independently. So that's what we decided to do.

The only obstacle that stood in our way was the fact that our old label had already pressed 500 copies of the new record. After some negotiating, we worked out an agreement to go our separate ways and purchase back the pressed records at cost. Unfortunately, that many records costs a lot of money—money that none of us have individually. And so, we come to you—friends, fans, folks who Google body parts—to ask you to help us cover the production cost and give this record the last extra push it needs to get out into the world. What does that mean? It’s pretty simple: this fundraiser is essentially an early pre-order for the fully completed, fully pressed new Long Neck record: World’s Strongest Dog, which officially comes out April 10, 2020. Hooray! 

WORLD’S STRONGEST DOG

In the two years since Will This Do?, we’ve done a lot. We’ve played shows in more than 40 of the 50 states (plus Canada!), toured with some incredible bands (gobbinjr, Field Mouse, and Adult Mom, to name a few), and grown in leaps and bounds as musicians and as people. World’s Strongest Dog is the culmination of that growth. 

It’s an album about learning to accept yourself, holding yourself accountable, and leaving behind bad habits. It’s about realizing that you’re always still growing and that there isn’t any endpoint you’re supposed to reach. It’s about fearing the unknown and finding the strength to explore it. And, at the risk of tooting our own horns (guitars? whatever), the record is chock-full of our most explosive and musically adept playing to date.

But don’t just take our word for it! Here’s what She Shreds magazine’s Cynthia Schemmer had to say: “[Songwriter Lily Mastrodimos] meditates on the last two years of her life—from friendships and romance, to getting older and changing habits—to craft an elegant reflection of self that poses maturity and awareness, along with an evident evolution in both lyrics and musicianship.” 

And here’s what our producer, Tom, had to say: “It sounds fucking sick, dude!” 

And here’s what Lily had to say: “I think we did an alright job!”

And if none of that's enough to convince you, take a listen for yourself to the album's first single, "Campfire":

 

WHAT DO I GET? AND WHERE’S THE MONEY GOING? 

As we said earlier, this fundraiser is basically pre-order for World’s Strongest Dog. That means that the cost of the perks is what we’d charge at the merch table—plus a few exclusive items we’ll get to later. The money we raise is going to a few things: 

500 Records: $1,814.50

Test Pressing/Deposit: $549.25

Imprint Jackets/Inserts: $720

Packaging: $175 

Design Work: $100

Platform Fees: $400

This brings us to $3,758.75. The remaining $241.25 will go toward things like gas (to go pick up the records from the presser in D.C.) and the upfront cost for manufacturing some of our perks. 

Speaking of perks, we have a few fundraiser exclusives that we’re excited to offer: 

-Items like pins and custom World’s Strongest Dog trophies that will only be offered through this campaign

-A nice spaghetti dinner (we cook for you!)

-A private live performance of World’s Strongest Dog PLUS a secret bonus set in which we will “Roll The Dice” (which will mean something to you if you’ve ever seen us at a house show. Otherwise it will remain a secret until you pony up, player—we promise it’s worth it!)

-Lily writes a song for you! 

-Go birdwatching with us (or just Lily, since she’s the only one in the band who's a member of the NJ Audubon Society)!

WHAT IF WE DON’T HIT OUR GOAL? 

If we don’t hit our goal, you’ll still get your rewards when the album is released. Like we said, the records have already been pressed and we’re excited for the world to hear them! Fortunately, IndieGoGo allows you to collect whatever you do raise if you fall short of your goal—we’ll just be eating a lot of rice and beans for a while/maybe forever if we don’t make it. So if you’re wary about Long Neck’s ability to make money, you have a lot in common with our families/the record industry in general. But also you have nothing to worry about. 

WHAT IF WE HIT OUR GOAL? 

First off, we’ll be thrilled! It means so much to us all that so many people have supported our music in so many different ways—whether it’s coming to shows or buying records or just not shutting off the algorithmically generated playlist when “Mine/Yours” comes on. If we do hit our goal any additional money raised will go toward the things money always goes toward in a band: paying for the van rental for the next tour, the cost of recording the eventual next album, and maybe staying in a motel or two on the road at some point (AKA the dream). 

Thanks for listening! 

Long Neck

AND WHERE’S THE MONEY GOING? As we said earlier, this fundraiser is basically pre-order for World’s Strongest Dog. That means that the cost of the perks is what we’d charge at the merch table—plus a few exclusive items we’ll get to later. The money we raise is going to a few things: 500 Records: $1,814.50Test Pressing/Deposit: $549.25Imprint Jackets/Inserts: $720Packaging: $175 Design Work: $100Platform Fees: $400This brings us to $3,758.75. The remaining $241.25 will go toward things like gas (to go pick up the records from the presser in D.C.) and the upfront cost for manufacturing some of our perks. Speaking of perks, we have a few fundraiser exclusives that we’re excited to offer: -Items like pins and custom World’s Strongest Dog trophies that will only be offered through this campaign-A nice spaghetti dinner (we cook for you!)-A private live performance of World’s Strongest Dog PLUS a secret bonus set in which we will “Roll The Dice” (which will mean something to you if you’ve ever seen us at a house show. Otherwise it will remain a secret until you pony up, player—we promise it’s worth it!)-Lily writes a song for you! -Go birdwatching with us (or just Lily, since she’s the only one in the band who's a member of the NJ Audubon Society)!WHAT IF WE DON’T HIT OUR GOAL? If we don’t hit our goal, you’ll still get your rewards when the album is released. Like we said, the records have already been pressed and we’re excited for the world to hear them! Fortunately, IndieGoGo allows you to collect whatever you do raise if you fall short of your goal—we’ll just be eating a lot of rice and beans for a while/maybe forever if we don’t make it. So if you’re wary about Long Neck’s ability to make money, you have a lot in common with our families/the record industry in general. But also you have nothing to worry about. WHAT IF WE HIT OUR GOAL? First off, we’ll be thrilled! It means so much to us all that so many people have supported our music in so many different ways—whether it’s coming to shows or buying records or just not shutting off the algorithmically generated playlist when “Mine/Yours” comes on. If we do hit our goal any additional money raised will go toward the things money always goes toward in a band: paying for the van rental for the next tour, the cost of recording the eventual next album, and maybe staying in a motel or two on the road at some point (AKA the dream). Thanks for listening! Long Neck

story:
WOODEN ELEPHANT records RADIOHEAD

We are Wooden Elephant and we make totally acoustic versions of classic electronic-based albums.

Aside from the musical material, our acoustic version of Kid A owes itself to Radiohead in another way: Wooden Elephant violist/composer Ian Anderson regularly works with the London Contemporary Orchestra, and from 2014 we collaborated with Jonny Greenwood in a series of projects which culminated in a tour of Europe with Jonny’s string music, and our subsequent appearance on Radiohead’s latest album, A Moon Shaped Pool. Along the way I got to witness Jonny’s constant experimentation with string techniques, some of which — such as detuned strings and Pacay bean shakers — made it into our version of Kid A. But it was more his overall mindset of always asking “but what happens if you do this?”, and “what happens if you hit it with that?”, which really had a big impact on the way that I approach composition and arrangements in general.

THE PLAN

We are asking for your help to fund the recording of our acoustic version of Kid A, for release on Berlin-based label, Backlash Records. We developed our version of Kid A in 2018, and since then have been tweaking and perfecting it. We now feel that we are ready to commit it to record, for release on Kid A's 20th anniversary next October.

We have scheduled our 5-day recording session for 14-18 January 2020, but in order to go ahead with it we need to raise a certain amount of money. We have already raised funding to cover the fees of our amazing recording engineer and producer, Johann Günther, but we still need to raise money to cover studio hire, travel, accommodation, and a short behind-the-scenes video to document the process.

If we do not manage to reach our entire goal then we will have to cancel the short film, which will be a real shame as it will help enormously with marketing and promotion. But we need to be realistic and we will be incredibly grateful for any help at all.

There are a range of perks you can choose which range from £5 digital downloads of an exclusive recording not available to the general public, through pieces of equipment that we use during the Kid A recording sessions, right up to one-on-one lessons with members of Wooden Elephant! But you are also very welcome to donate without selecting any perk, save for the reward of the warm glow which accompanies a good deed well done.

RISKS & CHALLANGES

There are many risks associated with recording and releasing any album, and when you're releasing your own acoustic contemporary classical take on one of the all-time great alternative-rock albums, that is certainly no different! People who know and love Kid A will have their own personal connections and associations with the album, favourite songs, and possibly very strong-held views on what is acceptable to do with the music (we speak as five of these very people!). One of the hardest things we will need to get across to our listeners is our total love and respect for this amazing music. Our intention has never been to 'mess' with the music, but to present it in the totally different (and we hope fascinating) context of the classical music live performance tradition, adapted very specifically for our particular set of instruments.

And then there's the unforgiving nature of the recording studio...! Every little mistake is audible under the microphones, so we will all need to be on the top of our game for the entire 5-day recording period. We have performed Kid A together enough times, and we will make sure that individually we can play our parts perfectly. It will be exhausting and at times infuriating, but ultimately exhilarating and a total honour to bring to our own unique take one of the great albums of all time.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

We totally understand if you are a fan of Kid A or Wooden Elephant (or both) and would like to help but are not in a position to spare any money (believe us – as freelance musicians we have all been there many many times!!). Fear not! You can help spread the word about our project by sharing this crowdfunding campaign on social media, or doing it the old-fashioned way of talking to a real human who might also be interested. We appreciate all forms of help and support :)

story:
Hi everybody!  Some of you may know me from my time with the band Chicago and currently with Don Felder (formerly of the Eagles).  I’ve been super blessed to play with some of the greats in the business and I’ve met some amazing people along the way.  I love what I do! Music has enriched my life since the first time I ever picked up an instrument.

     I’m really excited to share with you my 4th and latest solo album This Time Around.

For many of us, this pandemic has been a game changer and a life changer.  It's forced us all to live a little differently than we are used to.  I, for one, have missed performing in front of live audiences.  We all love to do it so much!   But I have also been given the time to write and record the kind of record I would want to hear.   The kind of record I would buy and tell all my friends about.  There is light at the end of this dark tunnel and into that light, I bring you ... new music!  I'm also thrilled to be working together again with Rex Schnelle, who worked with me on my last record Origins.  The record is sounding incredible and I cannot wait to share this full length album of 12 brand new songs with all of you.

The music industry has changed dramatically.  Record labels used to sign you to a big record advance, pay for the record, videos and marketing.  Not to mention the radio campaign and tour support.  All of this is extremely expensive, and now it's all on the artist’s shoulders.  This can be a very large mountain to climb!  

This is why I want to invite you to come along with me on this new adventure of music and exploration.  Feel free to take a look around and check out the perks and packages here on this page.  You'll see that there are several excellent ways for you to help make this all happen.

  • Be the first to hear the new record before anyone else with your Pre-Order 
  • Grab a CD Bundle
  • Grab a Personally Signed Lyric Sheet
  • Get a Signed Set List from a show
  • Let's do a Zoom Call
  • Opt for the Cover Song Video Request
  • It's all about the Private House Concert for you and your friends


​I can't thank you enough for taking the time to stop by this page and check out the campaign for my new record This Time Around.  Do me a huge favor and tell all your friends about it.  Help me make some noise about this campaign.  Feel free to use the Indiegogo Share Tool right here on this page.

Thanks very much

Jeff

story:
Short Summary

Kissing Candice is a masked nu-metal/industrial band based out of New York with members from all around the United States! We released our first full length album through Victory Records and followed up with an EP through Stay Sick Recordings. However, we have decided to go back to our DIY roots and handle everything for our next full length on our own. This album is entirely funded by ourselves and the fans. It will be a true reflection of who we are and what we want to create, not affected by ANY outside sources! We have no label, no management, no team. Just 5 masked madmen trying to put out the best album they possibly can!

However, as you may be aware. Being in an underground band doesn't make you rich by any means. We all work hard to do this and invest most of our time and money into this band to make music for you that we love. Unfortunately, this means we can't possibly fund this album totally on our own (unless we don't eat!). This is a project of passion, and this album will be no different. Since recording and releasing an album is VERY expensive, we would love the help of our devoted fan base who has supported us over our last 7 years as a band! Everyone who contributes to this project will receive very col perks and our eternal gratitude!

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what we need the money for:

  1. Studio time, production, recording, mixing, and mastering (will be done by Zach Jones, who has done all of our music since the single Taken).
  2. Album artwork
  3. Album Distribution
  4. PR campaign
  5. Advertisement
  6. Many other small things

Here are just some of the things you can get by contributing:

  1. Thanked in the liner notes
  2. A copy of the album
  3. Custom airbrushed guitars
  4. Guest vocals from Joey or Dreamer
  5. Skype lessons/calls with Grip or Pak
  6. THE ULTIMATE PERK! COME SPEND A WEEKEND IN THE STUDIO WITH US AND DO EVERYTHING WE DO!

The Impact

Kissing Candice is a hard working band. Whenever we are not touring, we are writing and working on the band, interacting with all of you, and maintaining full time jobs so we can continue to do this! Your money will help us achieve our goal of putting out a FULL album completely independent of the music industry. We are all the weirdos in this world, and we want to show everyone who WE are!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand things happen and times can be hard. If you still want to help out, please share this Indiegogo campaign across your social media, tell your friends about it, or hand out flyers!

Thank you all so much for your time, contributions, and support!

WE ARE A FAMILY!

story:
The Album

Sycamore as a band has been playing together for almost a decade, and has slowly but surely learned more and more about music and songwriting over that time. Over the past year, we've been able to bring our songs to another level by recruiting Noreen Lardizabal and Karwai Kwok, two of the best musicians we know. Check out our Soundcloud page for our latest release, S.O.S. ---> https://soundcloud.com/sycamoreworship/sos


We are launching our first full album in Summer 2018, but we need your help to get it over the finish line. The songs were born as early as 2016 and contain stories ranging from heartbreak to dance break, battle cries to soul cries. This album is us sharing our lives as an honest depiction of the modern Christian walk.

This is an all-or-nothing campaign which means that if we aren’t able to reach the goal, we won’t be able to complete the album.

Who are Sycamore?

Sycamore is a Mississauga-based jazz rock fusion band (that's a mouthful) with a purpose of pointing people to the Gospel.

The name Sycamore comes from Luke 19 where a man named Zaccheus wanted to see the passing Jesus, but was blocked by the huge crowd of people. He got creative by climbing a Sycamore tree and ended up hosting Jesus at his home that night.

While we used to write exclusively worship songs, this album also contains songs that are personal pleas, introspection focused, as well as those meant for a congregation.

But in all of them, the purpose is the same. Just like how the Sycamore tree helped Zaccheus see Jesus, we want our music to do the same.

Your Contribution

  • Every dollar of the $2500 goal goes directly to studio and production costs
  • The album is being recorded and produced at the Juno Award-winning Howl Studio in Oakville, Ontario

We understand that everyone has different ways through which they can contribute and we want to include your input as much as possible! Backers at different levels can gain access to:

  • Vote on the Album Title – We will be listening to suggestions about the album name from all campaign backers!
  • An Early Listening Party – We are hosting an exclusive early listening party before the mastering phase of production. This is where we’ll all put our ears to the tracks and have a discussion to hear your thoughts!
  • Your Name in the Album Art – Gold Contributors will be specially thanked in the album art!
  • Your Voice on the Album – Be a part of the Sycamore Choir and add your voice to the music!

Perks

To thank you for supporting and believing in us, every backer will receive a handwritten Thank You note! You'll also have the opportunity to receive:

  • Signed CDs & digital downloads
  • Tickets to Launch Concert
  • SYC swag
  • A private Sycamore concert

If you have questions about the Perks, or if what you're looking for isn't listed, contact us and we'll be happy to try to meet your request! SycamoreWorship@outlook.com

Spread the Word

If you think our cause is worthwhile, or if you want to tell others you're helping out with a huge artistic project, spread the word about our campaign! Whether it's to your friends, families, colleagues, churches or fellowships, it will be awesome to see how far we can take these songs together.

But Most Importantly...

None of this will be possible without your love and prayers!

Thanks to each and every one of you,

Sycamore

 

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

Can I support with cash?

YES! If you know us in person, you can support us by giving cash to Jared Tan, Matthew Wong or Noreen Lardizabal. You will receive the respective Perk and we are keeping track of all cash payments to make sure you get what you pay for.

Can I buy Launch Concert Tickets or a T-Shirt on its own?

We are currently working on a store where you'll be able to buy individual items. If you get them through the campaign there is a discount such as the 20% off Early Bird price!

Is there an option for Pick-up instead of paying for shipping?

Unfortunately Indiegogo lists prices by Country so we have to charge for shipping up front. BUT we are keeping a record of shipping costs so that we can refund shipping to all backers who end up picking up their Perks!

story:
The Quick & Dirty...

My name is Chris Stark and I'm a musician and songwriter from Hawaii. I have just finished recording, mixing, and mastering my third full-length album Kosmos XX. If you can help me reach my funding goal, I will be making the album available on physical CD in addition to the planned digital release.

PLEASE NOTE!!!

Indiegogo doesn't make it super obvious, but if you click on any of the "perks" listed in the right hand margin, the little boxes expand to show you a detailed list of what is included in each perk. It's not super obvious, so sorry in advance for any confusion!

My Story...

I am a multi-instrumentalist, but my focus is the guitar. Over the years I've played in a wide variety of bands and I've done session work for a variety of local musicians. I've toured Japan and several European countries as a hired musician, and I have contributed songs and guitar parts to a variety of documentaries and student films. I'm also a several time alumnus of Steve Vai's Vai Academy and Joe Satriani's G4 Experience. I eat, sleep, and breathe music.

Twenty years ago in 1998 I bought my first digital audio workstation computer and I started writing and recording my own music. By the end of 1998, I had recorded over a dozen original songs. I took my best 13 songs and called this collection Kosmos, and I burned about 50 copies of the album and I distributed those discs to friends and family. This was my first "real" album.

I've come a long way as a musician and home recording engineer in the last 20 years, and in more recent years when I would listen to "Kosmos" I couldn't help but cringe a little at the quality of that recording. I was really pushing the limits of my tools and my skills back then, and I had to cut a lot of corners because there was only so much you could do with a 450 MHz Pentium CPU and 9 GB hard drive back then.

This year I decided that in honor of the 20th anniversary of Kosmos I would re-record all of the songs using my modern gear and 20 additional years of studio knowledge. The result has been breath-taking. These songs have never sounded better and they truly deserve an official release: Kosmos XX 

Kosmos XX is a little different...

My first two released albums, Legacy and Juxtaposition are very much instrumental guitar rock albums. However, Kosmos XX is much more focused on synthesizers. The original Kosmos was my starting point into songwriting, and stylistically it's quite varied because I was still trying to find my voice, instrumentally speaking.

Even though my more recent music is very guitar-centered, on both the original Kosmos and Kosmos XX only 5 of the 13 songs have any guitar at all. My early songs have a strong world-beat influence combined with ambient electronica, but there's also a little industrial and metal influence too. Many of the songs from the original Kosmos were re-imagined into guitar songs on my 2016 album Legacy so if you happen to have that album, the song titles might be the same, but the songs are quite different. On Kosmos XX I strived to stay true to the original songs, only making minor changes. If you like Tangerine Dream, Jan Hammer, or Delerium, I think you'll enjoy Kosmos XX.

What You Get...

I've put together some perks packages, and all of them result in you getting some music that I think you'll love. Click on any of the perks for more details about what you get. Remember, even if you have no interest at all in a physical CD, your pre-order of the digital album will help me fund the CD pressing.

If I don't reach the funding goal, contributors will still get access to the digital version of the album, but if you help me meet the funding goal, I will be able to deliver Kosmos XX on CD in a 4-panel full-color eco-wallet.

Why a physical CD in this age of streaming?

I grew up in a time where vinyl LPs were the norm. Then came cassette tapes. Then came CDs. Then came the Internet and physical media started to disappear along with record stores.

I used to spend hours at a time flipping through every single CD in the "Rock" and "Metal" sections of Tower Records and Borders hoping to find some rare gem to add to my music collection. The browsing itself was part of the experience.

But another part of the music listening experience for me is the album art. Part of my listening ritual has always included admiring the album art and reading through the liner notes as I listen to the album. I would read and re-read every lyric, every songwriting credit, every thank you, every gear endorsement, and every inside joke. I miss that aspect of the listening experience with digital-only albums.

I don't think I'm alone.

I want Kosmos XX to be released on physical CD to continue this experience for myself and for others who feel the same way. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't or don't want to pre-order a copy of Kosmos XX, I would be incredibly grateful if you would share this campaign with friends or family that you think might be interested.
story_txt:
The Quick & Dirty...
My name is Chris Stark and I'm a musician and songwriter from Hawaii. I have just finished recording, mixing, and mastering my third full-length album Kosmos XX. If you can help me reach my funding goal, I will be making the album available on physical CD in addition to the planned digital release.
PLEASE NOTE!!!
Indiegogo doesn't make it super obvious, but if you click on any of the "perks" listed in the right hand margin, the little boxes expand to show you a detailed list of what is included in each perk. It's not super obvious, so sorry in advance for any confusion!

My Story...
I am a multi-instrumentalist, but my focus is the guitar. Over the years I've played in a wide variety of bands and I've done session work for a variety of local musicians. I've toured Japan and several European countries as a hired musician, and I have contributed songs and guitar parts to a variety of documentaries and student films. I'm also a several time alumnus of Steve Vai's Vai Academy and Joe Satriani's G4 Experience. I eat, sleep, and breathe music.
Twenty years ago in 1998 I bought my first digital audio workstation computer and I started writing and recording my own music. By the end of 1998, I had recorded over a dozen original songs. I took my best 13 songs and called this collection Kosmos, and I burned about 50 copies of the album and I distributed those discs to friends and family. This was my first "real" album.
I've come a long way as a musician and home recording engineer in the last 20 years, and in more recent years when I would listen to "Kosmos" I couldn't help but cringe a little at the quality of that recording. I was really pushing the limits of my tools and my skills back then, and I had to cut a lot of corners because there was only so much you could do with a 450 MHz Pentium CPU and 9 GB hard drive back then.
This year I decided that in honor of the 20th anniversary of Kosmos I would re-record all of the songs using my modern gear and 20 additional years of studio knowledge. The result has been breath-taking. These songs have never sounded better and they truly deserve an official release: Kosmos XX 

Kosmos XX is a little different...
My first two released albums, Legacy and Juxtaposition are very much instrumental guitar rock albums. However, Kosmos XX is much more focused on synthesizers. The original Kosmos was my starting point into songwriting, and stylistically it's quite varied because I was still trying to find my voice, instrumentally speaking.
Even though my more recent music is very guitar-centered, on both the original Kosmos and Kosmos XX only 5 of the 13 songs have any guitar at all. My early songs have a strong world-beat influence combined with ambient electronica, but there's also a little industrial and metal influence too. Many of the songs from the original Kosmos were re-imagined into guitar songs on my 2016 album Legacy so if you happen to have that album, the song titles might be the same, but the songs are quite different. On Kosmos XX I strived to stay true to the original songs, only making minor changes. If you like Tangerine Dream, Jan Hammer, or Delerium, I think you'll enjoy Kosmos XX.
What You Get...
I've put together some perks packages, and all of them result in you getting some music that I think you'll love. Click on any of the perks for more details about what you get. Remember, even if you have no interest at all in a physical CD, your pre-order of the digital album will help me fund the CD pressing.
If I don't reach the funding goal, contributors will still get access to the digital version of the album, but if you help me meet the funding goal, I will be able to deliver Kosmos XX on CD in a 4-panel full-color eco-wallet.

Why a physical CD in this age of streaming?
I grew up in a time where vinyl LPs were the norm. Then came cassette tapes. Then came CDs. Then came the Internet and physical media started to disappear along with record stores.
I used to spend hours at a time flipping through every single CD in the "Rock" and "Metal" sections of Tower Records and Borders hoping to find some rare gem to add to my music collection. The browsing itself was part of the experience.
But another part of the music listening experience for me is the album art. Part of my listening ritual has always included admiring the album art and reading through the liner notes as I listen to the album. I would read and re-read every lyric, every songwriting credit, every thank you, every gear endorsement, and every inside joke. I miss that aspect of the listening experience with digital-only albums.
I don't think I'm alone.
I want Kosmos XX to be released on physical CD to continue this experience for myself and for others who feel the same way. 
Other Ways You Can HelpEven if you can't or don't want to pre-order a copy of Kosmos XX, I would be incredibly grateful if you would share this campaign with friends or family that you think might be interested.

story:
What We're Doing

I'm partnering with Flourish Creative to record a six-song EP!

  • My name is Darion Ryan Roberts, and I'm a singer-songwriter from Wichita Falls, TX.
  • My wife and I moved back to our hometown almost three years ago, and we've been learning and growing -- these are a few of the songs that have come out of this season.
  • By partnering with me, you're helping me in an enormous way. It is literally impossible without you.

I believe songs have power, and songs connect people.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the rundown:

  • I need to raise $4,000 for tracking, production, mixing, mastering, distribution and a couple other cool merch items! 
  • Perks include getting the EP two-weeks early, t-shirt, even a custom song! 
  • If I don't raise all the money, I don't track all of the songs.

The Impact

The difference you'd be making by supporting me is huge.
This has been on my heart for a couple of years now, and I would take full advantage of the priveledge that comes with getting to release songs. I don't take this lightly, and will give all I have to releasing good art.

Risks & Challenges

This is honestly terrifying to me. For years I've struggled with the insecurity that comes from putting yourself out there. Music is a personal. I've always struggled with what people think about how I sing, or play. This is vulnerable. But with encouragement from those around me, I believe it's time. I'm also afraid of not raising the money. But with your help, both of these fears can be overcome.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • PLEASE share this campaign and help me get the word out!
  • Post it on social media, text or email your friends, whatever it takes!
  • Indiegogo has some cool and simple sharing tools, use them!
